U.S. Customs and Border Protection on Friday announced it will soon solicit proposals for "prototype wall structures." The agency said it will formally begin collecting proposals sometime around March 6 and expects to award contracts in mid-April.

About an hour before the announcement, President Trump said in a speech his proposed barrier is "way, way, way ahead of schedule."

Adam W. Purinton, 51, allegedly opened fire Wednesday night at a bar in Kansas after witnesses say he yelled "get out of my country."

Srinivas Kuchibhotla, 32, was killed in the shooting and his friend, Alok Madasani, 32, suffered injuries. Bar patron Ian Grillot, 24, was also shot after he tried to stop the gunman. 

The FBI has joined an investigation to determine whether the shooting was a hate crime. Kuchibhotla and Madasani are engineers at Garmin, and are originally from India.

The two intruders pulled up to the Sugary Donut shop, which was still closed at the time, and approached, apparently unaware someone was inside.

"They smashed the front window and went inside," one officer said. "The employee ends up shooting one of the suspects, killing him."

Three years after a dispute over texting in a movie theater left a man dead, a "Stand Your Ground" hearing is underway for a former Florida police captain charged with murder.

Curtis Reeves, 74, and Chad Oulson, 43, argued several times after Reeves complained about Oulson's texting. Oulson allegedly tossed a bag of popcorn at Reeves. Moments later, Reeves fired a single, fatal gunshot.

The outcome of this hearing will determine whether Reeves stands trial for second-degree murder. He also could be cleared completely.

California narrowly averted what could have been one of the worst dam disasters in state history when Oroville Dam managers were able to get enough water out of the reservoir before it flooded homes in the area.

The near-catastrophe grew out of fundamental problems with the original design of an emergency spillway that were never corrected despite questions about its adequacy, interviews and records suggest.
link_name: Government Misjudged Strength of Oroville Emergency Spillway, Records Show

An Orange County woman who said she felt like she was "put on this planet to be a mom" was devastated to learn she would be unable to have children after being diagnosed with breast cancer.

But then in the ultimate act of sisterly love, Maggie Paxton's older sister, Morgan Williams, stepped in and made the decision to become a surrogate. 

"As an older sister, I want to protect her, but I can't protect her from cancer," she said. "So I kind of just stepped up and was like, 'OK, if this is what I can do, then I will do it.'"

Last week, Paxton's dreams of motherhood came true when Williams delivered a healthy set of beautiful twin baby girls. The new mother is also cancer free now.

status_message:
In testimony during the preliminary hearing, teacher Jennifer Garcia said in the months before Gabriel Fernandez's death, she repeatedly reported to county child service workers new signs of abuse that prosecutors say came at the hands of his mother and her boyfriend. 

In one instance, Gabriel came to school with swollen eyes and a pockmarked face, she said. At first, he said he had fallen, but he then told her, "My mom shot me in the face with a BB gun," she testified.

On two occasions, she testified, a fearful Gabriel asked, "Can you call that lady?", referring to the county social worker. But as months passed, and the boy remained with his mother, Garcia said she began to lose confidence in child protective services.
link_name: Judge to Decide Soon Whether 4 Social Workers Can be Tried for Criminal Negligence in Gabriel Fernandez's Death

status_message:
Parents are searching for answers Monday after the death last week of a teacher in South Gate who had contracted meningitis. 

"I'm just worried that the school is contaminated. I want to make sure that everything is safe before I bring my kid here," said one parent who arrived at the school for a morning meeting to provide parents with further information. 

It was unclear how teacher Ramona Gedney contracted the bacteria, but officials have been giving out preventative antibiotics and information to those who had close contact with her.
link_name: Health Officials Investigate Death of LAUSD School Teacher Who Contracted Meningitis

status_message:
"The Happiest Place on Earth" just got a little bit pricier as the cost of daily tickets and annual passes increased on Sunday.

Single day tickets for value, regular and peak periods at Disneyland now run $97, $110 or $124, which is up from $95, $105 or $119.

All annual pass purchases or renewals also experienced a price bump of $10 to $20, with the the exception of the premier, signature plus and signature passports.
link_name: Disneyland Raises Prices for Daily, Annual Passes

status_message:
Residents of Oroville and nearby towns were ordered to immediately evacuate on Sunday afternoon after a "hazardous situation" developed involving an emergency spillway at the Oroville Dam.

Around 3 p.m., authorities learned that the dam's emergency spillway -- which has been in use since the primary spillway was recently damaged -- had a hole in it and was eroding, the sheriff said.

Read KTLA's full story here: http://on.ktla.com/rh0YK

On Friday El Nacional published a photo of the actor along with a caption calling him, "Donald Trump, president of the USA," whom the actor impersonates regularly on NBC's "Saturday Night Live." 

The photo accompanied a news article about Israeli settlements which also had a photo of (the actual) Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.
link_name: Dominican Newspaper Apologizes After Mistaking Alec Baldwin for President Trump

status_message:
For the first time in the 48-year history of Lake Oroville, the reservoir was so full that it triggered uncontrolled releases down an emergency spillway. 

Bloated with storm runoff, the reservoir had gone from 80% full to overflowing in less than a week when managers were forced to reduce releases on Oroville's heavily damaged concrete spillway.
link_name: Storm Runoff Brings Plenty of Water to California's Second-Largest Dam

A man was arrested on suspicion of kidnapping a teen at gunpoint, sexually assaulting her and threatening to pimp her out earlier this month. 

After driving the victim around and sexually assaulting her in a residential area, Jaisen Lacount told her he was going to be her pimp and was going to force her to "commit commercial sex acts," officials said. 

He was arrested in Lakewood where he thought he was meeting the victim to to begin working for him.

Officials have said that the arrests are routine and not part of a crackdown promised by President Donald Trump, but they have have sparked fear and anger in immigrant communities.

status_message:
"This is your parents' worst nightmare," a county DA said of 58-year-old William Thomas, a suspected serial child rapist who authorities say had a "perverse shrine" of numerous images of naked children, along with hundreds of pairs of soiled children's underwear in his home. 

At his arraignment this week on 51 charges, a district judge set the jailed suspect's bail at 10 percent of $750,000. 

"There's no guard that's going to help me here," Thomas told the judge. "I'm getting treated very awfully and I'm just scared to death."
link_name: DA: Alleged Serial Child Rapist Had 1,000 Images of Child Porn, Hundreds of Pairs of Children's Underwear in Penn. Home

status_message:
Massive amounts of water are gushing down the spillway at the country's tallest dam, Oroville Dam in Northern California. Amid an ongoing storm, Lake Oroville is 96 percent full and there's a hole in in the spillway that's hundreds of feet long.

Because of the damage, the state may have to use an emergency spillway for the first time in the dam's 48-year history. Crews are clearing nearly 100 acres of rocks and trees before the area is inundated.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/GactB

A special needs student who usually works as the Arroyo Valley High School basketball team manager got to suit up for the school's final game Monday and hit a three-point shot as time ran out. 

"I thought it would never happen â€¦ it was a dream come true," Ricardo Ruvalcaba said. "I made the shot. The whole place, the whole arena went crazy." 

Although they didn't win, the Hawks players were OK with how things ended. "A good thing happened out of a bad loss," one player said after the game.

Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials have yet to release details on how many people agents arrested Thursday, but advocates say more than 100 immigrants were taken into custody as ICE conducted home raids in Santa Paula, Oxnard, Van Nuys, Downey and San Bernardino.

Those detained were either illegal immigrants with deportation orders but no criminal background, or family members of those sought who were home during the raids and told officials they lacked documentation, according to the Coalition for Humane Immigrant Rights of Los Angeles.

Officers first noticed a car parked near the Atlanta prison fence line. The people inside wore ski masks and jumpsuits. When police approached, the suspects climbed the fence and ran back onto prison grounds, court records show.

Inside the car, officers found bottled alcohol, 24 cell phones and two loaded handguns.

Police started investigating inmates "temporarily escaping" from the medium-security US Penitentiary in 2013. Officers believe the inmates escaped through holes cut in the prison fence.
link_name: Inmates Sneaking In and Out of Federal Atlanta Prison for Years, Police Say

BREAKING: A three-judge panel of the federal appellate court in San Francisco has refused to reinstate President Trump's travel ban.

The judges rejected the administration's claim the court didn't have the necessary authority, writing: "There is no precedent to support this claimed unreviewability, which runs contrary to the fundamental structure of our constitutional democracy."
link_name: 9th Circuit Court Refuses to Reinstate President Trump's Travel Ban

Hours after he helped deliver newborn Rebecca Grace in the back of an ambulance, Myrtle Beach firefighter Marc Hadden and his wife learned the little girl was up for adoption.

"We had prayed about it for so long," he said. "We wanted to adopt because we were unable to have more kids. We always dreamed of adopting a little girl."

Five years later, "Gracie" is a beloved member of the family.

The 23-year-old was found dead Sunday afternoon on the country's Bastimentos Island. An initial autopsy suggests she was strangled, according to reports.

Eight people from Bastimentos Island have been detained in the investigation, but no charges had been filed yet, reports say.

Camryn Zelinger, 32, was arrested at Encore High School for the Arts, where she worked. The alleged "inappropriate physical contact and communications" took place over the "past few months," police said.

"If anyone ever calls us and says, 'This kid needs to go home on hospice,' there's only one name we think of," says a DCFS worker who finds placements for sick children. "He's the only one that would take a child who would possibly not make it."

Mohamed Bzeek of Azusa, a foster father for more than two decades, is the only foster parent in Los Angeles County known to take in terminally ill children.

He has buried about 10 children. Some died in his arms.
link_name: 'I Know They Are Going to Die,' Says L.A. County Foster Father Who Only Takes in Terminally Ill Children

Elijah Moore and Enrique Rios, both 17, were classmates and working at a construction training program when they vanished 25 days apart without a trace, authorities say.

California is among 15 states involved in a voluntary recall by an Illinois pet food supplier after pentobarbital, a sedative used in euthanasia, was found in cans of dog food tested after one dog died and four others were sickened.

Cans of Evanger's Hunk of Beef Au Jus dog food manufactured the week of June 6 through June 13, 2016 with lot numbers that start with 1816E03HB, 1816E04HB, 1816E06HB, 1816E07HB, and 1816E13HB, and have an expiration date of June 2020 are included in the recall issued Friday.

The company stated it had ended a 40-year relationship with the beef supplier and would be sharing all test results.
link_name: Discovery of Euthanasia Drug Prompts Dog Food Recall; California Among 15 States Involved

An Indian woman who had a live cockroach extracted from her skull at first thought she had a cold, reports say.

The 42-year-old woman woke up and felt an itchy sensation in her nasal cavity. Then she felt a "tingling, crawling sensation" around her nose and eyes.

Doctors used a nasal endoscope and were stunned when they found a full grown cockroach that crawled up the woman's nose while she was asleep and got stuck.

"It was alive. And it didn't seem to want to come out," one doctor said.
link_name: Live Cockroach Pulled Out of Woman's Skull in India After She Felt 'Crawling Sensation': Reports

status_message:
An Alaska Airlines flight attendant's instincts and quick thinking helped save a teenage victim from human trafficking on a plane headed to San Francisco, according to reports.

Shelia Frederick, 49, first thought something was off when she noticed a teenage girl with greasy blonde hair. The teen "looked like she had been through pure hell," Frederick said. 

Feeling uneasy about the situation, the 10-year flight veteran approached the duo and told the girl under her breath to go to the bathroom, where she had posted a note to the mirror.
link_name: Flight Attendant Used Secret Note to Save Teen Victim From Human Trafficking on Plane Bound for Bay Area

status_message:
A notorious apartment fire that killed seven children and three mothers, two of them pregnant, was set as retribution against a new building manager who wanted to stop rampant drug dealing there, police say.

Three of the suspects in the "mass murder" were identified by LAPD as 18th Street gang members. A fourth suspect is outstanding.

The 1993 fire, described as the deadliest arson in California history, was so fast and fierce that mothers were seen throwing babies from windows in hope their children would survive.
link_name: 3 Suspects ID'd, Will Face Charges in 'Mass Murder' in 1993 Westlake Apartment Fire That Killed 10

The New York Police Department is holding a man in connection with the killing of a 30-year-old woman who disappeared while jogging in her neighborhood last summer. 

DNA evidence links Chanel Lewis, 20, to the crime scene and victim Karina Vetrano. Her body was found by police and her father. She had been strangled and sexually assaulted.

One person died and at least four more were seriously injured after five hikers fell down an icy slope while hiking near Angeles Crest Highway outside Wrightwood, authorities say. 

A group of 10 hikers in their 50s and 60s were traversing a path called the Little Jimmy Trail at an elevation of about 7,000 feet when cold, snowy conditions caused half the party to fall down a 70-degree slope, according to a helicopter pilot.

"One missed step and then they start sliding and it's just all the way down until they hit something that stops their slide," he said. "A lot of times â€” unfortunately like today â€” it was a tree or a rock that can often prove fatal."
link_name: At Least 3 Seriously Injured Hikers Rescued, Possibly 3 More Missing After Falling Down Ice Chute Near Angeles Crest Highway

A federal appeals court early Sunday morning denied the US government's emergency request to resume President Donald Trump's travel ban.

The Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals has asked for both sides to file legal briefs before the court makes its final decision after a federal judge halted the program on Friday.

What this means is that the ruling by US District Court Judge James Robart, who suspended the ban, will remain in place -- for now.

A machete-wielding New York City homeowner fought off a masked burglar, badly injuring him during an alleged home invasion Friday before discovering that the man was his own nephew.

The 57-year-old man was waiting for a package delivery when he heard a knock on the door, police said. He opened the door and found a person wearing a mask and holding a box.

The masked man, identified as 25-year-old Kevin Henriksen, allegedly forced his way in and attempted to rob the home. The man, who hasn't been identified, fought Henriksen, attacking him with a machete. It wasn't until Henriksen's mask came off that the homeowner recognized him, police said.
link_name: Man Uses Machete to Fight Masked Burglar in Queens Before Realizing It's His Nephew: Police

"In accordance with the judge's ruling, DHS has suspended any and all actions implementing the affected sections of the Executive Order entitled, 'Protecting the Nation from Foreign Terrorist Entry into the United States.' This includes actions to suspend passenger system rules that flag travelers for operational action subject to the Executive Order," DHS acting press secretary Gillian Christensen said in a statement.

She said DHS will resume inspections of travelers as it did prior to the signing of the executive order.

A survivor of the Boston Marathon bombing plans to marry the firefighter who rescued her moments after the bombs went off.

Roseann Sdoia was watching the runners near the finish line when she was hit by shrapnel from the pressure-cooker bombs.

Firefighter Mike Materia came to her aid and went with her to the hospital. Sdoia had to have a leg amputated, but Materia followed her recovery. They started dating in June 2013, and he proposed in December.

"In the hospital, my mom tried to set me up with him," Sdoia told reporters. "She was like, 'Oh, did you see that firefighter? He's so cute.' And I was like, 'Mom, I just got blown up.'"
link_name: Boston Marathon Bombing Survivor to Marry Firefighter Who Rescued Her

A Whittier couple accused of torturing and killing a young girl they had taken from her mother, who they allegedly forced into prostitution, pleaded not guilty to the crimes Thursday, authorities say. 

Johnny Lewis Hartley, 39, and Mercy Mary Becerra, 43, face four felony counts in connection with the 2-year-old girl's death: murder, human trafficking to commit pimping/pandering, torture and assault on a child causing death. 

The two were stopped by Mexican customs agents after X-ray machines detected the girl's body in Hartley's bag as they attempted to cross into Tijuana.
link_name: Whittier Couple Found With Girl's Body in Duffel Bag Plead Not Guilty to Felony Torture, Pimping and Murder Charges

status_message:
Using stem cell technologies, researchers say they have generated human cells and human tissues in the embryos of pigs and cattle.

To grow human organs within animal bodies has long been the dream of scientists wanting to provide transplantable hearts, lungs, kidneys and other organs for patients in need.

Despite this milestone, integrating cells from human and animal species is difficult, and developing human organs remains at a considerable distance, one doctor said.
link_name: First Human-Pig Embryos Made, Then Destroyed, as Part of Research Into Transplantable Organs

President Donald Trump suggested he could be open to bringing back torture because he "absolutely" believes it works.

Trump said "people at the highest level of intelligence" have told him that torture does work, something military experts have refuted.

"When ISIS is doing things that no one has ever heard of, since medieval times, would I feel strongly about waterboarding?" Trump said Wednesday. "As far as I'm concerned, we have to fight fire with fire."

status_message:
BREAKING: Scientists have moved the "Doomsday Clock" to two and a half minutes to midnight, the closest the clock has been since 1953 -- after the first hydrogen bomb tests in the U.S. and then Soviet Union.

The group cited US President Donald Trump's "careless rhetoric" on nuclear weapons and views on climate change among other factors, including cyber threats and scientific developments, that have contributed to the darkened forecast.

The emblematic clock had remained at three minutes to midnight for the past two years.
link_name: 'Doomsday Clock' Moves Closer to Apocalypse, Now 2.5 Minutes to Midnight

Mexican President Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto said today his country "will not pay for any wall," defying the claims President Donald Trump has made.

"Mexico does not believe in walls. I've said time again; Mexico will not pay for any wall," he said in a video statement posted to Twitter and translated by CNN from Spanish.

PeÃ±a Nieto said he would wait for a final report from his top officials who arrived in Washington to meet with the Trump administration, and previous meetings with Mexican legislators, before deciding which steps he would take next.
link_name: Mexico's President Vows Country 'Will Not Pay For Any Wall'

Suddenly, two men in dark, hooded sweatshirts ran up to her car and pulled the door handles, according to the sheriff's department.

Trapped beneath a 12-foot-deep avalanche near Lake Tahoe Monday, two friends decided to keep calm by taking selfies.

"Once I got on the phone with 911, I knew there was fire and rescue coming out to get me, then we could relax a little bit and try to keep cheerful," David Ortiz said. "Worrying wasn't gonna get us rescued."

Rescuers said the young men were trapped for about 30 minutes. "We got there, shoveled out one of the doors, opened it up and out popped two happy, young men that were pretty stoked to not be in their car anymore," said one a firefighter/paramedic.
link_name: Trapped Beneath 12-Foot-Deep Avalanche Near Lake Tahoe, Friends Take Selfies

A man recently pardoned by former President Barack Obama was shot and killed by two men with assault-style rifles Monday night, police say. 

One masked man barged into the building and shot Demarlon Thomas, 31, of Saginaw, while another held about two dozen people in the home at gunpoint.

"He was just happy to be free and have a second chance at life," Carla Robinson, who grew up with Thomas, told reporters. "I actually talked to him even more before he came home. He was just focused on coming home. Before he even knew about the situation with Obama, he remained, 'I'll be home one day.'"
link_name: Man Pardoned by Obama 'Executed' by Masked Men at Michigan Halfway House

The search is on for whoever stabbed a man multiple times and left him to die on the patio of his Woodland Hills home Monday. 

Paramedics found 49-year-old Fabio Sementilli on an outdoor patio suffering from injuries to his face and a significant amount of blood loss. Responders were unable to revive Sementilli, who was pronounced dead at the scene. 

Sementilli's car, described as a  black 2008 Porsche Carrera 911 with paper plates, was missing from the home. 

Investigators have not identified a suspect or suspects in the case and asked anyone with information to call Detective Steve Castro at 818-374-1925.

Gmail users beware: A sophisticated new phishing scam is taking aim at Google's popular email service, and it's fooling even the most tech-savvy users. 

Part of the reason people are falling victim to the scam is because  the hacker's email looks like it comes from one of your contacts, and may even have a subject line that looks authentic.

What's more, even the URL redirecting you to login to your Google account looks like the real thing.
link_name: Gmail Targeted in Sophisticated New Phishing Scam That Is Fooling Even Tech-Savvy Users

status_message:
A dangerous rescue was captured on video after a hiker lost her footing on the Devil's Backbone Trail near the Mount Baldy summit Monday. 

The 34-year-old victim slipped 50 feet down the same ridge dozens of others have over the past few years, but managed to use her ice ax to keep from falling further down the steep mountainside. 

The rescue pilot from the San Bernardino County Fire Department hovered over the woman while battling high winds with gusts up to 45 mph. The victim was then placed into a harness and hoisted 130 feet to the safety of the helicopter.

A motorcyclist whose leg was partially severed in a crash is recovering at an Orange County hospital today thanks to a Santa Ana police officer who used a tourniquet to help save the man's life.

An SUV made a left turn in front of the motorcyclist, which sent him flying into a street curb, severely injuring his leg, officials say. 

A police officer arrived at the scene to find the motorcyclist bleeding heavily from his injured leg. The officer immediately applied a tourniquet to the man's leg until paramedics arrived.

Some Republicans said they were concerned that the GOP does not have a clear plan to replace Obamacare yet. One Republican representative cautioned that Friday's decision could further send insurance markets into a spiral.

A woman posing as a nurse kidnapped infant Kamiyah Mobley from a Florida hospital in 1998. Now, thanks to tips made to the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children, she's been found alive and well in South Carolina.

Gloria Williams, 51, seen at right, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping. Mobley grew up believing Williams was her mother.

"She's taking it as well as you can imagine," the sheriff said of the victim. "She has a lot to process. She has a lot to think about"
link_name: Missing Newborn Abducted From Florida Hospital Found 18 Years Later; Woman Charged With Kidnapping

The driver kept his cool, though, and slid down the freeway while CHP - Truckee blocked other vehicles. In about 20 minutes, the truck was safe and traffic flowing again.

Lady Liberty is shown as an African-American woman on U.S. currency for the first time in a new commemorative coin issued to mark the 225th anniversary of the United States Mint.

The $100 coin is the first in a series of 24-karat gold coins that will feature Lady Liberty as a woman of color, including as an Asian-American, Hispanic-American, and Indian-American. 

The mint says the designs are meant "to reflect the cultural and ethnic diversity of the United States."
link_name: New Commemorative $100 Coin Issued by U.S. Mint Shows Lady Liberty as African-American Woman for 1st Time

An Iowa principal let a student shave his head in front of the student body after the child was bullied for his own shaved head.

"I had a couple options at that point bringing in the individuals who had questions but I thought deeper I said you know this is an opportunity to teach more than just what our handbook says and policy this is an opportunity to teach life," said Principal Tim Hadley.

Heads up, Netflix users.

A cyber security firm says Netflix customers should know about an email scam asking customers to "update" their account information. A link redirects customers to a page that looks like an official Netflix login page, but it's a fake.

Scammers are trying to get people to give up personal information, including their name, address, credit card number and social security number.

On its website, Netflix says it will never ask for personal information in an email.
link_name: Netflix Users Targeted by Email Scam Seeking Credit Card, Account Information

A middle-income, married couple with two children is estimated to spend $233,610 to raise a child, according to a new report. That figure is only for costs from birth through age 17 -- so it doesn't include college expenses.

In urban areas of the western U.S., including California cities, costs are even higher than that average.
link_name: It Costs an Average of $233,610 to Raise a Child: USDA

status_message:
An Ontario woman who was jailed after being accused of harassing, stalking, pretending to be the wife of her ex-fiance, and placing ads online soliciting "rape fantasies" was in fact framed by the woman she was accused of impersonating, the Orange County District Attorney's Office announced Monday.

Michelle Hadley (pictured left) was jailed for several months. But authorities now say Hadley was the victim in the case, and that the wife, Angela Diaz (pictured right), has been arrested after allegedly framing Hadley for stalking and attempted rape. 

Because of the investigation into the case, Diaz has also been accused of faking cervical cancer, faking a pregnancy, and impersonating two of her husband's ex-girlfriends over email.
link_name: Woman Jailed for Posing as Ex-Fiance's Wife to Post 'Rape Fantasy' Ads Online Was Framed: Orange County DA

status_message:
A Pennsylvania couple arrested in the brutal beating, rape, killing, and dismemberment of the woman's teen daughter each face the possibility of the death penalty, prosecutors say. 

The victim, Grace Parker, suffered terribly before her death, according to Bucks County DA Matthew Weintraub. He called her slaying "a rape-murder fantasy that was shared by Jacob Sullivan and Sara Packer, and they acted it out."
link_name: Pennsylvania Girl, 14, Killed in Horrific 'Rape-Murder Fantasy'; Adoptive Mother, Boyfriend Arrested: Prosecutors

status_message:
An Orange County, Florida, deputy sheriff was killed in a motorcycle crash Monday during a manhunt for the gunman who killed an Orlando police officer earlier Monday morning, the sheriff said.

Area schools were on lockdown amid the search for the person who shot and killed Master Sgt. Debra Clayton, a 17-year veteran and mother of two.
link_name: Sheriff's Deputy Killed in Crash Amid Manhunt for Orlando Police Officer's Killer; 17 Schools on Lockdown

status_message:
Donald Trump denied "for the 100th time" mocking a New York Times reporter with a physical disability after Meryl Streep condemned him over it during a speech at the Golden Globes Sunday night. 

"It was that moment when the person asking to sit in the most respected seat in our country imitated a disabled reporter, someone he outranked in privilege, power and the capacity to fight back," Streep said, referencing this moment from a 2015 rally. 

The Times reporter, Serge Kovaleski, has a chronic condition called arthrogryposis, which limits the movement of his arms. 

"For the 100th time, I never 'mocked' a disabled reporter (would never do that) but simply showed him 'groveling' when he totally changed a 16 year old story that he had written in order to make me look bad. Just more very dishonest media," Trump wrote in a series of tweets.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/TCPo8

Diego Luna shared a heartfelt story from a fan who wrote about the importance of seeing the Mexican actor featured in the new "Star Wars" spinoff.

 "I took my father to see 'Rogue One' today," the fan wrote. "I wanted my Mexican father, with his thick Mexican accent, to experience what it was like to see a hero in a blockbuster film, speak the way he does. 

"I told him that Diego has openly talked about keeping his accent and how proud he is of it ... And my dad was silent for a while and then said, 'And he was a main character.' And I said, 'he was.' And my dad was so happy."

"Heroin, heroin is the devil," a mother said after her daughter was found dead in the bathroom of a North Carolina Taco Bell of an apparent overdose.

Claudia Marini said her daughter Madison was a straight-A student, a soccer goalie and a singer among other things. Around high school graduation time, however, Claudia says her daughter went down a different path and became an addict.

"It's devastating that, as a mom, that what I hang on to every day of my 22-year-old daughter is a piece of her hair," Claudia said, sobbing, holding a sandwich bag with Madison's hair. "Because I can't hold her, and I can't touch her and I can't brush her hair."
link_name: Mother Shares Story About Addiction After Daughter Dies in Taco Bell of Apparent Overdose

status_message:
Leanne Nasser, 18, who begged her parents to let her leave Israel for the first time and go to Istanbul to celebrate New Year's Eve, died when a terrorist opened fire killing 39 people.

"Her father was totally against that. He was saying that Istanbul is too dangerous and that she should not go at all. But she insisted, saying that nothing will happen to her," Nasser's aunt said.

Nasser's body will be flown home on Tuesday, three days into 2017. Her family is waiting for her to come home. The tears have not stopped, and the grief is still too near. It was Leanne Nasser's first trip abroad. And it will be her last trip home.
link_name: Istanbul Attack: Teen's First Trip Abroad Ends in Tragedy

status_message:
A home surveillance video showed a 2-year-old Utah boy trying for almost two minutes to free his twin brother from under a fallen dresser â€” and eventually succeeding.  

The boys' parents posted the video to social media to highlight the importance of securing furniture to make homes childproof, they said.

"We were hesitant to post this video initially," the boys' father said, "but a lot of parents have probably made the same mistake that we made, (they) don't have their furniture secure of bolted to a wall."
link_name: 2-Year-Old Saves Twin Brother From Fallen Dresser

While a Kansas City firefighter was on duty Saturday, two men kicked in his front door and stole his belongings.

A text message on his phone alerted him that there was movement in his living room. Through an app, he watched in real time.

"I was like, 'oh, it's just the dog walking around. That's when I saw them kick in the door. I literally just started shaking," Kelsey Koehler said.

"It was just too much heat and the smoke was just really unbearable," said neighbor Ronny D., who can be heard calling to the kids from outside one of the home's windows.

Investigators believe a Christmas tree may have played a role in sparking the fire, which left the father in critical condition and the two children in grave condition when they were rushed to the hospital. Family members said the boys, 2-year-old twins, were later pronounced dead at the hospital.

In video exclusively obtained by KTLA, the man suspected of killing a missing nurse and burying her body in a shallow grave in his backyard in Lennox is seen being questioned by the victim's family one day after Lisa Marie Naegle's mysterious disappearance. 

The family had persuaded Jackie Rogers to sit down for an interview at their home Monday night, which they recorded. 

During the questioning, Rogers admitted the two were having "relations," and told the family that he liked Naegle and would "do anything for her." He also denied leaving with her after the birthday party the pair attended Saturday night. 

Rogers is expected to be charged and to make his first court appearance Thursday.

Nintendo's beloved '80s Mario character is debuting on Apple devices for the first time with the launch of Super Mario Run Thursday. 

Fiercely protective of its mustachioed plumber, Nintendo had previously been reluctant to put him in a mobile game.

Users can play parts of the game for free, but a one-time payment of $9.99 will grant them unlimited access.

Deputies are reviewing footage of an assault incident that took place early Tuesday morning at the Hollywood and Vine Metro Red Line station. "You can't see in the video but then he kicked him in the face while he was down," Cunningham told KTLA. "I followed the guy and he had no teeth in his mouth. He had his teeth knocked out and he was bleeding all over the place."

Startling video shows the moment an e-cigarette exploded in the pants of a man working at a New York City wine store Wednesday. 

Otis Gooding, 31, suffered third-degree burns and was admitted to a nearby medical center burn unit, where he is expected to have surgery, his attorney said. 

There have been a number of reports of similar incidents involving e-cigarettes. In May, a vaporizer blew up in a young man's face in New York, knocking out teeth, ripping a hole in his tongue and leaving his hands covered in burns.

Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, the NBA's all-time leading scorer and former basketball superstar who helped lead the LA Lakers to five NBA championships during his decorated career, was honored with the Presidential Medal of Freedom at a White House ceremony. 

He was among 21 people chosen in 2016 to receive the nation's highest civilian award.

After a legendary career, Vin Scully -- the beloved longtime Los Angeles Dodgers broadcaster who recently retired -- was honored at the White House Tuesday with the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation's highest civilian honor. 

Scully was among 21 recipients who received the honor at this year's ceremony.

Ernest Thompson, the World War II veteran who was honored in front of his Gardena house in an emotional tribute that went viral online over the summer, has died. He was 99. 

Back in August, Thompson received nationwide attention when a group of Chief Selects decided to go to his home and pay tribute to him after he was forced to end his regular visits to the USS Iowa due to health issues. While they sang "Anchors Aweigh," Thompson stood and saluted -- the first time he was able to stand or walk since a fall earlier in the year. 

Before his death, Thompson was able to visit the ship he loved so much one last time as he celebrated his 99th birthday back in October. A memorial was held aboard the USS Iowa on Sunday. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/Q8kh7

Cpl. Todd Nicely was leading a group of Marines on a security patrol in Afghanistan on March 26, 2010, when he stepped on a 40-pound bomb. 

He survived the blast, but the IED left him a quadruple amputee. 

Today, this young man is one of only five Americans to survive deployments to Iraq or Afghanistan as quadruple amputees. 

KTLA's new documentary "Homeland Diaries" follows Nicely's inspirational journey and the stories of other veterans. It airs Friday, Nov. 11 at 7 p.m., with an encore on Sunday, Nov. 13 at 8 p.m. http://vetshomelanddiaries.com/

Two teen surfers helped rescue two young boys whose boat capsized while going the wrong way into Ventura Harbor.

Surfers Eithan Osborne and Micky Clarke were in the water and each helped one of the boys, paddling them back to land.

The skipper waited atop the capsized vessel for Harbor Patrol to respond. No one was injured.

There was no recklessness or negligence, only human error, the harbormaster said.
