President Barack Obama and first lady Michelle Obama celebrated Star Wars Day Wednesday with a dance featuring Star Wars stormtroopers and the beloved robot, R2-D2.

May 4 is a sacred day for fans of the George Lucas movie series and was chosen as the holiday by Star Wars fans around the world because "May the fourth" is a play on "May the force be with you" â€” a famous line from the series.

In December, the White House hosted a special screening of "The Force Awakens" for Gold Star families, who lost family members to combat or service-related injuries.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/JIMip

Beloved actor Danny Trejo gave KTLA a tour of his Trejo's Tacos restaurant in L.A.'s Mid-Wilshire district, as he prepares to open another location in Hollywood.

The menu offers tacos with fried or grilled Jidori chicken, beef brisket, slow-roasted pork shoulder and even black pepper tofu.

"If I didn't work out I'd be 500 pounds," the star of "Machete" said with a laugh.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/SYjkh

Update: A beloved therapy dog, who vanished during a family trip in the Leimert Park area, has been reunited with the boy in a wheelchair to whom he has been a constant companion for six years.

"I want my doggie back," a teary-eyed 10-year-old said after his therapy dog escaped his family's van last Friday. 

Juan Hernandez has osteogenesis imperfecta -- a form of brittle bone disease -- and spends much of his time in a wheelchair. According to Juan, life isn't the same without "Buddy." "It's been sad and depressing," Juan said.

Luckily, a 21-year-old woman who had been able to capture Buddy saw the news coverage. She got in touch with the family, and Buddy and Juan were reunited.

Alarming videos on social media of young people skateboarding on crowded freeways in Los Angeles and San Diego counties have emerged in recent weeks.

One pro skater who posted â€” and then deleted â€” video of himself apparently riding in freeway traffic is now saying others shouldn't take up the so-called "Freeway Challenge." It was only a "quick joke," skater Nakel Smith said.

A video he posted on Instagram may have prompted other skaters to take to freeways, and the CHP says it takes the matter very seriously.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/1NTQZ

A man previously arrested for "video voyeurism" ran scared from a Target store in Florida recently when a woman who recognized him from a past "inappropriate" encounter began recording him on her cellphone. 

Candice Spivey posted her video to Facebook in hopes of getting the word out about the man, and as of Tuesday morning more than 2.2 million people have viewed her video. 

The local Sheriff's Department also asked for anyone who had been approached by Jeffrey Polizzi to come forward after arresting him for reckless driving as he fled the Target. Authorities stated Polizzi had a prior arrest for "video voyeurism." 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/y2mgp

A bear made its way into a second-floor apartment in Colorado -- and was said to be rummaging through a refrigerator when firefighters and sheriff's deputies were summoned.

The resident of the home locked himself in his bedroom while the responders coaxed the small animal out into a hallway. The bear then left the building without incident.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/JYqly

A prosecutor expressed anger and frustration after the Oakland man convicted of abusing a puppy before burning her alive was sentenced to only three years in prison on Friday. 

Willie Bee Turner allegedly poured bleach on the weeks-old Chihuahua as punishment after she defecated in his friend's apartment. The incident culminated with him setting fire to the puppy inside the crate, killing the trapped dog, according to court testimony. 

"This is a piddly sentence for such a heinous crime," Sacramento County Deputy DA Hilary Bagley told the judge, according to a local newspaper. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/MqJDp

President Barack Obama delivered his final White House Correspondents' Dinner speech, joking about "running on CPT," ribbing Bernie Sanders and skewering Donald Trump.

Echoing Kobe Bryant's farewell speech after his last game, the president concluded his own remarks by saying: "And with that, I just have two more words to say: Obama out." In a flourish, he then dropped the mic before leaving the podium.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/8sZVU

Hundreds of demonstrators descended on the California Republican convention Friday to protest Donald Trump ahead of his speech. 

Protesters blocked off the road in front of the Hyatt Regency, forcing the GOP frontrunner's motorcade to pull over along a concrete median outside the hotel's back entrance. Trump and his entourage got out and walked into the building.

"That was not the easiest entrance I've ever made," Trump told the convention. "My wife called; she said, 'There are helicopters following you.' Then we went under a fence â€¦ Oh boy, felt like I was crossing the border, actually."

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/rxU7E

A wild scene outside Donald Trump's rally in Costa Mesa Thursday included one man jumping on top of a patrol car before several others began to try to overturn the vehicle. 

At least 17 people were arrested after a crowd of several hundred flooded the streets outside the Pacific Amphitheater where Trump kicked off his California campaign. 

The protests outside Trump's rally appear to point to an upcoming month of activism as the GOP front-runner tries to seal the presidential nomination in the state.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/bYTe7

A $50,000 reward is being offered to the person who can help police identify three men seen in surveillance video attacking a man in Westlake who ended up dying in front of a church about a block away. 

Video of the June 23, 2015 incident shows Oscar Lazo being surrounded by three men in front of Union Liquor on Beverly Boulevard when one of the men appears to stab Lazo as another swings what was described as a sharpened wooden sword. 

New video released Wednesday shows a 2006 or 2007 dark gray 4-door Nissan Altima with a sunroof and tinted windows that may belong to the attackers.

Investigators believe the men live in the neighborhood and have asked anyone with information to call the Police Department at 213-484-3650.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/vR20J

In an unusual move, Carly Fiorina chose to sing about how much she adores Ted Cruz's daughters during a campaign rally to announce her as Cruz's running mate. 

"I know two girls that I just adore, I'm so happy I can see them more. Cause we travel on the bus all day we get to play, we get to play," Fiornia sang. 

What do you think?

Contest: We're giving away tickets to see comedian George Lopez live from our partners at Goldenvoice. Watch the KTLA 5 News at 10 on Wednesday and Thursday for your chance to win. We'll pick a different winner each night.

Destiny Gleason was only 14 years old when she took her own life to escape what her parents described as "relentless bullying."

"She just wanted everybody to like her, that's all she wanted," Destiny's mother, Stephanie Clark, said.

The Missouri middle-schooler hanged herself from a pull-up bar in her bedroom last week following months of alleged harassment â€“ in person and on social media â€“ by classmates, her mother said.

"Words matter," said Clark. "That old saying, 'sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me' â€“ well, they will and we lost our daughter because of words."

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/3aW0X

Thousands of people have offered to care for a 5-year-old dog named Juice after a video of his whimpering went viral.

Following his initial adoption from an animal services center in Maryland, the bullmastiff mix was returned to the shelter due to a "bad fit" with his owner.

Placed back in his kennel, Juice cried for hours. The facility's staff posted video of the crying dog on Facebook, prompting an overwhelming outpouring of support.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/p84QX

Video showing a dog tethered to a car that was driving down a street in Stockton over the weekend has many pet owners upset. 

"First thought was 'oh my god this dog is going to get hurt' you know, maybe a car's going to go past him and hit him," said Amanda Brajkovich, who shot the video. 

The owner of the dog claimed the dog wasn't dragged and there was no tension on its leash.

Brajkovich said she hopes by sharing the video, other pet owners will step up and do right by their pets.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/pgkLY

A volatile spring storm brought damaging winds, hail and scattered showers to Southern California Monday.

Wind gusts were especially strong in the high desert and along the coast.

In Valencia, powerful gusts were blamed for ripping off a canopy from outside a car wash and blowing it across a parking lot.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/wj1k0

Did you know there's bacon being made right in the L.A. area? Lots of it.

Chris Burrous took a tour of Farmer John in Vernon, where he reports the company goes through thousands of pork bellies every day.

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://on.ktla.com/6YWdK

A student was arrested after video posted to social media showed a "special education student" being assaulted at West Ranch High School in Stevenson Ranch, according to the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department. 

While some whipped out their cameras to record the attack, others came to the student's aid. 

"I just go up to the kid and I'm just like, 'I don't want to fight, I just don't want you to fight him (the special education student),' because I knew he had like some issues," said Eli Skolnik, a junior at the school. 

Many at West Ranch have since united behind the special education student, taking to social media to express support for him.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/De5G8

A whale had "her tail just a few feet from my board," a paddleboarder who captured this amazing GoPro video of a close encounter with a gray whale wrote after posting the video to YouTube. 

A drone flying above the paddleboarders caught another view of the encounter and showed one of the whales turning over on its side. 

"The whales were very sweet and curious. EPIC," wrote Rich German, who recorded the GoPro video.

After becoming trapped in an elevator with seven other USC football players, Zach Banner began live-tweeting the ordeal.

One tongue-in-cheek tweet was simply captioned, "Here's my will"; in another, the offensive tackle, pretending to be in tears, cries, "Help me."

The athletes also got creative during the hourlong incident, breaking into the #ElevatorRap at one point.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/g7cHA

A wild multi-county pursuit came to an end when the female driver stripped naked on a downtown Los Angeles street and was arrested, according to authorities. 

The incident began about two hours earlier in Pasadena when she allegedly tried to run over one of her parents with an SUV during a verbal altercation, police say. 

She was identified by a police spokesman as 32-year-old Simone Gonzalez. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/wOSXs

A 28-year-old mother of two was arrested on suspicion of child endangerment after a neighbor's report of a "foul odor" led to the discovery of a dead infant in an apartment in Riverside County.

Deputies say Susan Chavez and a 2-year-old child were found living in the apartment with the deceased baby.

The toddler received medical attention and is in protective custody.

An autopsy will be conducted on the infant to determine a cause of death.

A 3-day-old baby boy was mauled to death by the family dog in what San Diego police described as a "horrific" and "tragic" incident.

The dog, a Staffordshire terrier, was lying on a bed with the baby and his parents when the child's mother coughed. The dog was startled and unexpectedly attacked the baby, police said.

The parents rushed the infant to a hospital where he was pronounced dead.

Purple rain is falling in the #RainRoom at LACMA, in a fitting tribute to Prince.

What's inside Prince's home remains a mystery to most because he didn't allow photos to be taken.

A close encounter with a great white shark off Dana Point was captured by a kayaker who was out fishing Wednesday.

Bill Morales had just caught a leopard shark when he said he was suddenly jerked backwards.

"I had the camera in one hand and I had the shark in the other hand ... I had to move my arm back and forth like a piston so that it wouldn't just pull me over," Morales said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/unH5m

"This is what it sounds like when doves cry." 

Doug Kolk takes a look back at the life and music of legendary artist Prince, who died today at the age of 57.

Want to ride the world's tallest water slide?

With a height that's still undisclosed, the ride will be about 2 1/2 football fields long, with four uphill sections. It'll take you 123 steps to get to the top.

It's under construction now in Texas and is expected to open in June.

A dolphin at the Shedd Aquarium in Chicago gave birth to a 25-pound white-sided calf, and the moment was captured in a remarkable video.

The new mom was in labor for three hours, after which onlookers erupted in cheers.

"As soon as those little tail flukes appear, your heart begins to race," a spokesperson for the aquarium said. "And you know it's only a matter of time before you are about to witness something incredibly amazing,"

A $50,000 reward is being offered in the hit-and-run death of an 81-year-old grandfather struck down and left to die in the street in Glendale.

It happened Saturday night as Martiros Arutyunyan was crossing at Broadway and Belmont Street, police say.

"I can't believe it, that my dad is gone," said his daughter who sobbed as she described her father as "a great man."

Surveillance video captured the crash and a clear image of the white sedan being sought. 

The victim's family urged anyone with information to come forward.

"It's not like they hit a dog," said the victim's son Martin Tovmasyan. "They hit a person."

A 3-year-old girl was airlifted to Loma Linda University Medical Center in stable condition after being bitten by a snake in Chino Hills.

The child was walking on a trail when the incident occurred, according to the Chino Valley Fire District.

Donald Trump accidentally referred to 9/11 as 7-Eleven, the well-known convenience store, while speaking at a campaign rally in Buffalo Monday.

"I watched our police and our firemen down at 7-Eleven, down at  the World Trade Center right after it came down. And I saw the greatest people I've ever seen in action," Trump said.

Trump has made his advocacy for New York City after the 9/11 attacks central to his candidacy. He is poised to win a lion's share of the delegates in New York's primary on Tuesday.

A boisterous crowd of Bernie Sanders supporters showered Hillary Clinton's motorcade with 1,000 one-dollar bills as she headed to a fundraiser in Studio City hosted by George and Amal Clooney. 

They then began dancing in the middle of the street, stomping all over the money.

The Golden State Warriors' Steph Curry has teamed up with President Barack Obama to promote My Brother's Keeper, a mentoring initiative, in an often humorous PSA.

In some of the the video's tongue-in-cheek moments, Obama helps the NBA All-Star with his resume, beats him at Connect Four, and even offers some basketball shooting tips.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/2yZI9

With a single photograph, a mother captured a powerful image of "pure" friendship between her daughter and boy she met at Myrtle Beach.

On her Facebook page, Ayanna Toye Barrows wrote that she and her daughter were walking on the beach at sunset when a little boy came running up to them and befriended her daughter. 

She says the children talked, walked and raced each other on the beach. 

Barrows snapped a picture of the two and wrote, "This is a moment that we humans understand as just simply seeing no color lines, no judgment, no race, no hate, no shades. It's just pure... two kids meeting on a sunset walk without a care in the world... all they saw was each other."

Update: As armed officers searched the campus of Kennedy High in Granada Hills for a mountain lion Friday, Sky5 captured video of the puma walking casually across a street in the surrounding neighborhood.

The mountain lion was tranquilized by a dart and will be returned to its habitat, the state wildlife department said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/mWaMX

A man convicted of tying a toddler to a motel bed and raping her as he recorded the brutal ordeal for others to watch was sentenced to up to 200 years in prison by a Michigan judge who says he wants the "truly evil individual" locked up behind bars for the rest of his life. 

Eric Devin Masters was also accused of urinated on the young victim after the sexual assault. He traded the video for other child pornography, according to authorities and a report. 

Just last month, Masters was sentenced to 50 years in prison in separate child porn cases involving three young girls, according to the FBI. 

"We need to make sure that you are never allowed in society," Judge Mark Tusock said. "I want to send a clear message to the Parole Board that when you are first considered for parole ... that I don't want you out. We're done. Take him to prison."

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/vtNXh

status_message:
A chimpanzee performed a high-wire act on live television in Japan Thursday after escaping from a nearby zoo.

After two hours on the loose, the 24-year-old chimp named Cha Cha was eventually located in a residential neighborhood where he climbed a utility pole and dangled from power lines as rescuers tried to capture him.

Men in a cherry picker shot Cha Cha with a tranquilizer dart. That appeared to anger the chimp, who lunged at the men and pulled the dart out of his back.

Cha Cha was eventually returned to the zoo.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/iB7QE

A gunman is seen unloading several rounds at a group of people standing in front of a South L.A. barbershop in newly released surveillance video. 

One man was killed â€” just two days after telling his mother he was going to be a father. 

Although the shooting is believed to be gang-related, the victim is not a gang member, investigators said Thursday. Anyone who recognizes the shooter is asked to contact police. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/icwhV

A Marine veteran was reunited with his missing service dog this weekend in a touching moment captured on video.

"Raider" disappeared from a hotel room where he was staying with former Sgt. Chris  in Utah.

The distraught veteran searched throughout the night for his beloved pet, who was finally located at an animal clinic near the hotel.

"Having him with me side by side makes me more confident, strong, and more like the sergeant in the Marines I once was," Galliher said. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/0yrte

Two-year-old James Sieger Jr. was unresponsive and covered in bruises when he arrived at a Utah hospital last year. Two days later, the toddler was dead from injuries he received during a vicious beating triggered by a dirty diaper, prosecutors said.

On Monday, Jasmine Bridgeman, 24, was sentenced to 15 years in prison for her part in her son's death.

Bridgeman's boyfriend became enraged during a potty-training incident, smearing a dirty diaper on the toddler's face and beating him, according to court documents.

"There are no words what this baby went through and the pain he suffered," said the little boy's aunt.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/GEk4v

A man armed with a chain saw was taken into custody after police officers repeatedly fired on him in a dramatic scene caught on video by workers at the scene in Torrance. 

The man, who has occasionally worked for a tree-trimming subcontractor at the SoCal Edison facility, ran around the yard with the chain saw and then jumped into a truck and drove wildly around with officers in pursuit, the video showed.

The suspect was not struck by gunfire, a police sergeant said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/lF7uv

Real or fake? A snowboarder recently posted video showing a bear chasing her down a hill in Japan, but some are questioning the validity of the video. 

"OMG! I was going through my snowboarding videos and I found a bear chasing me!!! I nearly got eaten!!!" Kelly Murphy's YouTube post read.

Some have suggested the video was fake because the bear's growls were too prominent. Others claimed that the type of bear seen in the video is unlikely to be in the area where the Murphy says she was snowboarding.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/uYpLS

Amazing video of a large sinkhole in the making was captured on Monday by police in the city of Madera, north of Fresno.

The sinkhole is one of many incidents being blamed on the recent storms, which brought heavy rains, high winds, flooding and snow.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/8mcgP

Security video from inside a Five Guys shows a real-life "Hamburglar" cooking himself a couple of cheeseburgers after he followed a delivery man into a Washington D.C. location. 

The video showed the man talking on the phone and sipping a drink as he cooked his meal. 

Police have asked the public for help in identifying the man. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/DnJ9w

Despite suffering minor burns, "Smokey Junior" is expected to be OK after he was rescued from a brush fire in Florida.  

Firefighters affectionately named the baby bear, calling him "SJ" for short, as they played and posed for pictures with him until fish and game officials arrived. 

"We treated him like one of our own," the battalion chief said of their time together.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/zu2ri

Multi-angle video shows the historic moment when part of a SpaceX booster rocket successfully landed on a drone ship in the Atlantic Ocean.

Employees at the company's facility in Hawthorne burst into wild applause, and many of them jumped up and down cheering, "U.S.A., U.S.A."

"What was different about this (landing) is that the rocket landed instead of putting a hole in the ship or tipping over," CEO Elon Musk later joked.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/CT9Nr

Update: Following the runaway success of last year's biopic "Straight Outta Compton," N.W.A. has been inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

The honor "means a lot of things," rapper-turned-actor-director Ice Cube said in a recent interview. "It means that the group's mark is kind of solidified." 

The Compton rap group had been eligible for induction for several years under the rule that 25 years must have passed from the release of an act's first recording. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/gcG70

A rare sight was caught on camera in Wisconsin on Thursday.

Three albino deer were seen feeding together on a property in Vilas County, according to Green Bay TV station WGBA.

According to the station, only one out of every 20,000 deer is born with albino traits.

Update: A pursuit driver and his passenger were greeted by dozens of people in South Los Angeles as a two-hour chase came to a stop.

One person was seen high-fiving and hugging the passenger as others took photos. Deputies arrived soon after and took the pair into custody without incident.

Watch KTLA's video: http://on.ktla.com/efu7s

Update: A TMZ tour bus temporarily blocked a pursuit driver on the 101 Freeway amid a two-hour long chase in the afternoon rain.

Let the magic begin: "The Wizarding World of Harry Potter" opened it's gates just before 6:30 a.m. Thursday to fans waiting to be the first to visit the fictional village at Universal Studios Hollywood in Universal City.

The attraction is based on the hit movies inspired by J.K. Rowling's book series and features Harry Potter themed restaurants, shops, and craft beverages created just for the new park.

There are also a number of Harry Potter themed rides, including "The Flight of the Hippogriff" roller coaster and a "Forbidden Journey" 3D-HD ride.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/hKScg

A man seen in disturbing video violently kicking and swinging a dog in the lobby of a South Pasadena police station has been sentenced to spend 120 days behind bars. 

"There was nothing to provoke him. He was by himself," a police captain said, adding that it was "very unusual to come into a police station and do it right in the police lobby."

Daisy, the 2-year-old Chihuahua, was bleeding when located but expected to make a full recovery. Christian Najera was arrested shortly after the incident. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/7opPy

A motorist in Van Nuys captured a frightening road-rage incident on video Tuesday when a chauffeur allegedly came after him and struck his car's window. 

"I was in shock. So that's when I called 911," said Shahnam Asbaghi following the incident. No arrests were made. "Because my head wasn't smashed, because the window wasn't smashed, no harm no foul is what they told me."

The LAPD said they were reviewing the incident Wednesday morning and would take the "appropriate action" if and when necessary. The car service said it had fired the driver.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/PQo60

The Nile River appears to be running blood red in a recent image taken by the European Space Agency. 

The photo draws parallels to the first biblical plague in Egypt as told in the Book of Exodus.

But don't worry, the image was taken by ESA's recently launched Sentinel-3A satellite, which views areas of vegetation in infrared from the satellite's radiometer.

Flames spread from a recycling business into a neighboring properties. Police have told residents to stay away.

Video shows an injured horse named "Spirit" being airlifted to safety after the animal became trapped in rugged terrain overnight in the Snow Creek area outside of Palm Springs.

A second horse named "Mo" was also trapped, but had to be put down because his injuries were too severe, fire officials said.

The owners stayed through the night with Spirit and Mo until the rescue chopper arrived Sunday.

A Chihuahua is safe and sound after leading San Francisco CHP officials on a "high-speed pursuit" on Sunday. 

Video shows the tiny pooch running across the Bay Bridge before it was  eventually caught.

"Suspect taken into custody. All are safe! #onlyinSF," the CHP tweeted.

A group of children out on an Easter egg hunt are credited with helping police near London catch a couple of suspected burglars during a chase by pointing them -- literally -- in the right direction. 

The kids realized they were witnessing a pursuit when they saw a police chopper overhead and two men racing across a field. So they dropped to the ground and lay out in an arrow-shaped formation to point authorities to them. 

 "The helicopter crew relayed this information to officers on the ground and a short time later two men were arrested," police said.

Cameras were rolling when two suspected drug smugglers tried to cross into Arizona undetected from Mexico at a heavily guarded border wall. 

The footage, shot by TV Azteca, shows the two scaling the wall with ease just 150 feet away from some Border Patrol vehicles. 

But once the duo spotted the news cameras, they quickly climb back over the same 30-foot wall into Mexico and out of sight.  

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://on.ktla.com/cNUGz

Four-year-old Leiliana Wright was fatally beaten and tortured by her own mother, police in Texas say, after the girl drank her 18-month-old brother's juice.

Her mother, Jeri Quezada, allegedly told police she beat Leiliana with a belt and a bamboo stick. Her boyfriend then tied her up in a closet with her wrists tied behind her back, preventing her from sitting down, she said.  

Later in the evening, when Leiliana had trouble swallowing, the mother's boyfriend allegedly began to slap her on the chest and hit her on the head while telling her to swallow her food, police say.

Leiliana's grandparents reported signs of abuse to Child Protective Services last year but say the agency determined she was safe.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/k9ofq

A Florida woman is facing felony charges after inadvertently shooting her husband in the testicles during an argument over an alleged affair.

Victoria Reid allegedly confronted her husband of 16 years and forced him at gunpoint to sit on a couch and discuss an affair she claimed he was having, authorities said.

After threatening to shoot him in the face, Reid allegedly shot him in the knee, local TV station WKMG reported. Authorities said the bullet traveled up the man's thigh and became lodged in his testicles.

A U.S. Marine from Temecula who was the first American to die in combat in Iraq since November 2011 was honored at a ceremony on Friday. 

Hundreds turned out for 27-year-old Staff Sgt. Louis Cardi's closed-casket public viewing. 

"For me it was really tough coming up and rendering a salute. It's hard to have one of your own brothers pass away,"  said a friend and fellow sergeant. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/a96yF

Disturbing video shows an Albuquerque police lieutenant reacting in horror after realizing that he shot an undercover officer during a botched drug bust.

Officer Jacob Grant was grievously wounded by his supervisor in the incident, which occurred in January 2015. The body-camera footage was released this week, one day after Grant settled a lawsuit against the city and was awarded $6.5 million.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/vSelF

A traffic stop ended with a sweet twist for an Orange County sheriff's deputy after he pulled over his wife for driving solo in the carpool lane. 

The videotaped traffic stop concludes with the woman handing her husband her license, registration and a piece of paper that reads: "Baby Wigginton arriving September 2016."

The couple's pregnancy announcement has been viewed hundreds of thousands of times since the Orange County Sheriff's Department, CA posted it on YouTube Monday. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/UJOaF

A Texas mother is facing charges after allowing a registered sex offender to give her three young children tattoos.

Ashley Weir allegedly told the children, all under the age of 13, not to whine or cry when they got the tattoos, the youngsters told police.

Weir, who has a history of alcohol-related arrests, was also allegedly drunk when she gave consent for the tattoos, police said.

The tattoo artist is Weir's boyfriend's brother, who also happens to be a registered sex offender, police said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/2oUHs

Surveillance video shows the terrifying moment when a man's idling car was stolen from a Fresno auto shop while his 3-year-old daughter was sleeping inside the vehicle.

The father and another customer gave chase but quickly lost sight of the car. About 10 minutes later, the unharmed girl was dropped off on the side of a road, where a good Samaritan saw her and called the California Highway Patrol.

Two days later, a 17-year-old boy was arrested in connection with the incident, authorities said.

Baby Aiden Lopez was suffering from serious head trauma and bruising to his upper torso when emergency responders were called to a Lancaster residence on March 22.

Aiden, just 5-months-old, died from the injuries four days later and now authorities need the public's help in gathering information.

Longtime family friend and babysitter Brittany Ingrassi was arrested following the incident, but detectives are asking for anyone with further details to contact the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department at 323-890-5500.

Sirens were blaring as this dramatic video of a tornado forming near Tulsa International Airport was being recorded Wednesday. 

Seven patients were taken to hospitals in the greater Tulsa area, including one who was in critical condition. 

Severe weather will be a concern in the southeast on Thursday and Friday, the National Weather Service said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/Fktgv

D'Angelo Russell said he has apologized to his Lakers teammate Nick Young for secretly recording a conversation between the two of them, in a video that later became public.

"It wasn't my intention. We joked around. We played around all the time,  say crazy things -- this just got in the wrong hands," Russell said.

Some Lakers players are irritated with Russell about the video, which shows Young talking about women other than his fiancee, Iggy Azalea.

Update: Video shows rescue crews working to free a person from a Ford Mustang that was wrapped around a traffic signal pole in Pasadena Wednesday morning. 

The car struck the pole following a crash with a Kia Sorrento, but it was unclear what caused the collision. 

Two people in the Mustang were killed and two others were in stable condition, officials said.

A rat can be seen crawling on an apparently sleeping man on a New York subway in cellphone video captured over the weekend.

As the man appears to wake up, the camera pans down and viewers can hear a loud shriek.

The fiery wreckage of a crash in South L.A. was captured on cellphone video after two cars slammed into a Metro bus, and witnesses say street racing was to blame. 

Two people were critically injured and four more were hospitalized following the crash, which occurred Monday afternoon. 

Authorities have not determined the cause of the crash, but said the drivers would face reckless driving charges if street racing was involved.

A young, father of two on his way to work was killed when a pursuit suspect driving at speeds of 80 to 100 mph sped through a red light in San Bernardino.

The victim's girlfriend told KTLA his name was Alex.

"He was full of life. He loved his community," Sarah Sias said of her boyfriend of more than five years.

Alex, 26, made T-shirts for the victims of last year's terror attack in San Bernardino, she said.

The pursuit suspect was also killed in the crash.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/ZehmW

The theft of a beloved dog has been captured on surveillance footage, and now the animal's owners hope someone will recognize the people caught on camera. 

"It's hard to actually see it with your own eyes. To see that he clearly didn't even want to go, and the fact that she forced it upon him and then just took him," the dog's owner said.

The Maltese was taken from the front yard of Valley Glen home Saturday evening while his owners ate dinner. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/V3hqj

Surveillance video captured a deadly confrontation between a married couple who worked at a Valley Village 7-Eleven and a homeless man who police say stole beer and a hot dog from the convenience store Friday. 

Lagrima "Paulina" Lopez ran after the alleged thief, followed by her husband, Washi Ahmed. In the video, Lopez can be seen confronting the man and grabbing the items from him.

This video stops before the stabbing, but after pulling out a knife, the man stabbed Lopez repeatedly. As Ahmed tried to push the transient off his wife, the assailant swung around and stabbed the victim in the neck. He later died of his injuries. 

"I'm just at a loss for words," said Kelly Seidel, a regular customer at the store. "They're the best people in the whole world. I just can't believe that something like this would happen."

A Georgia special education teacher has resigned after disturbing surveillance video emerged, allegedly showing her slamming a boy to the ground.

Video shows Amelia Stripling walking down the hallway to her classroom on March 17 when she sees one of her special needs students blocking the door.

The boy doesn't notice his teacher behind him when she slams her knee into his back, sending him sprawling face-first to the floor. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/6m54x

A bird was apparently feeling the Bern when it landed on Bernie Sanders' podium during a campaign rally in Portland, Oregon.

"I think there may be some symbolism here," Sanders said after the crowd erupted in cheers. "I know it doesn't look like it, but that bird is really a dove asking us for world peace. No more wars."

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/iDbAP

Dashcam video has captured the dramatic and daring rescue of a woman trapped in a burning car in Florida. 

During the 3-minute video, two deputies can be seen smashing the car's window and tirelessly trying to reach the victim, who was trapped because of her seatbelt, steering wheel and air bag. 

"Video of the incident shows that despite danger to themselves, they continued to work to save this woman from her burning car," the Indian River County Sheriff's Office said.

The woman was airlifted to a hospital in unknown condition after being rescued, and one of the deputies sustained burns to her hand. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/1kzIh

In a crime caught on dramatic surveillance video, about a dozen burglars stormed into an Indianapolis clothing store after a vehicle rammed through the gate.

Police are still looking for the thieves, who rolled away concrete planters before the car plowed into the store.

The driver of an SUV that was hit by a construction worker who plunged 53 stories to his death last week in downtown L.A. has spoken publicly for the first time.

"It was traumatic, it something that I never thought I would have to see," the woman said, holding back tears. 

The man's death was determined to be a suicide on Thursday.

After three people were killed in a fiery 5 Freeway crash caused by two street racers, their relatives and friends on Wednesday begged the remaining driver to surrender. Another driver has already been arrested.

The son of UPS driver Scott Treadway, whose 18-wheeler was struck and then went over the center divider and into another car, killing himself and two teens returning from Disneyland, tearfully pleaded for the street-racer to come forward.

"Some look upon street racing as entertainment. It is not â€” it is deadly," Sheriff Jim McDonnell said. "It could be anybody."

An allegedly intoxicated and unruly man was put in a choke hold by a fellow Metro Expo Line passenger in video that has now been seen by millions. 

"It wasn't going to be a person that I could rationalize with," said the passenger, a fitness professional. "So I thought the best course of action was to just go and subdue him."

And the person who recorded the video agrees: "He did the right thing, I mean, the guy was harassing people."

After falling to the ground, the man was eventually arrested. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/j15E2

Terrifying video out of Belgium shows the chaotic scene at an airport moments after an explosion Tuesday morning. 

A series of attacks has killed at least 34 people and injured another 170, according to Belgian media. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/c4nA8

A 6-year-old girl at the center of a custody dispute was removed from her foster family in an emotional and chaotic scene in Santa Clarita Monday.

The family had sought to bring attention to their effort to "Save Lexi" as they battled to keep her, despite a court order that the little girl be sent to join relatives in Utah.

Lexi is part Choctaw, and she was sent to live with relatives under a 1978 federal law intended to protect Native American families and children. She has been with her foster family since she was about 2.

Detectives are searching for a man who was possibly kidnapped in East Los Angeles. 

Surveillance video from a local business appears to capture a confrontation between two men prior to the alleged kidnapping, and shows one man leading the other away at gunpoint on Saturday. 

Anyone who recognizes those involved or has information is asked to contact investigators.

A horse is "back on its feet and talking" after being airlifted to safety on Saturday, the L.A. County Fire Department said. 

The horse somehow became stuck in a ravine in the Angeles National Forest, and was unable to get out. Rescuers decided a hoist operation was the best option.

Protesters were pepper-sprayed and arrested as hundreds marched to Trump Tower while holding signs and screaming chants against the GOP presidential front-runner on Saturday. 

During a small skirmish, the Donald J. Trump protesters allegedly threw water bottles at police before being sprayed, CNN reports. 

Among the protest signs, some read "#CrushTrump," which was trending on Twitter by the afternoon with nearly 30,000 tweets published that included the hashtag. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/Mza5i

Three pregnant border collie mixes who were dumped on Pasadena-area streets gave birth to more than a dozen healthy and adorable puppies within days of being rescued by good Samaritans. 

Pasadena Humane Society officials believe one person is responsible for abandoning the dogs without food and water. Had they not been rescued, the newborn pups could have died. 

"Please do the responsible thing, either bring them to your local shelter or find someone who you know can take care of them," said Judy Holeman of the Humane Society. "Do not dump them on the street. It's dangerous for the dogs and it is cruel to them as well."

Five cheetah cubs are receiving round-the-clock care at the Cincinnati Zoo after being born prematurely during a rare C-section delivery.

The three males and two females were born March 8 at the zoo's regional cheetah breeding facility.

They were immediately transferred to the nursery where they are being closely monitored and bottle feed every three hours, according to the zoo's website.

The cubs were expected to remain in the nursery for eight to 12 weeks. Their mother "Willow" is still recovering from surgery.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/DHYih

A $500,000 arrest warrant was issued Friday for a man being sought in a series of assaults on women in Santa Ana, one of which was captured on surveillance video.

The chilling video shows a man, identified by police as Carlos Olivares, stalking one of his unsuspecting victims as she walked to her car in a parking lot in Santa Ana.

The 31-year-old Olivares has disappeared from his Santa Ana home and is wanted by police in this attack and assaults on two other women.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/EU603

Alicia Osibin is suspected of fatally shooting her 90-year-old adopted mother and stuffing the elderly woman's body in a trash container at the home they shared in the Bay Area, police said.

An arrest warrant has been issued for Osibin, who is believed to be hiding in the Los Angeles area.

Osibin may have changed her appearance to look more masculine, and may be using the name of A. Callico or Alex Callico, police said.

She should be considered armed and dangerous.

A fire-breather erupted into flames during a pep-rally performance before some 2,000 horrified students at a Florida high school Thursday, and Twitter user @SolJah13 captured the scene on cellphone video. 

The performer and seven students were hospitalized, and a dozen others were treated at the Delray Beach school.

The performance was meant to get students excited about upcoming testing but instead produced a "terrible accident," the school district said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/rhw93

A terrifying moment was captured on surveillance video at a convenience store in Colorado, where a woman suffered a seizure while carrying her baby.

A quick-thinking clerk, Rebecca Montano, reached out and took hold of the child and the mother. The customer collapsed to the ground, prompting a response from paramedics.

"I'm a mother, I'm a grandmother. It's motherly instinct to worry about children," Montano said.

The baby was uninjured. After being treated, the woman was reunited with Montano, whom she thanked with a hug.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/Vv1Yc

While her parents and thousands of others headed to the polls to vote in Tuesday's presidential primary, one 4-year-old Missouri girl was left behind at home.

She was not happy about it.

She tearfully expressed her frustration regarding the voting rights of 4-year-olds to her parents, who posted her reaction on YouTube.

Despite her age, she already knew who she would have voted for.

Watch the full video and read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/Ywu1K

CHP Officer Nathan Taylor, who was fatally struck while responding to a collision on Interstate 80 in the Donner Pass area, was remembered in an emotional ceremony Tuesday documented in this California Highway Patrol video.

Taylor, 35, leaves behind his wife and three sons ages 3, 5, and 8. Tributes to his generosity and kindness poured in to CHP.

Just days before he died, video captured him carrying an elderly woman from her vehicle to his after she crashed in a storm.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/1ACyY

A viral video shows a 27-year-old driver tearing through the streets of San Diego in a souped-up Volkswagen Beetle, and now he has been sentenced to 45 days in jail and three years probation in connection with the stunt.

Blake Wilkey pleaded guilty to six of the 26 counts with which he was originally charged, including reckless driving and exhibition speed.

The video, titled "Urban Assault: San Diego Shark Attack," has been viewed more than 1.2 million times on YouTube.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/IJ8Zk

Do you recognize these two men? 

They are wanted in a string of at least 15 bank robberies committed all across Los Angeles County. 

Nicknamed the "cold hand bandit," one of the men is known for keeping his hands hidden during the robberies. 

His accomplice is also wanted. 

A $5,000 reward is being offered in the case.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/AN1vR

"Constitution, the POTUS, I'm freestylin'. You know this," Lin-Manuel Miranda, the creator of Broadway musical sensation "Hamilton," raps in a video with President Obama that was posted by the White House on Monday. 

Obama tells the drummer to "drop the beat" and flips through cue cards as Miranda raps.

"You think that's going viral? That's going viral," Obama says at the end of the video.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/7wfKq

Video apparently showing police officers eating marijuana-laced "edibles" during a pot-shop raid in Santa Ana last year actually shows the officials eating protein bars and cookies, the DA said on Monday. 

There was "no evidence that any Santa Ana Police Department personnel consumed any edible marijuana items available at the dispensary," the DA concluded. 

Three officers were charged with petty theft on Monday after allegedly taking the snacks from the dispensary's break room.

One of the officers was also charged with vandalism after allegedly banging and smashing surveillance cameras.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/BYubQ

How would you like to get paid to walk a tortoise? 

Hundreds of people applied for such a job after a woman in New York posted an ad on Craigslist looking for someone to walk her beloved pet, Henry. 

The person who lands the coveted position will take Henry to Central Park in his carrier a few hours a week. He doesn't have a leash -- he's a tortoise, so of course he won't run away -- but the person does need to keep a sharp eye on him. 

Amanda Green says she posted the ad because she wants Henry to enjoy some fresh air while she's at work, but she wasn't expecting the overwhelming response. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/Hla7u

L.A. County has turned to a mysterious weather-modification technology called cloud-seeding in hope of getting more rain to fall -- as the drought continues despite the predicted deluge from El NiÃ±o.

The incredible love story between Ronald and Nancy Reagan was remembered at the former first lady's funeral on Friday during the reading of a touching Christmas love letter from husband to wife:

"Dear Mrs. R,

I still don't feel right about you opening an envelope instead of a gift package.

There are several much beloved women in my life and on Christmas, I should be giving them gold, precious stones, perfume, furs and lace. I know that even the best of these would still fall far short of expressing how much these several women mean to me and how empty my life would be without them.

There is of course my "First Lady." She brings so much grace and charm to whatever she does that even stuffy, formal functions sparkle and turn into fun times. Everything is done with class. All I have to do is wash up and show up.

There is another woman in my life who does things I don't always get to see but I do hear about them and sometimes see photos of her doing them. She takes an abandoned child in her arms on a hospital visit. The look on her face only the Madonna could match. The look on the child's face is one of adoration. I know because I adore her too.
She bends over a wheelchair or bed to touch an elderly invalid with tenderness and compassion just as she fills my life with warmth and love.

There is another gal I love who is a nest builder. If she were stuck three days in a hotel room she'd manage to make it home sweet home. She moves things around â€” looks at it â€” straightens this and that and you wonder why it wasn't that way in the first place.

I'm also crazy about the girl who goes to the ranch with me. If we're tidying up the woods, she's a peewee power house at pushing over dead trees. She's a wonderful person to sit by the fire with, or to ride with or first to be with when the sun goes down or the stars come out. If she ever stopped going to the ranch I'd stop too because I'd see her in every beauty spot there is and I couldn't stand that.

Then there is a sentimental lady I love whose eyes fill up so easily. On the other hand she loves to laugh and her laugh is like tinkling bells. I hear those bells and feel good all over even if I tell a joke she's heard before.

Fortunately, all these women in my life are you â€” fortunately for me that is, for there could be no life for me without you. Browning asked; "How do I love thee â€” let me count the ways?" For me there is no way to count. I love the whole gang of you â€” Mommie, first lady, the sentimental you, the fun you, and the peewee power house you.

And oh yes, one other very special you â€” the little girl who takes a "nana" to bed in case she gets hungry in the night. I couldn't and don't sleep well if she isn't there â€” so please always be there.

Merry Christmas you all â€” with all my love.

Lucky me."

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/BgS3a

Former Mexican President Vicente Fox doubled down on his withering criticism of Donald Trump, saying the GOP presidential front-runner reminds him of Adolf Hitler.

Presidential hopeful John Kasich told a crowd on Monday that women "left their kitchens" for him in an early statehouse race.

The Republican was referring to campaign supporters in the 1970s, when "things were different" and everyone wasn't working. 

The explanation didn't stop one female attendee from responding: "First off, I want to say â€” your comment earlier about the women came out the kitchen to support you? I'll come to support you, but I won't be coming out of the kitchen."

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/XwoF9

Once a child surfing prodigy, a Huntington Beach teen is now on his way to fulfilling his dreams of becoming a world champion. 

The young surfer first told KTLA reporter Eric Spillman of his goal during a televised interview when he was just 6 years old. 

Fast forward 12 years, and the now 18-year-old is creeping closer to that dream after qualifying for the World Surf League Championship Tour.

On Friday, he looked back with Mark Mester on his first experience in the spotlight. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/hHgXZ

A stunning image captured what appears to be lava or fire falling over Horsetail Falls in Yosemite National Park.

The spectacle is actually an illusion known as "firefall." 

The annual phenomenon is a completely natural effect that occurs when the angle of the sun sets and illuminates the waterfall.

It is only happens for a couple of weeks in February at sunset.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/th8kl
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A San Pedro high school student who said he had sex with his now-incarcerated teacher said the instructor bought him an Xbox before manipulating him into repeated sexual encounters.

After the school year ended, Michelle Yeh texted the 16-year-old, asking if he wanted to hang out, he said. She took him to the movies, tried unsuccessfully to hold his hand, and then gave him $20 when she dropped him off.

A week later, she bought him an Xbox 360 and some games â€” spending some $400, according to the teen. When they went back to the boy's home to play the games, she moved in on him physically.

Yeh, 29, was in January sentenced the three years, eight months in state prison on multiple counts of child molestation and unlawful sex with three male students she met while working at San Pedro High School.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/orwuN

This newly released video shot by a bystander captured the heart-dropping moment when a helicopter crashed on the water in Honolulu, Hawaii. 

All five people aboard the chopper -- described as a news helicopter -- were pulled to safety by Hawaii authorities and good Samaritans on Thursday, according to the U.S. Coast Guard. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/gOeFl

A Missouri man saved a dog from possible death after the canine's leash got caught in an apartment building's elevator in a terrifying incident that was captured in this dramatic surveillance video. 

Brian Ussery, a maintenance supervisor at the complex, was walking through a door in the lobby when he saw the dog fly through the air and slam against the elevator. 

Ussery ran toward the dog, reaching her just as the the leash tightened once more and the pup started flying through the air again. Thinking quickly, he grabbed the canine and broke the leash.

Later, Ussery shared the video of the terrifying incident on his Facebook page, explaining that he posted it as a warning to dog owners about leashes and elevators. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/r7xiv

Video captured firefighters using oxygen to help a distressed bulldog they rescued from a burning building in Koreatown Thursday morning. 

No people were hurt in the blaze, which broke out just before 1 a.m. in the 100 block of South Oxford Avenue. 

The bulldog, which was the only rescue in the incident, was very friendly and doing well, Brian Humphrey of the Fire Department said. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/CVB6u

Police are pleading with the public to help find a man who forcibly dragged an elderly Northridge woman from her home and tried to sexually assault her.

"If this was your mom or your grandma, definitely you would want somebody to come forward," LAPD Detective Stefanie Diaz said.

The woman, described as being in her 80s, fought her attacker for 15 minutes until he finally gave up and ran away, Diaz said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/wTIDg
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
"We know we have a piece of them together that will last forever," said a pregnant Kansas mother who was told one of the twins she's carrying is not expected to survive. 

At each appointment, it's been more bad news. Until Tuesday, when doctors captured baby Mason McIntire holding onto his big sister's hand in a sonogram. 

"She's the only one who can actually be there and is holding onto him... so it's comforting to know that if he does pass, he won't be alone," Brittani McIntire said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/U7YaR

Pope Francis scolded a person in Mexico after he was pulled down onto a young man in a wheelchair. 

Video shows Francis regained his balance with the help of a security guard. But his normally smiling face morphed into a look of anger as he apparently yelled at the person in the crowd.

The usually calm and collected Pope is known for interacting closely with worshipers.  

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/mVieL

An orphaned sea otter pup named "Spitfire" is getting a permanent home after being found stranded in early January on Carmel Beach by storm waves likely caused by El NiÃ±o.

After unsuccessful attempts to reunite the pup with her family using her cries, the Monterey Bay Aquarium was able to nurse the 4-week-old pup back to health.

Now, she has found a new home at the Shedd Aquarium in Chicago where she continues to thrive.

The once-fragile pup now weighs 11 pounds and is receiving around-the-clock care from her surrogate moms who will teach her the skills every sea otter needs, according to the Shedd Aquarium.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/zBfom

"There's a piece of wood stuck to me," a 14-year-old basketball player said after she was partially impaled by a splintered floorboard during a game. 

Video shows the Wisconsin girl sliding across the floor and then reaching for her side once she realized she couldn't get up. 

"We thought they were going to have to remove an entire board and take the board to the hospital," the tournament organizer said.

The eighth-grader was loaded on a stretcher and spent the night at the hospital. None of her internal organs were hit by the wood.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/kvlmn

Hillary Clinton told a joke -- at Republicans' expense -- whose punchline included her barking like a dog.

"One of my favorite political ads of all time was a radio ad in rural Arkansas where the announcer said, 'Wouldn't it be great if somebody running for office said something, we could have an immediate reaction to whether it was true or not," Clinton told supporters at a rally in Reno, Nevada.

She continued: "Well, we have trained this dog. â€¦'"

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/4uW1V

A child in a wheelchair received a kiss and blessing from Pope Francis after being lifted up by members of a crowd at a soccer stadium in Tuxtla GutiÃ©rrez, Mexico.

The pontiff came down from an altar to receive the child, who was lowered back into the audience after the encounter.

Francis celebrated Mass at the stadium on the third full day of his six-day visit to Mexico.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/NuoIp

A 15-year-old cancer patient serenaded Pope Francis with a stirring rendition of "Ave Maria" during the pontiff's visit to a children's hospital in Mexico City.

Alexia GarduÃ±o, who suffers from osteosarcoma, was embraced by the pope after singing the song.

Angelica Rivera, Mexico's first lady, was visibly moved to tears by the performance.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/h8vOy

A terminally ill boy who found the love of his life at the age of 8 has died after courageously battling cancer for most of his life.

When he was diagnosed for a fourth time last March, David Spisak's parents made the decision to stop treatments and let David enjoy life. And that's when he met 7-year-old Ayla, his "true love."

David invited Ayla to go bowling. He gave her a teddy bear and roses and he even got a kiss on the cheek -- his first kiss.

"Their story is definitely something everyone can learn from," says Angela Andrews, Ayla's mom. "Just to love. Because that's what's important. At the end of every day that's what's important. Who loves you and who you love back."

Ready KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/k78Jf
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
An amazing sight was captured on video off the coast of Newport Beach this week showing a gray whale feeding extremely close to shore.

The video was shot Wednesday by the crew at Newport Coastal Adventure. The group says the whale was likely "skim feeding" on plankton and rubbing itself on the sandy bottom of the Balboa Peninsula.

"This one gave an amazing show, and even paraded around with its mouth open, giving us a rare look at its BALEEN!," the company posted on their Facebook page.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/8rxKA

Pope Francis arrived in Mexico City on Friday evening amid cheers and singing from the thousands of people who gathered at the airport to welcome him.

He was greeted by Mexico's President Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto and the first lady.

Pope Francis' first stop on his five-day visit will be the Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe -- the patron saint of Mexico. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/oi8NK

"I don't want to break his heart. He looks so happy," 5-year-old Quinn says in a viral video in which she contemplates her romantic troubles.

Quinn gets mad if her stories aren't taken seriously, says her mom, a North Carolina TV anchor who shared the video with her fans.

"I hope she lets him down easy," her mom says.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/uADCa

Police acted like a "firing squad," a lawyer has said of officers unleashing some 27 bullets on a San Francisco man in December. 

Mario Woods, 26, was wielding a knife and under the influence of drugs when he was shot at least 21 times, according to autopsy reports released Thursday.

Protesters say race was a factor in the deadly shooting, and the U.S. Department of Justice is now conducting a review of the San Fransisco Police Department.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/KdB59

Selfie sticks aren't just for humans, apparently. 

A sea lion gave people a front-row seat to its underwater world after an Aquarium of the Pacific volunteer handed it the camera.

"I just thought it would be neat to see a swimming sea lion from the same selfie stick perspective that surfers and other action sports athletes use to give a 'you are there' feel to their shots," husbandry volunteer Hugh stated online Thursday.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/zaglr

Update: A teenager who grabbed an aluminum bat, "charged" a 72-year-old man, and beat him at a Santa Ana gas station surrendered to police Thursday. 

The man slipped and fell onto the 18-year-old's car, prompting the vicious response, police said. 

In the video, the older man is seen grabbing an object, believed to be a pipe, in an attempt to defend himself. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/3trLU

This stunning time-lapse video shot by astronaut Tim Peake shows a massive lightning storm from his view aboard the International Space Station. 

"Amazing how much lightning can strike our planet in a short time," Peake stated on his Facebook post.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/Y7Vob

Two border collies can be seen hugging in a video that's been viewed by more than 16 million Facebook users. 

Dewey has won several awards for obedience and trick competitions, and his best bud, Blaze, is described by his owner as courageous and being into stunt work.

You can see all their adventures on the Facebook page Dewey & Blaze Border Collies.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/DdR4J

An innocent 1-year-old girl who was killed in an apparent gang-related shooting in Compton was being remembered by family members as an "awesome baby" whose smile "could make a bad day turn out all right." 

Autumn Johnson was in her crib when gunfire erupted from outside her family's residence Tuesday night, striking her above the eye. Responding deputies arrived before paramedics and rushed her to the hospital, but she was pronounced dead a short time later. 

Her great aunt recalled rocking Autumn to sleep in church on Sunday. "Little did I know that when she closed her eyes, that was going to be my last time. If I had known I would've held her forever," she said through tears. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/kXiaG

Dramatic dashcam video shows a woman being pulled from a burning car by a Missouri Highway Patrol trooper before the flames engulfed the entire vehicle.

The trooper was responding to a crash scene when he spotted the burning car and immediately ran to it and pulled the woman to safety. 

A few minutes later, the entire car was engulfed in flames.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/M5AWG

A violent hit-and-run that left a 27-year-old female pedestrian severely injured was caught on video in a historic waterfront neighborhood in Baltimore.

The driver was attacked by multiple men and was trying to flee when he repeatedly struck a stopped car, then backed up onto the sidewalk, hitting the woman, police said.

He was arrested close by and was allegedly under the influence of alcohol.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/6HPoO

There were moments when Lisa Cohen didn't care if she lived or died.

Her downward spiral started with a Vicodin prescription that led to OxyContin use and eventually heroin and homelessness.

Now she's been clean for about three years, and Lisa is helping other women get sober at an Orange County addiction treatment center.

All week long, the KTLA 5 News at 10 is following these women through treatment, seeing both victories and pitfalls. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/fAVH3

Without warning, an awning over a line of gas pumps at a Chevron station in Torrance came crashing down on top of two cars.

Two maintenance workers were on top of the awning inspecting it for cracks when it fell out from under them.

One of the workers received minor injuries, the other was unhurt but "got quite a ride," authorities said.

No one else was injured.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/1ZQrx

Surveillance video captured the dramatic moment an SUV barreled into several parked vehicles before flipping onto its side in East Hollywood.

A woman, believed to be a grandmother, was killed, and a 7-year-old girl was injured. 

The cause of the crash is under investigation, but the LAPD said the black SUV crashed into another SUV when the two "joined together."

After traveling about a block, the black SUV separated and struck the parked vehicles.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://on.ktla.com/NtlxU

A baby sea lion is recovering after being found, malnourished and dehydrated, in a booth at a La Jolla restaurant.

Video shows the pup being taken out of The Marine Room by members of a SeaWorld rescue team, who fed and treated the animal.

The 8-month-old California sea lion, who's been given the name Marina, is "getting along great," a SeaWorld official said. "She's had a few good meals and plenty of buddies."

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/gRJ92

Surf's up, SoCal. As this video shows, surfers in the South Bay got to play in the big waves Friday. 

The high surf was expected to end Saturday, but gusty Santa Ana winds will blow through the region into next week.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/InbgV

Witnesses cried out in horror as a 565-foot crane collapsed during morning rush hour in Lower Manhattan, killing one person and injuring three others.

Video recorded from inside a nearby building shows the construction crane descending slowly at first, then rapidly crashing to the street below.

The deceased victim was sitting in a parked car at the time, while the three injured were pedestrians struck by falling debris, New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/Lbzs6

Heads up, motorists: In a closure dubbed the #101SlowJam, several miles of the 101 Freeway near downtown L.A. will be fully shut down Friday night, as crews demolish the historic Sixth Street Viaduct. 

The 84-year-old bridge, which has appeared in several films and music videos, will be replaced by a new bridge that is expected to be completed by 2019.

To spread the word, Mayor Eric Garcetti performed this slow jam with the Roosevelt High School jazz band. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/ceJf9

They could hear their neighbor's screams for help, but no one in the Glendora mobile home park could do anything -- the flames were just too intense.

Matt Andrews said he tried in vain to fight through the smoke and fire to enter the home. He called out to his trapped friend, urging him to try to crawl out. 

Others frantically tried to hose down the structure in a futile attempt to douse the flames.

In the end, the fire was too hot and the flames were too big.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/TSaZ5

Former pharmaceuticals CEO Martin Shkreli is notorious for hiking the price of Daraprim, an AIDS treatment, by 5000 percent. He apparently did little to improve his reputation among some representatives during an appearance before a Congressional panel.

Shkreli smirked while repeatedly invoking his Fifth Amendment rights, much to the annoyance of several members of the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

"See there, you can answer some questions," Rep. Trey Gowdy said, after Shkreli confirmed the pronunciation of his name. "That one didn't incriminate you."

"I intend to follow the advice of my counsel, not yours," Shkreli retorted.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/2GnXr

Cameras recently captured the only known wild jaguar in the U.S. roaming the Santa Rita Mountains, just outside out Tucson, Arizona. 

The footage of the jaguar -- known as El Jefe -- was shot and released by Conservation CATalyst. 

Among the large cats roaming the planet, the jaguar is the only one native to North and South America. However, wild jaguars were not known for sure to be in the U.S. until El Jefe was discovered. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/aRNAj

A special-needs puppy born without her front legs was found abandoned in a soggy cardboard box near a busy Market Street intersection in San Francisco right before Christmas.

A passerby rescued the pup and brought her to the San Francisco SPCA.

Rescuers at the SPCA could see that the puppy had already learned to compensate for her missing legs.

But they wanted more for "Daffodil."

"In order to give her the life she deserves, one full of puppy playdates and trips to the beach, we decided to get Daffodil her very own set of wheels," the SPCA stated on the website.

They ordered a set of prosthetic legs and created a vest on wheels.

But, best of all, one of the people working on the prosthetic project fell in love with Daffodil and gave her a forever home.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/mQwV4

Are you looking for a job?

The Home Depot is hiring 2,000 people in the Los Angeles area to fill permanent, part-time and seasonal positions.

The home improvement company plans to fill more than 80,000 jobs nationwide in sales, operations and cashier positions. Job seekers were encouraged to apply online at http://careers.homedepot.com/jobs-in-bloom/.

The company stated that more than half of their seasonal hires transitioned to permanent positions last year.

Read KTLA's story here: http://on.ktla.com/wbfWQ
