status_message:
A tagger at Venice Beach chose an unusual place to leave a mark earlier this week, and now police are searching for the person responsible.

An LAPD horse named "Charly" was working a crime suppression detail at the beach Tuesday when someone tagged the horse's hind-quarters with the letters "RBS."

Police got Charly cleaned up later that evening and have asked the public for help in finding the tagger.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1GqNUXY
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Becky Miller's daughter Bailey suffered from a temporary, unexplained paralysis from the waist down.

Then, after 11 days, the Texas girl regained feeling and movement in her legs.

A viral video shows the moment when she surprised her favorite nurse by standing up and walking, bringing the medical worker to joyful tears.

The video has been viewed more than 6 million times on YouTube.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1aYgYYX

BREAKING: At least 12 students were injured, one critically, Thursday after a stage collapsed during a high school musical in Indiana.

Students at Westfield High School were performing the play "American Pie" when the stage caved in, authorities said. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1ExeCOm

An attorney has asked the FBI to investigate the violent arrest of a mentally ill homeless man he says was repeatedly punched, shot with a Taser and hogtied. 

Cellphone video of the 2014 incident was released Wednesday and contradicts what police stated in their incident report, the attorney alleges.

"The video recording raises concern that the LAPD officers intentionally fabricated and, or withheld crucial evidence that may have resulted in the dismissal of criminal charges against (Samuel) Arrington," the attorney stated.

KTLA has reached out to the LAPD for comment but has not yet received a response.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1PnVILs

The mother of an 8-year-old boy who was the subject of an Amber Alert refused to let police search her Northern California home and was handcuffed during an altercation with officers. Now she and her husband, who was also handcuffed, are alleging mistreatment.

Audio captured by a Fairfield police bodycam reveals Suzanne Guzman angrily refusing to let police search her home for her missing child, Brock, who was later found unharmed. 

The Guzmans say they were worried their dogs would bite officers inside the home. They say they have hired a lawyer and plan to file a complaint.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1zM9s9Z

A local congressman has come under fire after a confrontation between him and a protester accusing him of lying was captured on video. 

"If you touch me again, I'll drop your ass," U.S. Rep. Steve Knight, R-Palmdale, said after the protester, who called himself "Mike," shook his hand aggressively and said, "You told me you didn't vote amnesty and you did â€¦ You lied to me." He then patted Knight on the arm twice.

Knight went on to tell the group he never voted for "amnesty," saying there were several versions of the bill.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1Ebs8VU

A television news camera was rolling when an allegedly intoxicated Florida grandmother clad only in a bikini was arrested following a sobriety test. 

Patricia Ebel, 49, was driving with her 10-year-old grandson after a day at the pool when she crashed her BMW into a stopped car last Friday. 

Ebel now faces DUI charges, including having a blood alcohol content of more than 0.15 with a minor in the car. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1HkXPi0

Las Vegas is known for putting on a show, but on Friday it was Mother Nature that took center stage with a pretty amazing performance of her own.

Video captured a dust devil that appeared to be dancing next to the famous Las Vegas sign.

The woman who designed the iconic sign, Betty Willis, died Sunday at the age of 91 at her home outside Las Vegas.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1yNJuHZ

Dramatic video that appears to show a deputy U.S. Marshal grabbing a woman's cellphone and then slamming it to the ground in South Gate over the weekend is being investigated.  

In the video, a woman appears to be using her phone to record a group of federal officers when one of them comes up to her, grabs the phone, slams it to the ground and then kicks or stomps on it. 

The U.S. Marshals Service is aware of the video and is reviewing the incident, the agency said in a statement Tuesday. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1bgaW6p

Dramatic dashcam video shows police officers rescuing an unconscious driver from a burning SUV in Mesquite, Texas.

After one officer smashed a window and called out to the man, another officer helped pry open the driver's-side door.

They then pulled the man out of the vehicle and carried him to safety as the flames grew larger. No one else was inside.

The driver was transported to a hospital, where he was treated for burns and internal injuries.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1yMZ9Yj

New Jersey police officers used a knife to cut through the seat belt that secured an unconscious woman inside an overturned car.

Flames were visible about a minute after they dragged her limp body from the vehicle. Two minutes later, an explosion occurred.

The 45-year-old woman was later charged with DUI, having an open container of alcohol in the car, reckless driving and with failure to stay in her lane.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FYZPXv

Dispatchers told Officer Jesse Kidder a suspected killer might have a gun and might try to commit "suicide by cop."

After a pursuit, the officer confronted the man on a street in New Richmond, Ohio. Body cam video shows the suspect running toward him, shouting, "Shoot me. Shoot me."

Kidder, a former Marine in his second year on the police force, declined to open fire.

"For him to make the judgment call that he did shows great restraint and maturity," Police Chief Randy Harvey said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1JWQVO4

Firefighters heard screams for help as they battled a blaze at an Idaho home on Friday - but were shocked when they found parrots, instead of people, inside. 

"What was actually recorded was them saying fire, fire," a firefighter said. "That's what we got. 'Help. Fire.' â€¦ It's a smart bird, smart bird."

The rescued birds were unharmed, and no one else was found inside the home.

Emergency crews told a local TV station that birds can be trained to issue warnings when they sense danger.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1cMLNkI

Update: Humans weren't the only ones forced to leave their Riverside County homes after a fire broke out Saturday. Video captured horses quickly leaving the area as the blaze burned the thick vegetation around them. 

"The access is very difficult for firefighters â€¦ these are drought-stricken fuels, this is a river bed, again, difficult access, and thick vegetation. It's a difficult firefight," a fire captain said. 

The animals were taken to a local shelter and were all reported to be OK.

The blaze is 25 percent contained and has burned some 980 acres. Smoke advisories are in effect.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1HHoLrl

One teacher's attempt to get her students to open up has gone viral after she posted the third graders' responses on social media under the hashtag #IWishMyTeacherKnew.

While several responses were positive and touched on topics like wanting to go to college and read more, others showed the difficulties children often face, including bullying and their parents being sick or deported.

"As a new teacher, I struggled to understand the reality of my students' lives and how to best support them. I just felt like there was something I didn't know about my students," the Colorado teacher said. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Hf5Xio

A driver captured dramatic footage of a fire that injured 14 people after a gas line explosion in Fresno County.

The blast happened behind the Sheriff's Office's gun range when a county worker leading a team of inmates constructing a dirt road accidentally struck the gas line, fire officials said.

The county worker and at least one of the inmates were critically injured in the incident, which is under investigation.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1yB4pOl

Surveillance video shows a security guard being shoved into a door by one of three suspected robbers who fled from a business in Beverly Grove earlier this week. 

Video showed the security guard had initially stopped the third man from leaving the store, but was unable to hold him after being pushed. 

Police have asked the public for help in identifying the men. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1yCgd36

Dramatic video captured the moments when a man tried to use a porch bench as a battering ram to enter a North Hollywood home early Wednesday. 

Fearing for his family's safety, Jose Nunez grabbed his gun and confronted the man, who dropped the bench and began charging at Nunez.

The father had his finger on the gun's trigger but decided against pulling it after looking at the man's face.

"The look he had was not an aggressive look, it was â€¦ a crazy zombie-type look," Nunez said. "I didn't want to shoot the guy even though I probably had every right to."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DKmTMM

Newly released surveillance video shows a bicyclist being violently attacked and stabbed multiple times by a group of men who had chased him down on an El Monte street. 

The 36-year-old victim was riding his bike last Monday when someone from a passing vehicle began yelling at him. Police say several people got out of the car after it pulled a U-turn and began punching, kicking and stabbing him repeatedly. 

The victim suffered life-threatening injuries. El Monte police released the video Wednesday amid the search for five men wanted in connection with the assault. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1GOlYNQ

Update: A magnitude-3.1 earthquake hit the San Fernando Valley area Wednesday just before 9 p.m., according to the U.S. Geological Survey.

The quake was centered 4 miles north-northwest of San Fernando at a depth of about 5 miles, according to the USGS. A preliminary report indicated the temblor had a magnitude of 3.2, but it was later downgraded by USGS to 3.1.

Did you feel it?

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DlcF3P
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A 35-year-old Georgia mom who police say admitted to throwing an alcohol and drug-fueled party for her underage daughter that included "naked Twister" is facing charges of contributing to the delinquency of a minor.

Police say Rachel Lynn Lenhard allowed a group of minors to drink alcohol and smoke marijuana at her home. 

The mother of five then allegedly played "naked Twister" in her living room, had sex with an 18-year-old in the bathroom and then continued the party in the home's hot tub.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DK2DuD
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A mother received a letter from a group of "friends" that were apparently fed up with her constant updates and "baby spamming."

"â€¦ every parent thinks their kid is the best ever. But we don't ram it down everyone else's neck!!!" the letter reads, then goes on to say "We can't wait for you to go back to work - maybe you won't have time to be on Facebook quite so much."

While some believe the letter was faked, it brings up an interesting debate about people's social media habits.

What do you think about how your friends use Facebook?

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1IegCZn
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
"Oh Jesus Christ. Man down." 

That was the reaction heard on the graphic dashcam video from one Arizona police officer as he watched a colleague intentionally run down an man with a rifle. 

The incident was recorded Feb. 19 by two Marana police cars that were following the armed suspect. The suspect, identified as Mario Valencia, survived the crash.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1OyRFvC

A mob of teenagers brutally beat a man carrying a baby in what appeared to be an unprovoked attack at a gas station in Memphis.

Orrden Williams, Jr. ran to his car when he saw the group running toward him. One teen threw several punches that landed just inches from his baby's head. He said he considered using a gun to defend his family.

"It would have been a couple of 'mommas' whose child wouldn't have come home â€” justifiably not coming home," Williams said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1FO8sJS

An Egyptian goose was spotted walking in Anaheim Hills after being shot through the neck with an arrow.

Animal control workers have been trying to capture the bird so that it can be turned over to a vet who specializes in the care of exotic animals.

"The arrow is not grossly impairing the animal," an OC Animal Care official said. "It is quite strong and active and, as such, has been a challenge for our officers to capture."

An animal-cruelty investigation is expected to begin if the goose is caught.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DZCCcD

Dramatic video captured a pit crew member being struck by an out-of-control car at an IndyCar race in Louisiana over the weekend. 

Todd Phillips, a tire changer for Dale Coyne Racing, was hit by the car of Francesco Dracone as his vehicle spun out on a pit road.

Amazingly, Phillips walked away with only a cut on his leg and six stitches. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1EztaeX

Animal-control officials are trying to coax a mountain lion believed to be the much-photographed P-22 from the crawl space under a Los Feliz home.

A man installing a security system at the home made the startling discovery this afternoon.

The home is a few blocks away from Griffith Park, where the big cat has lived for more than two years.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1FOX4ue

Tulsa County Deputy Robert Bates "inadvertently" fired his gun instead of his Taser while trying to subdue a suspect, who later died of his wound, police said.

Now Bates has been charged with manslaughter.

The incident occurred after an undercover weapons sting that was captured on video.

The footage shows several officers restraining Eric Courtney Harris, a convicted felon, on the ground as he shouts "He shot me."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1cpDgUz

About 30 teens with cancer got the full treatment when they were pampered for free before a "Great Gatsby"-themed prom in the San Diego area Friday. 

"These are my heroes, really. Just to see these kids go through what they go through â€¦ it takes me away from what I've been through," said the salon's owner, who herself was diagnosed with cancer last year. 

The girls joined other teens with cancer to walk the red carpet before celebrating a prom hosted by the nonprofit group Friends of Scott.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1IEVwXi

A woman has been arrested after allegedly abandoning her 21-year-old quadriplegic son in the woods of Philadelphia's Cobbs Creek Park.

The victim, who suffers from cerebral palsy, was left with only a Bible and blanket. His mother then caught a bus to Maryland to see her boyfriend, police said.

Low temperatures reached the mid-30s and rain was reported during the man's ordeal. He was found after several days by a passerby.

The mother is facing charges of aggravated assault, simple assault, reckless endangerment of another person, neglect of a care-dependent person, unlawful restraint, kidnapping and false imprisonment.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1JCwe9X
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
An Oklahoma reserve deputy's body camera was recording when he chased down an alleged illegal-weapons dealer and fatally shot him.

The Tulsa County Sheriff's Office, which released disturbing footage of the incident, said 73-year-old Reserve Deputy Robert Bates thought he had his Taser in hand when he opened fire.

After a gunshot rings out, a voice in the video is heard saying, "Oh, I shot him. I'm sorry."

Officers restrain Eric Harris on the ground as he repeatedly shouts, "He shot me." He later died at a hospital.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1GBCxMM

Patrons at a doughnut store can be seen taking cover after as many as 10 bullets came flying through the shop's windows Saturday morning. 

One woman was shot in the arm during the incident, which the shop owner says is the third shooting to occur in the area in two years. 

The motive is unknown, and San Bernardino police are searching for the shooter or shooters.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DyX7Lj

Do you recognize the people in this video?

Recently released surveillance footage caught two men and a woman allegedly burglarizing an Encino home. The robbers eventually appear to realize they're being recorded, but not before video captured a close-up of one of them. 

The burglars allegedly stole numerous firearms and a safe.

"Share" this post to alert others.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1cmfclG

A police dashcam video shows shows a fatal brawl involving officers and eight members of a family in the parking lot of an Arizona Walmart.

One man was killed in the fight and another was shot and wounded in the stomach. A Cottonwood police sergeant was hit in the leg by a bullet.

The incident began as officers were responding to a report of an assault at the store.

At least three members of the family are reportedly in the Christian band Matthew 24 Now.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Fx0Hb5

Dramatic video shows an allegedly intoxicated woman walking away from her car after stopping in the middle of a busy freeway in the San Diego area.

Bystanders at the scene attempted to prevent a high-speed collision by signaling to oncoming vehicles, directing them away from the stopped car.

California Highway Patrol officers arrived and took the woman into custody on suspicion of DUI.

No one was injured in the incident.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1NZNMNT

Disturbing surveillance video shows a young boy being slapped by a man and falling to the ground in a Bakersfield grocery store.

Justin Whittington, 23, was taken into custody in connection with the incident after the video was posted on social media and went viral.

He was being held on $1,000,000 bail.

The boy was not seriously injured, authorities said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Gx82rf

After giving birth to six boys, a North Carolina woman wondered if she'd ever have a baby girl.

As it turns out, seven appears to be Cher Lair's lucky number.

A friend was recording as Lair cut the cake at a gender reveal party and captured her priceless reaction to finding out, "It's a girl."

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1D0Dl9S

Imagine being kicked off an airplane because you have cancer.

That's the nightmare one California woman said she experienced on an Alaska Airlines flight back to San Jose, and she posted video of the incident to Facebook. Elizabeth Sedway, 51, said she was ordered off the flight because she did not have a doctor's note clearing her to fly.

Being forced off the plane meant Sedway could miss two chemotherapy appointments for her multiple myeloma, she said.

An airline spokeswoman said the company was very sorry for how the situation was handled, and that Sedway's tickets were refunded and the cost of her overnight accommodations would be covered. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CRnjz6

Dozens of passengers banded together to save a 70-year-old woman after she became trapped when her foot got caught between a subway train and platform in Russia.

This surveillance video of the incident shows the commuters rocking the train back and forth in the rescue attempt.

They were ultimately successful in their efforts to free her.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1InQWfY

A Santa Ana man convicted of sodomizing a 3-year-old girl was given less than half the minimum 25 year sentence after the judge determined there "was no violence or callous disregard for (the victim's) well-being."

Prosecutors said Kevin Jonas Rojano-Nieto, 20, sodomized the girl and forced her to touch his penis when the toddler wandered into a garage where he was playing video games.

The judge considered the full sentence to be cruel and unusual punishment. 

"Although serious and despicable, this does not compare to a situation where a pedophilic child predator preys on an innocent child," Superior Court Judge M. Marc Kelly said. "The manner in which this offense was committed is not typical of a predatory, violent brutal sodomy of a child case."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1MYIBmr
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Disturbing video captures a woman hitting a crying 3-year-old in the face with what appears to be a tablet in a Victorville parking lot.

A man decided to film the woman, identified by police as 39-year-old Yvonne Camargo, after allegedly seeing her pull the child out of a Khol's store by his hair.

The boy was examined for injuries by a sheriff's deputy and officials plan to submit the case to the DA's office.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1abhHFS

Police in Oklahoma found about $30,000 worth of methamphetamine inside an unexpected container â€” a stuffed Easter Bunny.

One pound of the drug was recovered after authorities received a tip and intercepted a package that was set to be delivered to a home in Tahlequah.

A resident was arrested after she admitted her intent to redistribute the meth to another person, investigators said.

The discovery is "not the prize egg that we want in Tahlequah," the city's chief of police said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1MVSUre

Hundreds of rowdy University of Kentucky fans took to the streets after the Wildcats lost to the University of Wisconsin-Madison Badgers in the NCAA men's basketball tournament.

Several small fires were ignited during the unruliness, which broke out after the Wildcats' seasonlong win-streak was broken.

"Obviously everybody here wanted Kentucky to win, but they lost, man," said one witness. "There's nothing much to say. This place is crazy. They're rioting."

Thirty-one people were arrested, according to authorities in Lexington.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CryISy

A burglar's daring escape was recently captured on the homeowner's surveillance cameras.

The accused 19-year-old - who stole $6,000 in cash, electronics, and a van - can be seen driving the vehicle through a closed gate, causing it to swing open and injure the victim.

The burglar then rams the stolen van into the victim's vehicle several times, at one point appearing to almost drove over a portion of it.

The alleged burglar was eventually arrested and the stolen property was returned.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1yNpqjE

An edited image that shows an Oklahoma man standing with his young family has gone viral.

Lane Smith was fatally injured in a boating accident in July 2014, when Sierra Sharry was eight months pregnant.

Later, when she had professional photos taken of herself and their 6-month-old son, she felt they were not quite whole.

Sharry asked the photographer if she could somehow create an image of the family together. The result is a poignant photo that has been shared more than 28,000 times on Facebook.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1IzcaEt

"We saw this girl bare naked, in the parking lot," a witness told KTLA after finding a 2-year-old who had been abducted hours earlier in Gardena. 

The toddler was with her mother at a car wash when someone snatched her, held her captive and injured her.

Police believe the kidnapper drove a white Nissan Altima, described as a 2008 to 2012 four-door model, with tinted windows. It's unknown if it has license plates.

"Share" this post to alert others.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1DuyX6m

As a 12-year-old recovers from gunshot wounds and seeing his mother killed in front of him, loved ones gathered to honor the woman.

"She was a happy person ... and to hear that her laughing took her life away is just unbelievable," one co-worker said at the vigil in Hawthorne.

Police say Denise Berry and her son noticed someone in a Cadillac with his feet hanging out of the window, and chuckled about it. They were then followed and shot.

No other connections between the shooter and Denise have been found.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1D1qFAT

An inexperienced sailor who was lost at sea for 66 days says he survived by eating raw fish he caught with his bare hands and drinking rainwater, all while praying and reading the bible. 

The 37-year-old was reunited with his father Thursday after going missing in January when his sailboat capsized a few miles off South Carolina's coast.

"He's got very strong constitution and (is strong) not only physically, but spiritually," the sailor's father said. "And he told me on the phone that he was praying the whole time, so I believe that sustained him a great deal."

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1DuIlHm

Who needs a dentist when you have a dad with a muscle car and a willing 8-year-old boy?

Video of a Florida father's unique approach to removing his son's loose tooth has gone viral.

Robert Abercrombie posted the video to YouTube.

It shows his son with a string tied around his tooth just seconds before Abercrombie revs the engine of his Chevy Camaro and speeds off with his son's tooth in tow.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1BSpzDA
Love or lust? Salem l WGN America season 2 premieres Sunday at 10 p.m. on our partner WGN America.

An NYPD detective faces a suspension after video of him going on an expletive-filled tirade against an Uber driver went viral. 

In the video, the irate detective tells the driver he has committed "three traffic and law violations" then yells at him and mocks his accent. 

The altercation began when the Uber driver gestured to the detective in an unmarked car to use his blinker after he was allegedly attempted to park without using it, according to the passenger who filmed the incident. 

Read KTLA's story here: www.ktlane.ws/1MzW0B0

After discovering a panhandler wearing a uniform had never served in the military, Army veteran Garrett Goodwin decided to confront him over his deception. 

"Take off my uniform," Goodwin demanded when the Florida panhandler couldn't prove he was a veteran on Sunday. 

"I'm about public safety, public service and when it comes to the military, seeing people in uniform that ... we bled, sweat, cried and burned through, it disgusts me," he explained to a local TV station. 

Click here to read KTLA's story: www.ktlane.ws/1BI8riY

A special needs student at a Kansas high school is being asked to stop wearing his varsity letter jacket.

Michael Kelley has Down syndrome and autism. His mother bought him the jacket after he was recognized for his playing extra-curricular special needs basketball.

But district officials say only members of varsity teams are allowed to wear varsity letter jackets.

Michael's situation has attracted attention on social media. More than 40,000 people have signed a Change.org petition asking the district to change its policy.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1HgBP4n
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Two passers-by are being called "superheroes" after getting out of their car and chasing after a man who allegedly stole an 82-year-old woman's purse as she was walking home from church on Sunday in La Habra.

The good deed was caught on surveillance camera, but the identities of the good Samaritans are still unknown.

Police are hoping someone will recognize the two men so they can be properly thanked.

"Share" to spread the word.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1DhJQa2

Asked about his good friend and costar Paul Walker, actor Vin Diesel became so emotional during a sit-down on-camera interview that he got up and walked away. 

Walker, who died in a fiery car crash in November 2013, will appear alongside Diesel in "Furious 7," which is set to come out this week.

"I just hope he's watching," Diesel said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1GHhIhC

Disturbing video shows a firefighter falling through the roof of a burning home in Fresno, in an incident that left him badly burned.

Fellow firefighters ripped off the house's garage door and rescued their colleague within three minutes.

The 25-year-veteran suffered second- and third-degree burns to about 50 percent of his body. He remained in critical condition Monday.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1G1Be9I

Four years after an Orange County paramedic helped rescue the doctor who saved his life as a baby, the two reunited at a fundraiser benefiting children with cancer.  

Chris Trokey was among the first responders who aided Dr. Michael Shannon when he was trapped in a fiery wreck. However, it wasn't until he was at the hospital that he realized the victim was his former pediatrician who saved him three decades earlier.

When Trokey was born, he weighed just 3.2 pounds and doctors had initially gave him a 50/50 chance at surviving. Had it not been for Dr. Shannon's round-the-clock care, he might not have lived. 

On Sunday, the two were among 30 people who shaved their heads and raised $12,000 at the fundraiser benefiting St. Baldrick's charity.

Watch KTLA's video here: www.ktlane.ws/1BV2dfj

A Colorado Rottweiler named Brutus was maimed by his breeder, who amputated the dog's feet after he contracted frostbite.

But now Brutus is learning to get around with the help of four custom-made prosthetic limbs, provided by Orthopets of Denver.

"He's able to walk in them. It's not always pretty," says his foster mom, Laura Aquilina. "We want to be able to give him a higher function, where he can run and play with other dogs, go on hikes."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1ONJLj4

Thousands of screaming fans descended on a Downey shopping mall where pro skateboarders Steven Fernandez and Keelan Dadd were scheduled to hold an autograph signing.

The size of the crowd prompted the cancellation of the event, and the mall was closed for more than an hour as police escorted fans off the property.

"Da event got shut down cuz it was over 3500 people here and da out side of da mall was so packed . . . cops and helicopters came and shut it down," Fernandez said later on Instagram.  "I'm so sorry to all those who came out."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1yooulE

A 16-year-old girl who was brutally attacked by a group of skateboarders in Venice Beach says she may not have survived the beating had it not been for a stranger who used her body to shield the teen.  

"If it wasn't for her, Lord knows what they would be doing to me," Brooklyn Smith said of the woman who came to her aid. "They were hurting her too â€¦ because she was screaming."

The victim told KTLA she was hit in the back of the head with a skateboard, and she and her boyfriend were repeatedly punched and kicked Thursday night. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1GyOHVi

A 4-year-old girl walked away from her Pennsylvania home shortly before 3 a.m., determined to satisfy her craving for a slushie.

Surveillance footage shows young Annabelle stepping onto a public bus as the startled driver and passengers look on.

After police were called, the girl explained she was on the hunt for a frozen treat.

Officers responded, escorted her off the bus and reunited her with her parents.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1HUSNIU

A news cameraman was filming as he tried to awaken an allegedly intoxicated driver who passed out in her locked car on a San Diego freeway. 

Moments later, a California Highway Patrol officer arrived and tried to revive the woman. Unable to do so, he smashed the vehicle's passenger-side window as it began to roll forward.

He then opened the door, reached in and activated the emergency brake.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1xHPhP7

An empowering photo of a mother of three in a bikini that was posted on Facebook along with a message encouraging women to "flaunt that body with pride" has gone viral. 

Rachel Hollis, an author and founder of the website The Chic, posted the picture of herself along with a message of self-love that she hoped would inspire many, especially mothers coming to terms with their post-baby physique. 

"I wear a bikini because I'm proud of this body and every mark on it. Those marks prove that I was blessed enough to carry my babies and that flabby tummy means I worked hard to lose what weight I could," she wrote. "They aren't scars ladies, they're stripes and you've earned them." 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1EelaAQ
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Empire actress Taraji P. Henson has apologized for accusing officers of racial profiling hours video showing an encounter between Glendale police and her20-year-old son was released. 

"I would like to publicly apologize to the officer and the Glendale Police Department," she wrote on Instagram. "A mother's job is not easy and neither is a police officer's â€¦ Thank you to that officer for being kind to my son."

The officer seen in the video can be heard telling Marcell Henson he won't cite him for the original infraction because it would have a lasting effect on his driving record. Instead, he cited the young man for possessing marijuana after checking his car. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1IFnwaB

An 87-year-old woman was leaving church when she was run over by the driver of a late-model silver Infiniti SUV who made a U-turn, possibly coming back to look at what he had hit, and then sped off, according to LAPD.

Barbara Summerfield remains in critical condition with a brain injury, unable to breathe on her own, after the March 16 hit-and-run in a busy intersection near USC. 

Her family pleaded for help finding the driver, and police are offering a $50,000 reward in the case.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1xitE7r

A bus driver is being praised for escorting students off a bus that erupted in flames outside a middle school in Rancho Santa Margarita.

No one was injured in the blaze, which was extinguished by Orange County firefighters within 15 minutes.

Witness videos showed dramatic flames and at least two explosions before the fire was knocked down.

The cause of the incident was not immediately known.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BtVARi

Many registered sex offenders in California can now live closer to schools after the state Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation decided to loosen a key provision of Jessica's Law, which forbid all sex offenders from living within 2,000 feet of a school or park.

The decision comes nine years after California voters approved the controversial law, named after Jessica Lunsford, who was abducted from her bed in Florida in 2005, raped and buried alive while clutching her stuffed dolphin by a sex offender living nearby.

The California Supreme Court ruled earlier this month that the strict provisions of the law made it too difficult for some sex offenders to find a place to live and violated their constitutional rights.

What do you think of the decision?

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BORGCs
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Update: An explosion rocked New York City's East Village on Thursday, leveling part of a building and leaving at least 12 people injured, four of them critically.

Video from the New York City Fire Department (FDNY) shows smoke rising from shell of the seven-story building as firefighters work to contain the blaze.

More than 250 firefighters are on the scene, and authorities are searching for anyone who may have been trapped.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BOFvW9

Authorities are investigating after a video was posted on Facebook showing a man driving with a Great Horned Owl and an apparent bottle of alcohol.

"3am in the morning, we are drunk. and we are high. we bout to take this thing home and eat it up. just found it on the road," the Facebook post says.

The Great Horned Owl is a federally protected animal.

A wildlife official who viewed the video said: "To me the concern is where the owl is now, what happened to the owl, did anybody cause harm to the owl."

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/19nLYka

Update: A swarm of bees on a neighboring property is believed to have killed three Australian shepherds at a Santa Ana home. 

"It's surreal, it is heartbreaking, it's devastating," the owner said after discovering her dogs' bodies, which were covered with bees Wednesday. 

Investigators think the dogs were barking at a neighbor's pool man, which disturbed the bees and caused them to attack. 

Local animal control officials said they'd never seen anything like it. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Ozgh8h

The Most Interesting Man in the World â€” or rather, a cardboard cutout of the Dos Equis pitchman â€” couldn't help a Washington driver get out of a ticket for driving alone in an HOV lane.

A state trooper recognized the object as a prop and not a passenger, and pulled over the motorist on the 5 Freeway outside Tacoma, authorities said.

A spokesperson for the Washington State Patrol later tweeted: "I don't always violate the HOV lane law...but when I do, I get a $124 ticket! We'll give him an A for creativity!"

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1E07yZK

BREAKING: The alleged kidnapping for ransom of a Huntington Beach woman in the Bay Area was an "orchestrated" event, police in Vallejo announced Wednesday, just hours after Denise Huskins was found back in Southern California.

Read KTLA's updated story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FVfpqE

Original post:

A woman from Huntington Beach has been kidnapped for ransom from her boyfriend's Bay Area home, family and officials have said. 

"Don't hurt her, please don't hurt her," her father begged after learning of her disappearance. "The biggest fear is the horror she might be going through. That's my biggest fear. She doesn't deserve that, not from anybody."

The boyfriend is not currently a suspect. Police are asking for anyone with information to come forward.

"Share" this post to alert others.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1EEX9xF

Dramatic dashcam video captured the moment when a truck tumbled off a ramp and onto the middle of a busy Toronto highway during the afternoon rush hour. 

After falling from the ramp, the tractor-trailer crash landed upside-down before rolling onto its side and hitting two other vehicles, video from CTV News showed. 

Amazingly, the truck driver â€“ who sustained minor injuries in the serious crash â€“ was the only one hurt. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1HxuCg1

Angelina Jolie has removed her ovaries and fallopian tubes, two years after having a double mastectomy, in an effort to drastically lower her chances of getting cancer. 

She chose to undergo surgery after blood tests revealed she is at high risk for getting breast and ovarian cancer. 

"I went through what I imagine thousands of other women have felt," she wrote in an op-ed published Tuesday. "It is not easy to make these decisions. ... You can seek advice, learn about the options and make choices that are right for you. Knowledge is power."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1HvIszL

A 22-year-old man says he's grateful and overwhelmed by the response to his graphic and emotional video exposing his body after losing 270 pounds.

After receiving lap band surgery six years ago, Matt Diaz lost half his body weight, leaving him with excess folds of skin all over his body.

In an effort to raise money for skin removal surgery, Diaz went public with his personal battle with his body image.

"I think it's important that I'm not ashamed about who I am because I worked really hard to get here," Diaz said in the video. 

"I still don't have the body that I want but I'm trying really hard to love myself."

Watch KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BohNA0

Maria Uriostegui says it's a "miracle" she survived being run over in a restaurant parking lot by four people trying to skip out on paying their bill.

The waitress and mother of two said she went into the parking lot to try to get their license plate. Uriostegui saw the car driving toward her and suddenly realized they were not going to stop. She tried to jump out of the way but says it was too late.

"It's a miracle. I'm very blessed to be here today," Uriostegui said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1xrDsw6

Loved ones gathered to remember a 20-year-old man who was killed when he was struck by a dump truck while skateboarding down a mountain road in the Angeles National Forest north of San Dimas. 

"Eric was just one of those people who just welcomed everybody. â€¦ It didn't matter, especially in his heart, he would be just so inclusive to anybody," one friend said at Sunday's vigil. 

Eric Pederson is survived by his parents, brother and longtime girlfriend.

No charges have been filed in connection to Friday's deadly collision.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1EBZuJz

When Colorado police officers Billy Sawyer and Phil Piotrowski responded to a 911 call from a pregnant woman who was stabbed and had her fetus ripped out, they weren't prepared for what they would see.

"She was covered from head to toe in blood," Sawyer said. "So I put some gloves on and held her hand and went through where her injuries were."

Michelle Wilkins, 26, was attacked when she responded to a Craigslist ad about baby clothes for sale.

The fetus died, but the mother survived and is in critical but stable condition.

The suspect, 34-year-old Dynel Lane, is being held on $2 million bail.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CK2dEh

Photos of a Kentucky woman have gone viral after she finished a 10K race with the help of her son and and a Louisville police officer.

Asia Ford, who has lost 217 pounds over the last two years, had just over a mile to go when she began to have doubts about finishing the event.

That's when Lt. Aubrey Gregory got out of his vehicle and approached her.

He took Ford's hand, as did her son Terrance, and the trio crossed the finish line together.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FrsZDo

A 12-year-old Colorado girl is accused of twice attempting to poison her mother after the woman took away the girl's smartphone.

When the alleged victim smelled bleach in a water carafe in her bedroom, she confronted the girl. "Her daughter told her that she was trying to kill her for taking her iPhone," a Boulder County sheriff's official said.

The woman had noticed a bleach smell in her smoothie two days earlier.

The 12-year-old was being held at a juvenile center on suspicion of attempted first-degree murder.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FPwO3Q

Fifty-seven dogs and puppies were shipped to San Francisco after being rescued from a dog meat farm in South Korea.

The animals â€” beagles, poodles, Korean jindos and other breeds â€” will soon be available for adoption, Humane Society International said.

The dogs were kept in small, dirty cages, which were crowded and exposed to all weather conditions, according to The San Francisco SPCA.

"They deserve to spend the rest of their lives in loving homes," an SPCA official said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1xbgkS4

A devastated San Fernando Valley woman says she's barely slept since her service dog went missing nearly a week ago. 

"He's definitely more than just a family pet. â€¦We're very bonded with him," Barbara Borah said. "It's heartbreaking."

Rocky, a 2-year-old border collie, helps Barbara with mobility issues, but they really depend on each other. Rocky takes medication daily, and Barbara says she's worried for his safety.

"Share" this post to alert others.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Ezr7Df

Cellphone video captured the terrifying moments after a man ran through a New Orleans airport, attacking people with a machete and wasp spray. 

One TSA agent used luggage to block the machete as he was chased through the airport. A police officer then shot the knife-wielding man three times. 

Several people were injured, but miraculously no one died. 

Richard White, a 62-year-old taxi driver who recently received his chauffeur license, was identified as the alleged attacker.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DHjMpY

Police are hoping someone can identify the hit-and-run driver that struck an 87-year-old woman as she was walking in a marked crosswalk in broad daylight at a busy intersection near USC.

Surveillance video shows a silver late-model Infiniti SUV striking the woman in the intersection of Adams Boulevard and Figueroa Street on Monday.

The driver sped away, but then made a U-turn and drove past the woman again as she was lying critically injured in the street. 

"Share" to alert others.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Ex1zJw

Caught on camera: An armed man disguised as Darth Vader robbed a North Carolina credit union earlier this week.  

The man entered the building Monday wearing a mask, gloves and chest plate similar to those worn by the Star Wars villain. He got away with thousands of dollars, authorities say. 

"This is definitely something unusual that you don't see every day in law enforcement," a Pineveille police lieutenant said. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1xeBn6J

A pregnant stingray, measuring 8 feet across and 14 feet long, could be the largest freshwater fish ever found.

Scientists working with Jeff Corwin's show "Ocean Mysteries" found the giant stingray in Thailand.

Researchers estimate she weighs between 600 and 800 pounds and is between between 35 and 40 years old.

The stingray is pregnant with two fetuses and was released back into the wild unharmed, Corwin's posted on his Facebook page.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1GmpYkJ

Passengers aboard a United Airlines flight stepped in and restrained a man who allegedly rushed at the plane's cockpit screaming, "jihad, jihad" on Tuesday. 

Cellphone video that captured the aftermath of the incident and was posted to YouTube showed the man being held down by passengers as the airplane turned back to Washington D.C.  

As he sobbed, "I'm sorry," another passenger could be heard telling him, "You're OK. We're going to get you off this plane, buddy."

The man was taken to a local hospital for evaluation, an official said. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Emw2au

Police in Glendale are hoping someone will recognize one of the burglars caught on surveillance video inside an optical store.

At least seven burglars are wanted for stealing thousands of dollars worth of merchandise in what appeared to be an organized break-in.

Some of the burglar's faces can be seen on the video. 

"Share" to spread the word.

Watch KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FrMk5K

There's a new way to watch KTLA. With Watchup, you pick your favorite channels and topics, and the app creates a custom newscast just for you. 

It's available for download on iOS, Android, Xbox 360 and Amazon devices.

As the search continues for an LAPD officer considered a "person of interest" in the shooting death of Salome Rodriguez Jr., family and friends gathered at a vigil for him.

"I can't even cry today, because you know what? I know he's with God," the victim's mother said.

Family say Rodriguez was shot five times after an altercation in Pomona. Investigators are searching for a missing LAPD officer in connection to the killing, but have not said what the officer's connection to it is.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1x7Y24w

Stunning video taken from a small camera strapped to an eagle's back captured its record-setting dive from the world's tallest building Saturday. 

This edited video shows the breathtaking bird's-eye view of the eagle as it swooped down from the Burj Khalifa in Dubai and landed safely on the arm of its trainer. 

Freedom Conservation organized the event as a way to raise awareness of the endangered bird. 

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://ktlane.ws/19mVjcY

Most L.A. Marathon runners receive applause at the end of the grueling 26.2-mile race, but one woman got an unexpected proposal from her trainer.

"I said to her, 'I want to give you something, will you marry me?' â€¦ And that's when I got down on one knee and handed her the ring," the trainer told KTLA, which happened to be at the right place at the right time to catch the moment on camera.

Needless to say, she said yes.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1AIzpq2

Dramatic body cam video captured the frantic moments of first responders rescuing a Utah toddler who hung upside down for 14 hours after her mother's car crashed and flipped into a frigid river. 

When they found Lily, she was suffering from hypothermia and wasn't breathing. They rushed the 18-month-old to a hospital ER for treatment. 

A week after being rescued, police report that Lily "seems to be doing great." 

Authorities have credited the toddler's car seat for saving her life in the crash, which claimed the life of her 25-year-old mother. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1AE6xzd

A wild motorcycle pursuit through a shopping mall in Canada was captured on surveillance video.

The video shows the motorcyclist as he winds through the streets of Surrey and then, to the astonishment of police, into Guildford Town Centre mall.

Stunned shoppers can be seen dodging the bike as it plunges down an escalator and through glass sliding doors with mall security in pursuit.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1HSVJmx

Is this photo patriotic or offensive? 

When Vanessa Hicks, a Navy veteran, posted this picture of a newborn baby being held in an American flag by a sailor, she thought it was patriotic. 

Instead, she says she became the victim of cyber bullying after a Facebook photography page shared the photo, then accused her of desecrating the flag and "dishonoring our fallen soldiers."

"When I look at this picture, I see a man who has served six years in our Navy, the mother of this child is prior Army," Hicks said. "The flag, the uniform, that baby. Exactly what every service member is out there fighting."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/18eVohx

Disturbing cellphone video surfaced Wednesday showing a 15-year-old girl inside a Brooklyn McDonald's being savagely beaten by four other teenagers while onlookers do nothing to help.

The video shows dozens of young people inside the crowded restaurant when the attack began. Not only did no one come to the victim's aid, many of the onlookers can actually be heard cheering on the attackers.

Police hope to use the video to identify the teenagers involved in the fight.

Watch KTLA;s video here: http://ktlane.ws/18C16Km

Just blocks from the apartment where he cared for his mother, Elias Aceves was crossing the street near USC in a clearly designated crosswalk when he was mowed down by the driver of black sedan.

The 58-year-old was thrown 70 feet as the car sped away, and he died at the hospital Tuesday night. Now LAPD, which released this video, is asking for help finding the hit-and-run driver.

"He didn't even stop at all, or even slow down," said Aceves' nephew. "I feel sorry for my grandmother. She lives a block away â€¦ so she's going to pass by here every day."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BqM4md

A naked man smashed head-first through the closed rear window of minivan in Anaheim during a bizarre incident that was captured by surveillance cameras.

The man then ran after a nearby car as a terrified woman attempted to drive away. He jumped on the hood of the vehicle and was thrown off after it grazed the minivan.

Garrett Smith was later arrested on suspicion of being under the influence, vandalism and resisting arrest, police said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BpO2U1

Utah lawmakers voted Tuesday to bring back the firing squad as a method of execution.

The bill establishes firing squads as a backup form of execution in case the primary method of lethal injection is unavailable.

What do you think?

Chilling surveillance video shows a man attempting to kidnap a boy in Washington as the victim's young sister gives chase.

The 22-month-old boy was taken from a park in Sprague, where he was reportedly playing unsupervised with his brother and sister, ages 10 and 8.

The kidnapper dropped the toddler in a vacant lot before getting away.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1F7dOOe

A fraternity has shut down its University of Oklahoma chapter after a disturbing video showed members singing a racist chant that used the n-word.

Sigma Alpha Epsilon suspended all of the Oklahoma chapter's members and threatened to ban those responsible for life.

In the video, the students are heard chanting, "There will never be a n----- in SAE. You can hang him from a tree, but he'll never sign with me."

"If the video is indeed of OU students, this behavior will not be tolerated and is contrary to all of our values. We are investigating," the university's president said in a statement.

About 2,500 people â€” and 22 caribou â€” took to the streets of Anchorage for the annual running of the reindeer.

The beloved event is an answer of sorts to Spain's running of the bulls, but without the danger of being gored.

The Alaska race is part of the Fur Rondy festival and helped raise money for Toys for Tots.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1aVE6rt

At least eight partygoers were injured, including one person who was impaled in the leg by a piece of wood, when a roof collapsed Saturday morning. 

More than 1,000 college-age people were celebrating St. Patrick's Day a bit early when the weight of about 30 to 40 people standing on a garage structure's roof caused it to collapse near Cal Poly San Luis Obispo. 

A "mass-casualty incident" was declared and some seven local agencies assisted in clearing the area and stopping the "unruly behavior," according to the San Luis Obispo Police Department. 

The conditions of those hospitalized is not yet known. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1EpEtHc

An unexpected stowaway was discovered by a TSA agent inside a checked suitcase at LaGuardia Airport in New York.

The suitcase set off an alarm when it was being screened, triggering a manual inspection. When the security officer looked inside, he found a white-and-beige Chihuahua staring back at him.

The TSA was able to track down the owner, who claimed the dog must have jumped into the bag while she was packing.

Six-year-old cancer patient Ella Schultz had a simple wish: a playhouse in the backyard of her Missouri home. But the local homeowners association said the playhouse could not be built because it violated regulations.

The association was adamant, despite Make-A-Wish Missouri's offer to build the small structure, which a construction company designed free of charge.

After people from all over the world wrote letters and sent emails, the Stonegate Homeowners Association finally reversed its decision.

"The one thing she wanted, they were going to move mountains like I was wanting to, to make it happen," Ella's dad, Pete Schultz, said. "She'll be able to have friends over, which she is really looking forward to that."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1aQjNM1

A family visiting a safari park in South Africa learned a memorable lesson about locking their car door when they almost found themselves taking on a hitchhiking lioness.

While the family stopped to take pictures of lion pride at the park, one of the big cats used the opportunity to wander over to the car. 

She managed to pop open the car door with her teeth at stick her head inside before the stunned family managed to get the door closed.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1H3fTtK

A recent fist fight at a Lancaster nail salon that ended with an arrest allegedly began when the shop's owner refused to paint a customer's 1-year-old-daugther's nails. 

After her request was refused, Tawana Davis is accused of grabbing bottles of polish to paint the toddler's nails herself. Salon owner Kathy Nguyen intervened and tried to take the polish away, at which point she said things got physical and she was injured.  

Davis was later arrested on suspicion of robbery and released from jail after posting bail, according to the L.A. County Sheriff's Department. She says she plans to sue the salon and hopes to get the charges against her dropped.

An amateur photographer captured a once-in-a-lifetime image of a weasel riding on the back of a woodpecker in flight.

Martin Le-May was walking with his wife near London when he took the remarkable photograph.

Le-May says the weasel likely attacked the woodpecker who was fighting for its life by taking to the air. The woodpecker won the fight. 

After a few seconds, the weasel lost its grip and the bird flew away.

A dog who found himself in a bit of a tight spot was rescued Sunday by L.A. County firefighters.

The canine somehow got himself wedged in a six to seven inch gap between a house and a retaining wall in West Hollywood.

Using ropes and a wiggling motion, firefighters were able to free the dog and return him to his owner.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/18HpPhh

Video that has quickly gone viral shows a skydiving student experiencing a seizure during a free fall about 9,000 feet above the ground. 

Christopher Jones, 22, survived the terrifying incident, and has described the "near death experience" as "possibly the scariest moment of my life." 

Jones has epilepsy, and said he thought he was OK to jump since he had not had a seizure in four years. 

The video shows a fellow skydiver deploying Jones' parachute, which instructors say would have deployed as a safety precaution anyways. 

In any case, Jones says he no longer plans on pursuing a skydiving career.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Cjc1FW

Actress Michelle Rodriguez has apologized after saying racial minorities should "stop stealing all the white people's superheroes."

She made the initial comments when TMZ asked her about the rumor that she might be cast as the Green Lantern.

Rodriguez later took to Facebook, where she elaborated on her statement and said she has "a tendency to speak without a filter."

"Sorry about that," she said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1aIm3VG

LAPD officers shot and killed a homeless man during a confrontation on skid row that was captured on video.

Police used a Taser on the man before opening fire several times, according to witnesses and officials. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

Authorities had responded to the location after a report of a robbery. The shooting occurred after a struggle over an officer's handgun, according to the Los Angeles Police Department.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FLPAXH

BREAKING: Firefighters extinguished a fire that broke out near the iconic It's a Small World ride at Disneyland.  There were no immediate reports of injuries.

A tree caught fire in a backstage area adjacent to the ride, a spokeswoman for the theme park said. Anaheim firefighters responded and knocked down the flames in about 30 minutes.

It's a Small World was not damaged in the incident, the spokeswoman said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DF2KWP

Four people were lucky to be alive after an SUV rolled over five times in a wild crash that was caught on dashcam video.

The 23-year-old driver and two passengers, including a 5-year-old boy who suffered two broken legs, were ejected from the vehicle. Another passenger was not thrown from the SUV.

Authorities in Kentucky, where the interstate crash occurred outside Cincinnati, said the incident should be a reminder to wear seat belts.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Ey4R0i

The usual crashing ocean waves off the Massachusetts coast turned into nearly-frozen "Slurpee surf" recently. 

That's how surfer Jonathan Nimerfroh referred to the slow-moving waves of slush he photographed off Nantucket Beach last Friday. 

Nimerfroh said he returned the next day to take more pictures, but the water had frozen into a sheet of ice. "Nothing was moving," he said. "There were no waves anymore."

What color is this dress? Some people are describing it as white and gold, while others say blue and black.

The simple question became a hot topic online Thursday after a woman posted the pic to her Tumblr account and it went viral. 

Within a few hours, the image surpassed 200,000 likes on Tumblr and was referenced in five out of 10 trending topics in the Los Angeles area.

A police officer has been placed on paid leave after he was caught on cellphone video pushing a 58-year-old homeless man to the ground and then slapping him in the face.

The confrontation allegedly began when the off-duty Fort Lauderdale officer tried to get the homeless man to leave a bus terminal where he had been found sleeping on a bench.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1zJxT7w

An explosion disintegrated a New Jersey home as workers were trying to fix a gas leak Tuesday. The blast, which left 15 people injured, was recorded on an officer's dashcam. 

Six firefighters, two EMS workers and seven gas company workers were injured in the explosion but are all expected to recover.

"I saw one of my guys get knocked to the ground. Something I never want to experience again," the volunteer fire department chief said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1wp2fk3

After a degenerative disease stole his eyesight a decade ago, a Minnesota man can once again see the smiles on the faces of his family, including his ten grandchildren.

A camera was rolling as Allen Zderad saw his wife for the first time in 10 years.

Zderad suffers from retinitis pigmentosa, but with the help of an eye implant doctors are able to bypass his damage retina and send images directly to his optic nerve.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/18j2UJ2

Dramatic video recorded just moments after a Metrolink train slammed into a truck that was stopped on the tracks in Oxnard Tuesday morning shows the fiery wreckage that was left behind. 

Twenty-eight people were hospitalized, four in critical condition, as a result of the collision, which left derailed the Metrolink train.

The driver of a vehicle involved in the wreck fled the scene and was later located and taken into custody. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/17u4NRX

Update: A rare tornado swirled through western Kern County Monday, prompting witnesses to whip out their phones and document it.

The National Weather Service confirmed the "cold-core funnel cloud" touched down near an area called Blackwell's Corner, 45 miles from Bakersfield and about 135 miles from downtown L.A. It lasted about 10 minutes and was 150 feet wide.

The weak tornado came as a winter storm that brought snow and rain to SoCal was making its way out of the region.

A terrifying moment for two people who stepped off a bus in South Korea was captured on video. 

The man and woman were walking across a patch of tiles on a sidewalk when the ground suddenly gave way. 

The two disappeared as they plummeted into a sinkhole nearly 10 feet deep, but luckily they were not seriously injured. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1LyI9H9

Authorities are asking for the public's help in finding the driver of a "party bus" that struck a 26-year-old husband and father in a Norwalk hit-and-run.

The victim was dragged more than 200 feet by the bus before it drove away, with neon lights flashing and music playing inside, the L.A. County Sheriff's Department said.

Efren Virgen was taken to St. Francis Hospital in Lynwood, where he remained in critical condition.

"Share" this to alert others.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1FikbMl

An SUV crashed on a busy road in Chicago, trapping the 17-year-old driver inside and igniting a fire.

Several good Samaritans thought they had extinguished the flames that erupted as they worked to extricated the teenager. But the fire flared up again as rescuers pulled the driver to safety.

Firefighters arrived at the scene and knocked down the blaze.

The driver was taken to a hospital with injuries that were not life-threatening.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1LvMT0k

Kai Rizzuto and his grandfather were fishing in waters off the coast of Hawaii when the teenager hooked the catch of a lifetime â€” a 1,058-pound blue marlin.

It took 30 minutes to reel in the massive fish and four people to lift it into the charter boat.

"This fish came to the boat dead, upside down on its back, there was no chance of reviving it," Rizzuto said. "By and large, we try and release every blue marlin we can as a conservation measure, but sometimes in a hard fight the fish dies and there is nothing you can do."

Instead, the fish will be used for food, he said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CXvSph

Not everyone loves snow, but these two adorably playful red pandas were certainly excited by the recent snowfall in Ohio. 

This viral video shows 2-year-old Lin and 9-year-old Rover frolicking around the mounds of white powder that blanketed the Cincinnati Zoo and Botanical Gardens this week. 

The zoo was closed Saturday as more snow was forecast to the hit the area. 

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://ktlane.ws/1zvkP5G

Amazing video shows that even a wall of snow is no match for a hungry cat.

At least not for one clever cat in Quebec named Plume. He proves that even at the age of 14, nothing stands between him and dinner, not even an icy snowbank.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1AZuaXY

An 86-year-old woman who had just won $250 at bingo stepped away from her bag just long enough to tip the bingo caller. 

It was only a few seconds, but it was long enough for another player to grab the woman's purse and make off with her winnings. 

The brazen theft, caught on surveillance camera, showed a fellow player, identified by Monterey Park police as Maricela Bracamontes, rushing out of the senior center with the victim's bag.

The 53-year-old Bracamontes was arrested for felony elder abuse. The victim's money was not recovered.

While much of the East Coast is blanketed in snow, a 16-story high snowboard ramp is being built outside the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, where the afternoon highs were expected to be in the 60s this weekend. 

The ramp is part of Shaun White's Air + Style sports and music event taking place Saturday and Sunday. Professional snowboarders and skiers will compete as fans are entertained by 18 live bands. 

So, while Mother Nature has failed to bring much snow to Southern California this winter, Shaun White has apparently succeeded.   

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/187VZSL

Seventeen-year-old Brady Becker says he was simply trying to defend his friend when he intervened in an altercation with two other men â€” who turned out to be sheriff's deputies â€” at a Mardis Gras parade in the New Orleans area.

A bystander's cellphone captured video of the encounter, which turned violent and left Becker with a visible eye injury.

"I had no clue he was a cop," he said. "I thought this was some random guy, you know, waving his gun at everybody."

According to an arrest report, Becker and his friend were yelling "(expletive) the cops" when they were approached by the deputies.

Becker was booked on suspicion of possession of alcohol by a minor, resisting arrest, battery on a police officer and inciting a riot.

A teenage boy's simple act of kindness captured in a photograph has generated national attention.

Teresa Adams was driving with her son Tommy when the boy saw an elderly man with a walker trying to shovel snow in front of his Virginia home.

Tommy asked his mother to pull over and jumped out to help the man.

"I try to do good for the elderly," Tommy says, "because one day I may need help too." 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/17xXVCX

An amazing picture shows an ice sculpture left behind by the front grill of a Jeep in the frigid parking lot of a medical center in North Carolina.

The person who took the photo theorized that it's likely the driver left the engine on to warm up the car.

And when the driver backed up, the ice sculpture remained because it was frozen to the curb.

Flood waters nearly filled the lower level of a home in Hollywood Hills and left several cars submerged after a nearly 90-year-old water main broke early Wednesday morning. 

The 18-inch pipe, which was installed in 1926, burst a few hundred feet from the 101 Freeway near Cahuenga Boulevard. 

Crews had trouble shutting off the flow of water because of a "sequence of valves," an LADWP spokeswoman said. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1zNWGWK

A St. Louis police officer has come under fire after disabling a dascham video during an apparently violent arrest.

Before the video was turned off, a female officer can be heard warning fellow officers that the camera was recording. It is against the St. Louis Police Department's policy to turn off the dashcam.

In a recently filed lawsuit over the April 2014 incident, Cortez Bufford alleges police used a Taser on him and that he suffered numerous injuries after being kicked by multiple police officers.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/17gmepb

A kidnapping suspect led police in Fresno on a wild pursuit across rooftops wearing nothing but his underwear and socks.

Video showed Abel Rodriguez jumping from roof to roof as neighbors shouted out his position to officers.

Police eventually took him down with a Taser.

The 29-year-old is accused of breaking into a house, holding a woman with a screwdriver to her throat and threatening to kill her.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1A4huhG

A Fullerton family had a Valentine's Day they'll never forget, and it's all because of this adorable sea lion pup that hitched a ride on their kayak during an outing in Santa Barbara.

Rodney Gist was riding with two of his young children Saturday when the sea lion plopped down on the back of the kayak, started nuzzling against him and even kissed the back of his head.

Gist admitted to being nervous at first when the animal jumped up sat down behind him, but it appeared the pup was simply looking to spread a little bit love on the romantic holiday. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1zkVNWF

Motorists got an unexpected surprise over the holiday weekend as they passed a drive-in movie theater in Sacramento playing the R-rated film "50 Shades of Grey," and could clearly see the movie.

"I'd think it's a safety issue; people trying to sneak a peek as they are going 70 miles down the freeway and looking not where they are supposed to be going, but looking at the movie," one driver said. 

The film is rated R for "strong sexual content, unusual behavior, and graphic nudity." 

Theater officials have not yet responded to questions about policies regarding sexual content being visible on its screens. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1zZnIzf

A Philadelphia couple was initially anonymous when their marriage proposal was photographed under a rainbow in the San Diego area.

After photographer Dan McGeorge spotted Robert Treml and Meghan Peart in the image, he launched an online campaign to find them.

The soon-to-be newlyweds have since come forward to tell the story of their picture-perfect moment.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/17DGMc3

A police pursuit ended in Baldwin Park when a stolen truck slammed into a tree. The two suspects, however, were not taken into custody until after officers and firefighters rescued them from a nearby wash.

As a police helicopter hovered overhead, two officers with guns drawn climbed down into the wash and detained one of the men, who had floated several blocks in the water.

The other suspect climbed a ladder to safety of his own accord.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1KZaoyC

An Alabama police officer has been arrested after this newly released dashcam video showed him forcefully slamming an unarmed grandfather to the ground. 

Officer Eric Parker now faces third degree assault charges. He has been placed on administrative leave and the Madison Police Department's chief has recommended Parker be fired. 

The Feb.6 incident left 57-year-old Sureshbhai Patel with "significant trauma to [his] cervical spine" and "partially paralyzed," according to his family, which has filed a lawsuit. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1vtSY3Y

Caught on video: A wrestling mask was the disguise of choice for a criminal who stuck a revolver in the face of a store clerk in Santa Ana.

The robber, along with an accomplice hiding behind a cap and a bandana, hit Arthur's Liquor at 7:30 p.m. Monday, police said. They wiped out the cash register and fled, slow-motion surveillance video showed.

Detectives want help from the public identifying the two masked men.

Read the full story on KTLA here: http://ktlane.ws/1AxNvPE

A Texas mother who took down an alleged carjacker after he slammed into her minivan during a high-speed police chase in Dallas says she was just trying to protect her child.

Jessica Liesmann got out of her van, grabbed the suspect and punched him several times. Her boyfriend then held him down until officers arrived.

Leismann explained that the couple had recently lost their 4-year-old son to epilepsy, and the threat to her 13-year-old son -- who was in the minivan at the time -- prompted her strong reaction.

A GoFundMe page has been set up to buy a new vehicle for Leismann, who was described on the page as a "hero" for her "act of bravery and vigilante justice."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1AfsUkx

Two people in Southern California are being treated for burns that may be linked to "exploding" e-cigarettes. 

A man in San Diego County suffered burns to his face on Sunday after fire officials say an electronic cigarette exploded.

On Tuesday, a teenager holding an e-cigarette was injured in a home explosion in Anaheim that police say may have been sparked by the electronic device.

Cellphone video captured a violent brawl in which high school students threw punches and damaged vehicles after a basketball game between highly ranked teams at Beverly Hills and Santa Monica High Schools.

Police, security guards, parents and extra lighting are expected at Tuesday night's rematch game, and SAMO's principal said she's willing to cancel all future games if attendees aren't peaceful. 

No disciplinary actions have been taken and officials are investigating if students violated the district's education code, a local school district spokeswoman said. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1DAu7SY

A terrified young mother found herself face-to-face with a desperate man with a gun who ordered her to get out of her car during a wild pursuit in South Gate.

"He was pointing the gun at me. I just got out of the car and ran," Elizabeth Yarahuan said. "I was just scared he was going to hurt me." 

The 22-year-old mother was alone in the car, but says she usually has her two little girls with her.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CbpnPt

Two years after Najee Rivera was brutally beaten on a Philadelphia street, two police officers have been charged with committing the assault â€” and attempting to cover it up.

Officers Sean McKnight and Kevin Robinson said they stopped Rivera after he ran a stop sign on his scooter, and that he resisted arrest and tried to run.

A third officer who later arrived at the scene thought Rivera had been shot, due to the amount of blood on the ground.

McKnight and Robinson were themselves arrested after Rivera's girlfriend went around to local businesses and found surveillance video of the encounter.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1yZavCx

A 13-year-old girl tearfully called 911 after her father was fatally injured in a hit-and-run crash in Maryland.

The dispatcher on the other end of the line told her to "stop whining, OK? It's hard to understand you."

Rick Warrick, who had been changing a tire when he was struck, later died of his injuries. His fiancee, who was also hurt in the collision, was hospitalized but expected to recover.

The 911 dispatcher has been reassigned pending an investigation into the call.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1KoObtm

The death toll after a plane crashed into a bridge in Taiwan continues to rise, as 18 people remain missing and 25 have been reported dead. 

Dashcam video captured the moment the plane hurtled from the sky and clipped the bridge, causing a taxi to lose control. Two people in the taxi were injured but were said to be in stable condition. 

The plane went down shortly after take off with 58 passengers, four of whom were children, on board. Some have reported the pilot appeared to try and control the plane as it descended. 

An investigation into the crash is underway. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CYKN5Y

This may be the only photograph a North Carolina couple will ever have of their son Amari after someone stole the camera containing pictures of his final moments.

An organization that takes professional photographs of newborns who will never go home from the hospital, captured the last minutes of Amari life with his parents. The newborn lived only 30 minutes.

But the next day, the camera was stolen along with the memory card containing the precious photographs. Amari's mother is begging for their return.

"Please, just give me back the last moments I had with my child."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1LKarzA

Surveillance video captured disturbing images of an armed assailant chasing after man outside a grocery store in what Covina police are calling a racially motivated attack.

After first stabbing an 18-year-old clerk at the store, police say, Louis Vasquez attacked a second man with a "large kitchen knife."

Shivering and soaking wet, a small dog was plucked out of the rain-swollen L.A. River on Friday by Los Angeles firefighters.

Rescuers say they arrived just in time. Given the frigid water temperature, Lucky might not have been able to hang on much longer.

A suspected drunk driver apparently didn't realize Main Street had come to an end when he jumped a curb and sped onto the Huntington Beach Pier earlier this week. 

The driver, identified as 27-year-old Hojin Jang, made it all the way to the end of the pier, then circled around Ruby's Diner before returning to find three police cars waiting for him. 

Luckily no pedestrians were injured in the incident, which was captured on surveillance video.

Rap mogul "Suge" Knight was arrested on suspicion of murder after allegedly running over two men â€” one fatally â€” in a hit-and-run crash in Compton.

The Death Row Records founder, who turned himself in at the L.A. County sheriff's station in West Hollywood, is being held on $2 million bail.

The second victim in the collision is recovering from his injuries.
