status_message:
A terrifying crash involving a school bus was captured in this dramatic video from a camera aboard the vehicle. 

The bus veered off the roadway and slammed into a home after it was clipped by another vehicle on Monday. 

Despite the damage, the homeowners actually called driver a hero. They told an Atlanta TV station that by driving the bus into their home, she avoided a neighboring park filled children. 

No kids were inside the bus when it crashed, and amazingly, no injuries were reported. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1tsyUkz

The words "So help me God" are no longer required during U.S. Air Force oath ceremonies after an atheist airman threatened legal action. He was not allowed to re-enlist after he refused the language.

"We take any instance in which airmen report concerns regarding religious freedom seriously," said Secretary of the Air Force Deborah Lee James. "We are making the appropriate adjustments to ensure our Airmen's rights are protected."

What do you think?

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1u4Hrvk
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Rats are infesting a Westchester neighborhood and residents believe it's because one homeowner may be feeding them.

"Let me tell you, it's terrifying. These rats are everywhere," Erik Jakobsen said as a group of rats scurried up and down his neighbor's home.

The rodents repeatedly startled residents by dropping in while they were telling us their story. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1ssDQl2

A dog named Gordo is recovering after being struck by a van during a wild police chase in South Los Angeles.

Phones were ringing nonstop at the veterinary center where the canine was treated, as donors pledged contributions to help pay for his medical care.

The outpouring of support was spurred in part by the hashtag #savethewhitedog on social media.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1srGrLX

Surveillance video captured the terrifying moment when a stroller carrying a toddler rolled off of a train platform headfirst onto the tracks. 

Several good Samaritans rushed in to help the small child, who amazingly suffered only minor injuries in the incident, which occurred over the weekend in Melbourne, Australia.  

Reports say the toddler's parents were drunk at the time. 

Read KTLA's story here: www.ktlane.ws/1r0xj4u

A group of first responders helped rescue a woman by holding up the car in which she was trapped after a rollover crash in Sylmar.

Video from the scene showed officers from the California Highway Patrol and Los Angeles Police Department, as well as two paramedics and fire department explorers, stabilizing the vehicle while another paramedic crawled underneath and extricated the driver.

The woman, who suffered only minor injuries, was then transported to a hospital.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1mcjgbK

This video perfectly captured the exact moment when a powerful bolt of lightning struck amid a dangerous thunderstorm that swept through parts of Southern California on Tuesday. 

It was shot in the Temescal Valley area of Riverside County, which was hit particularly hard by the severe weather late in the afternoon. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1BKhJ0p

This incredible time-lapse video captures what could be the vehicle of the future -- a printed 3D electric car-- as it is being "built." 

It took about 44 hours to print the "Strati," which made its debut test drive in Chicago over the weekend. 

The tiny car can reach speeds of up to 40 mph and lasts about 120 miles between charges. 

Engineers hope to bring the custom printed vehicle to market as early as next year. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1o1Oq14

Detectives are searching for more possible victims of a San Bernardino high school program director accused of having sexual relationships with two boys. 

Amy Corinne Bramlett, 46, was arrested over the weekend for allegedly having sex with a 17-year-old boy who had gone to Indian Springs High School where she worked. Detectives also discovered Bramlett may have previously had sex with a 16-year-old boy. 

Authorities released Bramlett's booking photo because they believe there may be more possible victims. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1pgX5Mr
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Django Unchained actress Daniele Watts said LAPD officers allegedly detained her because they thought she was a prostitute.

Watts, who is African-American, and her white boyfriend accused police of racism for questioning them after they were seen showing affection in public.

Officers from the North Hollywood station were responding to a citizen complaint of indecent exposure, the Police Department said in a statement.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1uO8dFd

Update: CHP officers took a driver and four passengers into custody after a lengthy pursuit that reached speeds of up to 90mph as it wound through Orange and Los Angeles counties.

A Nissan Pathfinder made its way through surface streets and transitioned among multiple highways after the chase began on the northbound 5 Freeway in Buena Park.

The pursuit ended when the SUV pulled over on the 5 Freeway in the Anaheim area. The five occupants exited the vehicle and were taken into custody without incident.

Watch KTLA's live video here: http://ktlane.ws/1xWl11Z
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Police say this man ran onto an O.C. preschool campus, entered a classroom and then brandished a 12-inch kitchen knife at a teacher who asked him to leave.

Gonzalo Parra Jr., 30, was arrested by Garden Grove police who found him in an unoccupied classroom. No students were hurt or threatened.

Parra was held on suspicion of possession of a weapon on school grounds, brandishing a deadly weapon and a parole violation for drug charges.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/ZjDqGL
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A solar storm is headed to Earth, and scientists aren't exactly sure yet what the effects will be. The burst of radiation could disrupt electric grids, radios and satellites from Friday through the weekend.

Two solar flares that exploded off the sun this week are causing the predicted geomagnetic storm. Wednesday's flare, shown in the photo, was the most intense kind.

Past solar storms have knocked out power and sent satellites tumbling out of control. There's no danger to humans, experts say.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1pU2UzA
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Do you think this photo of a sick newborn who desperately needs a heart transplant to survive is too scary, gory or sensational? Facebook did. 

They initially banned it from being used in an ad that was meant to raise awareness and money for Hudson Bond, who is currently being kept alive with the aid of an artificial heart. 

"I was really hurt... I kinda cried," Kevin Bond, the baby's father, told CNN. "That's my son. I love him. And to have someone reject a picture to me just, it's my beautiful son lying in a hospital bed needing help." 

After the story received national  attention, however,  Facebook reversed course and apologized to Bond, offering $10,000 in ads to make amends. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1oxneXY
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A baby gray whale was showing off for the cameras in Marina del Rey Tuesday. 

Not only did the wayward whale give a rare close up at a boat dock, it was also spotted floating next to a pair of swimmers. 

Officials were concerned the baby whale may have become separated from its mother and was lost, but it appeared to have moved out of the area on Wednesday. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/WGJOpk

Update: A fire that appeared to start in motor home and spread to a house in South Los Angeles has been knocked down by firefighters. 
 
The RV was fully engulfed in flames when Sky5 arrived. 

Moments later, the home and a car parked next to the RV also caught fire. 

More than 50 firefighters responded to the blaze and extinguished the flames. 

Watch KTLA's live video here: http://ktlane.ws/1wfppYj

Caught on video: After a violent confrontation was posted to YouTube with the title "Neighbors from hell," 47-year-old Laura Cox of Huntington Beach found herself behind bars.

Cox erupted in rage when her roommate blocked her truck, knocking him to the ground and then backing over his motorized scooter, prosecutors say.

Cox pleaded not guilty Tuesday to driving under the influence of methamphetamine, battery and other charges. The alleged victim said he was Cox's boyfriend and told reporters that "nothing happened."

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1tIcXPy

The peak of Colossus collapsed after a fire broke out while contractors were working to disassemble the recently closed roller coaster.  

Sky5 was overhead Six Flags Magic Mountain and captured video of the fire that ripped through this iconic, wooden ride.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1rTRDqq

BREAKING: A pool of water began to swirl beneath a collapsed portion of a street in Encino after a water main broke Monday morning. 

LADWP crews were on scene trying to shut off the 16-inch main. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1lRlY6C

Tina Cleveland and Paul Sirimarco are trying to bridge the gap between the hearing and deaf communities with a series of sign-along videos that have gone viral. 

The engaged couple from Chatsworth began posting videos of themselves interpreting popular songs into American Sign Language on YouTube in July. 

Millions have seen them, including this rendition of "You're the One That I Want" from Grease that has reached nearly 1.3 million people. 

"It's about bringing awareness to, really, the hearing world," Sirimarco said. "The hearing world needs to know that there's these beautiful, intelligent, smart, talented people that are out there and available to be part of the entire community."
 
Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1CHvMoN

A  spaghetti strainer was claimed as religious headwear in an Oklahoma woman's recently taken driver's license photo. 

"For me the colander represents freedom, our freedom of religion, and to whatever religion that we prefer, or even lack of religion," Shawna Hammond said. 

Hammond is an atheist who also claims to be part of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster, and says, "it felt good to be recognized that we can all coexist and have those equal rights."

State officials are examining the photo, which Hammond says adheres to state law.  

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1tDsMXO
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
BREAKING: Officials have released photos of LAPD Officer Erick Alcaraz, 24, who was killed when his motorcycle collided with a vehicle in an off-duty crash.

The Marine Corps veteran finished his one-year probationary period with the Los Angeles Police Department on the day of the collision, and had been scheduled to start at a new division on Sunday.

"The entire #LAPD grieves the loss of a young officer taken from us too soon," LAPD Chief Charlie Beck said on Twitter. "#Godspeed brother."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rSkJqk
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Three-year-old Rayden "Bubba" Kahae, who was born without a right hand, always wanted a prosthetic like his favorite superhero Iron Man.

The Hawaii boy got his wish when the nonprofit E-Nable paid for his new hand, which was produced by a 3-D printer.

Rayden's father captured the moment when the special delivery arrived and his son was able to hold his own hand for the first time.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1qxG2e1

Raina and Ruuxa haven't left each other's side since they became friends when they were only a few weeks old, and things didn't change when the young cheetah underwent surgery Wednesday. 

"Raina appeared very concerned about Ruuxa when she saw he was sleeping and she couldn't wake him," an animal training manager said. "She licked him and nuzzled him, and when he awoke, she lay with him and seemed very content to know her cheetah was okay."

The 4-month-old cheetah had surgery at the San Diego Zoo Safari Park to repair growth abnormalities in his limbs. He is expected to make a complete recovery. 

Watch video and read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1uE9w9M
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
"Chopper" â€” a 30-year-old, 125-pound alligator â€” has been removed from her longtime home in Rancho Cucamonga, resulting in protests from her owner and children in the neighborhood.

California Department of Fish and Wildlife officials, citing state law, confiscated the animal after a neighbor complained.

"I never had children. She is my child," said Chris Cassaro, who has owned the alligator since 1987.

"We just really want her back, so bad that it's not even funny," said Braden Zazueta, one of more than a dozen neighborhood kids who staged a sleep-in demonstration.

Read KTLA's story: http://ktlane.ws/1rhXKyE

A big cat named Little Dude is working with a foster owner to shed a few of his 33-pounds so he can be adopted into a "forever family."

His primary caretaker, an older man, likely subscribed to a "food is love" philosophy, the coordinator for WAGS Pet Adoption, where Little Dude arrived about two weeks ago, said. 

The goal is to get Little Dude down to a manageable weight before he is ready for adoption in several months, his foster owner said.

"Share" this post with others who may be interested in adopting Little Dude.

More information can be found in KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1taoIdF
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A Florida mom tracked down a suspected burglar accused of breaking into her home and stealing hundreds of dollars raised by her son's Cub Scout troop.

When the alleged thief was spotted riding a bike in Gina Pleasanton's neighborhood, she jumped in her car, called police and followed him. He was later arrested and charged with grand theft.

"It's the best feeling to catch the guy who robbed you," she said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1t8QEyB

An armed man in a wheelchair allegedly robbed a Kmart in Chula Vista, then got into a van and led officers on a lengthy pursuit that ended outside San Diego Police Headquarters, officials said.

The suspect was then taken into custody at gunpoint after a K-9 unit was deployed.

"Fortunately, he complied with our directives, but he was armed with two firearms," a police spokesman said. "He had a shoulder holster and a semi-auto handgun under his arm, and he had a small revolver that was cocked and ready to go under his leg."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1qpOT1B

A 15-year-old with autism thought he was taking the ALS ice bucket challenge â€” but instead of water, his family says a group of juveniles doused the Ohio teen with a mix of urine, feces, spit and cigarette butts.

The incident was recorded on the boy's cellphone and reportedly posted on Instagram by the group. His family chose to share the video in an effort to raise awareness of bullying.

"The bucket challenge is supposed to be raising awareness for this disease and now they've turned it into a sick joke," his mom said. "I just can't understand why kids would do something this cruel."

An investigation is underway and criminal charges may be filed, according to police.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1vPoNbE

Most people expect to be playfully insulted by someone in a dunk tank, but a clown at a Tennessee fair took things too far when he started using racial slurs.

"We heard over the loudspeaker, someone said, 'Hey, nappy head,'" said fairgoer Tanya Jones.

"He was like, 'Yeah, I'm talking to you, Sheneneh. You look unbeweavable,'" said Mario Curry.

The Delta Fair employee was later fired.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1nURBqU

Odie Garcia is battling lymphoma, but one of his dreams came true on Tuesday as he was sworn in as a deputy in San Bernardino.

During his day as deputy, Odie led academy trainees on push-up drills and was visited by members of the SWAT team. 

Odie's big day concluded with a birthday song from everyone at the station. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/Z6bAgT

BREAKING: Newly released video purports to show U.S. journalist Steven Sotloff being beheaded by ISIS militants, CNN reported. 

Sotloff speaks to the camera before he is killed, saying he is "paying the price" for U.S. intervention.

His execution comes two weeks after ISIS militants decapitated another American journalist, James Foley. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1plTGfa
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
The Huntington Beach Police Department has a sense of humor about preventing brawls in the city, as a new public service announcement shows.

The tongue-in-cheek PSA, posted on the department's Facebook page, admonishes against violence in the area.

But instead of footage from an actual scuffle in Huntington Beach, a chaotic bar brawl scene from the 1939 movie "Dodge City" is shown.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1tmNlYm

A family's adopted pit bull named "Hades" is being called a hero after rescuing an 8-year-old boy from swarming bees that stung him dozens of times. 

Jesse-Cole Shaver was playing with a group of kids in a steep embankment in Oregon earlier this week when they were swarmed by the bees. The other kids made their way up the hill to escape, but Jesse-Cole couldn't. 

Luckily, Hades saw Jesse-Cole struggling, went to the boy, grabbed him by the leg of his pants and dragged him all the way up the hill to safety. 

"A couple of these kids could have gotten really sick or died, I'm sure of it," his mom told a local TV news station. "I thank my puppyâ€¦ I'm so glad we adopted her."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1lBQL7h
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
An online video game got a little too real for one Colorado player when a SWAT team stormed into his office with guns drawn.

The man was the target of an apparent "swatting" hoax by fellow gamers while live-streaming the incident, authorities said.

Officers and bomb technicians swept the building but didn't find any sign of trouble. No arrests were made.

Not only is swatting a waste of taxpayer money and public safety resources, the Littleton police chief said, it's a prank that carries some dangerous potential.

"This is not an online game. We have real guns, real bullets and there is a potential there for some tragedy," he said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/VWQ1gZ

A man who posed as a cab driver in New York and was allegedly caught on disturbing surveillance video trying to sexually assault a mother in front of her three young kids has been arrested, reports say. 

During the violent struggle, the man in the video elbowed the 5-year-old and threw the 3-year-old from the car before it sped off. 

The two children sustained minor injuries and were treated at a hospital. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1wOABfC

The latest viral video to hit the Internet shows a pregnancy announcement gone comically wrong. 

"What were you thinking?" the boy responds to his mom's exciting bit of news, adding that he finds the situation "exasperating."

As the adorable young boy explains, he already has a little sister and doesn't understand why his mom is having another baby. 

Additionally, he says he'll need his parents to buy him earplugs to deal with the crying newborn. 

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://ktlane.ws/1wJ7pqc

Magic Mountain's iconic Colossus roller coaster has given fans their last ride after 36 years, and now Six Flags has announced plans for a rebirth.

The classic wooden ride will be transformed in a "record-breaking" hybrid coaster dubbed Twisted Colossus. 

Set to open next year, the new ride will offer a four-minute journey over nearly 5,000 feet of track.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/YYLjRw

A brutal beating near the Venice Beach Boardwalk was recorded by a resident who says it's only the latest incident in a string of violence that has recently plagued the neighborhood.

Tim Geoghegan says he posted the video in hopes of alerting authorities and city officials to the ongoing situation in the area.

Police are searching for witnesses who may be able to identify the people in the video. 

"Keep Venice weird, but less stabby," Geoghegan said. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/XUJxRm

Dramatic video caught a surfer being launched into the air Wednesday before crashing down on waves that were as high as 25 feet at the Wedge in Newport Beach.

Thousands have flocked to SoCal beaches to watch huge waves pound the shoreline thanks to Hurricane Marie.

Big swells, high surf and strong rip currents were expected to continue through Friday.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1tJzM2U

Four lifeguards rescuing an injured body surfer appeared to need some help of their own as 25-foot waves came crushing down around them at the famous Wedge in Newport Beach Wednesday. 

The entire rescue effort was viewed on live television while hundreds more watched from shore. 

At one point, the lifeguards and the swimmer can be seen as they are pulled to the top of one of the massive waves. 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1tJzM2U

Compton Unified school police will soon be allowed to keep semiautomatic AR-15 rifles in their cars while on patrol, and the local NAACP chapter is demanding the policy be changed. 

"Compton schools are not located in Beirut, Gaza, or Kabul. They are located in the heart of a hard- working, proud community in Los Angeles County," the Compton NAACP chapter president said. 

The district's Board of Education approved the policy in July and says it's meant to help police save lives.

 "These rifles give us greater flexibility in dealing with a person with bad intent who comes onto any of our campuses," according to one statement. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1qw6xAn
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Surveillance video captured the terrifying moment when an SUV ran over a little boy who was playing with his toys near his home. 

The driver told police he didn't see the child. 

Miraculously, the 6-year-old got up and walked away as if nothing had happened. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rv0KxK

Surveillance video captured the frightening moments when a magnitude-6.0 earthquake struck the Bay Area in the overnight hours on Sunday.  

The quake was centered near Napa, but was widely felt from San Francisco to Sacramento. It left dozens of people injured, and homes and roads in the region damaged. 

The temblor was the largest to hit the area since the Loma Prieta earthquake in 1989. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1sjRSqf

A man suspected of being part of a group of three who posed as deliverymen and tied up adults and kids in two separate home-invasion robberies was arrested following the release of this surveillance video, according to Garden Grove police.  

Jerry  Cleveland Coleman, along with two others, allegedly pretended to deliver flowers and balloons to homes in order to rob them, police say.  

In one of the incidents, three adults and two children were zip tied and shoved into a bathroom. In the other, two teens and a woman opened the door and were confronted by the armed men, according to the Orange County DA's office. 

The two other people in the group are still at large. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1vf38X2

A man who allegedly broke into a woman's home in Santa Ana, stripped naked and fell asleep in the victim's bed was arrested after he left a critical piece of evidence behind: his driver's license. 

Police say Jonathan Phan fled after the woman woke up, saw him and screamed, police say. But he left behind his pants, cellphone and a wallet that contained his ID.

Officers used the driver's license to track the suspect down.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1tbMR5J
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
New Los Angeles Clippers owner Steve Ballmer's signature enthusiasm was truly on display when he greeted fans Monday, shouting at the top of his lungs with a  cracking voice.

"I love basketball â€¦ I love Los Angeles," Ballmer said. "I love this team."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1pFScB8

A California woman was cited by police after she climbed into a zoo exhibit and promptly got kicked in the head by a 2-year-old giraffe named "Wally."

At first, the encounter between 24-year-old Amanda Hall and Wally at the Henry Villas Zoo in Madison, Wisconsin appeared to be peaceful, as the giraffe licked her. 

But things took a violent turn when Wally turned his back and kicked her in the face. 

Hall, who said she climbed in the exhibit because she said she really loves giraffes, was hospitalized and cited on suspicion of harassment of zoo animals. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1t8zIud

status_message:
A 17-year-old will serve a maximum of six years after admitting to voluntary manslaughter charges in the killing of his half brother.

The body of 11-year-old Terry Smith Jr. (right) was discovered in a shallow grave in his backyard last year after a massive four-day search effort.

The teen may be released when he is about 21 years old, when the equivalent of a parole hearing is held, a Riverside County DA spokesman said Friday. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1pk8P54
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Update: A shark sighting off Manhattan Beach was confirmed by county lifeguards on Thursday, when a swimmer appeared to have a very close encounter. 

Aerial video showed four to five animals that resembled sharks in the water. Lifeguards determined that the one 7-foot juvenile shark they saw was not aggressive or a threat.

About a month ago, a swimmer was bitten by a shark in the same area.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1AhrbHG

Half-naked models may soon be delivering underwear and alcohol to your front door. 

Don't get the connection? Two L.A.-based companies have teamed up to offer Sleepover Packs.

Underwear models will bring buyers a fresh pair of underwear, socks, a T-shirt, sunglasses, a hangover-fighting vitamin, and alcohol and mixers.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1razcNX
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Tritobia Ford says her son, Ezell, was lying on the ground and complying with officers' commands when he was fatally shot by police on a South L.A. street.

The shooting occurred after "a struggle ensued" between the 25-year-old and officers, according to the Los Angeles Police Department, and is now under investigation by multiple agencies.

Reaction to the incident has spread on social media under the hashtag #EzellFord. A rally is being organized for Sunday at LAPD headquarters, according to a Facebook invitation.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1AausIT

As the world mourns film icon Robin Williams, his legacy of charity work on behalf of more than 50 organizations and causes is also being recognized. 

In addition to entertaining U.S. troops abroad, one of Williams' most visible fundraising efforts was for St. Jude's Children's Research Hospital. The actor starred in commercials for the hospital for years, including this 2013 spot alongside young cancer patient Darcy. 

Williams never charged St. Jude's a fee.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1syREPS

Donald Sterling is finally out as the owner of the Los Angeles Clippers, nearly four months after recordings were released of his racist rants to his companion V. Stiviano.  

Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer was confirmed Tuesday as the team's new owner.

"Clipper fans are so amazing. They have remained fiercely loyal to our franchise through some extraordinary times," Ballmer said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1Abioaj

status_message:
Twenty-nine-year old Ryan Mitchell Anderson was shot and killed by a Long Beach resident while allegedly burglarizing a house. Now the neighborhood is divided over whether the homeowner used excessive force.

Friends of Anderson say he was intoxicated and had simply entered the wrong house after a night of partying. Supporters of the resident insist the shooting was justified.

No charges have been filed in connection with the incident.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rfCwCJ

BREAKING: Oscar winner and comedy icon Robin Williams has died at his Bay Area home in a suspected suicide, authorities and representatives for the actor confirmed Monday. He was 63.

"This morning, I lost my husband and my best friend, while the world lost one of its most beloved artists and beautiful human beings," said Williams' wife, Susan Schneider. "I am utterly heartbroken." 

Williams had been battling severe depression, a spokesman said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1r5YMDQ

status_message:
Organizers want to set up a giant slip 'n' slide in downtown L.A. next month. But more than 1,700 petitioners say the plan is "irresponsible," given California's current drought conditions.

The author of the online petition is hoping to get 5,000 signatures by Sept. 27, when the vinyl water slide is scheduled to be set up on Olive Street.

Do you think it's a good idea? 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1supOnX

A Lake Forest piano teacher suspected of taking lewd photographs of at least two elementary school-age students has been arrested, according to the Orange County Sheriff's Department.   

John Mordecai Scott, 58, allegedly took the pictures at his home, where he also teaches piano. The photos purported to show the young girls naked and in compromising positions, a sheriff's official said. 

Authorities believe there may be more victims. Scott, who was arrested on suspicion of lewd and lascivious conduct with a child, also taught at music schools in Mission Viejo and Rancho Santa Margarita and had numerous students. 

"Share" this post to alert others.  

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1lNIBTN

status_message:
An adventurous Minnesota couple took the plunge in a rather unusual way: underwater and surrounded by sharks. 

Video captured the wedding of Rongini Mukherjee and Steve Strohbeen, who decided to get married at the Sea Life Aquarium after taking scuba diving lessons together. 

In addition to the sharks, dozens of invited guests were able to witness the nuptials from the dry comfort of a tunnel beneath the 500,000 gallon tank. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1uB4DPb

An 83-year-old Glendale woman says she was groped by a teen who was among a group of boys that stopped to ask her for directions.

Police are searching for the teenagers, who may face felony elder abuse charges if apprehended, officials said.

A law-enforcement official described the incident as "very callous, very stupid. I probably could use a few other words, because we all have mothers and we all have grandmothers." 

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/V9DxBX

Passengers at a train station in Australia banded together to rescue a man who had become trapped between a railcar and the platform.

Surveillance video shows about 50 commuters lining up along the side of the train, and after two collective pushes, the man was able to free his left leg.

A witness said the uninjured commuter was a little embarrassed, "because right where he fell was the 'mind the gap' writing."

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1kHkbAw

The frightening ordeal of an elderly couple whose vehicle was forced off of a Nevada highway after a flash flood, leaving the pair trapped as another car raced toward them, was captured on this dramatic video. 

Luckily for the couple, a group of fearless airmen happened to be in the area and sprang into action when they saw the couple in trouble. But after rescuing the pair from the waist-deep waters, one of the airmen got pulled into the waters and had to be rescued himself. 

The airmen said they didn't think of themselves as heroes.  "I don't think hero. I feel most people would do the same thing," Christopher Jones told KTNV.

The 81-year-old woman said she was just happy she and her husband made it out alive and were OK. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/V0qbYG

He's not even in kindergarten yet, but this precocious 5-year-old Pennsylvania boy is "apparently" already an Internet star.  

In a video that went viral, Noah Ritter responds to a local TV news reporter's question about a ride at the local county fair by enthusiastically taking the mic and beginning his own kind of report, frequently using the word "apparently."

In a followup interview, he acknowledged his overuse of the word. "It was great but apparently I was, like, so embarrassed," Noah told WNEP. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1ASH5tf

Update: A disorderly driver repeatedly punched an LAPD motor officer during a traffic stop, leaving the officer injured, according to police.

Witnesses heard the man say "I'm going to kill you" before punching the officer, police said. The ensuing sidewalk scuffle was caught on video by a witness.

The officer was hospitalized, and the motorist was in custody.

See the full video and read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1sbLBNy

A ferris wheel ride took an unexpected turn when a power outage left the Santa Monica Pier in the dark.

A KTLA viewer captured the unnerving moment on video on Sunday, when the hourslong outage left about 4,700 customers without electricity.

No injuries were reported.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1p3LBQI

BREAKING: A mother and her two children were in grave condition after she attempted to rescue them from the deep end of a motel pool in the Hollywood area.

The three victims showed no signs of breathing or pulses when they were pulled out of the pool by a good Samaritan, the Los Angeles Fire Department said.

All three were transported to hospitals, officials said, and the LAFD was "offering emotional support" to a man and two other children at the scene.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1p5THZb

status_message:
You've probably burned charcoal briquettes or natural gas for your backyard barbecue. How about a bed of molten lava?

That's what London food designer Sam Bompas used as a heat source to grill steaks and corn.

The innovative foodie pulled off the extreme barbecuing stunt after teaming up with a Syracuse University sculpture professor.

"You get a thick char on the outside which, frankly, tastes delicious," Bompas said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/XwGgHp

An innocent homeowner was mistakenly shot and killed by a deputy involved in a standoff with a parolee in Pico Rivera, the L.A. County Sheriff's Department admitted late Saturday. 

Frank Mendoza, 54, was just trying to escape his own house after the suspect broke in and took his wife hostage late Friday afternoon. 

However, mistaking Mendoza -- pictured right -- for the suspect, a deputy open fired as he tried to reach safety. Preliminary evidence indicated that he was "likely" hit twice, a Sheriff's Department's official said. 

The suspect, identified as 24-year-old Cedric Ramirez, was fatally shot hours after the hostage situation began, and Lorraine Mendoza, pictured left, was rescued. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1pOQWYv
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
Is it an African lion, a large dog, or perhaps some kind of illegal pet? 

This grainy surveillance video captured a mystery creature roaming a residential street in densely populated Norwalk earlier this week, but its appearance has residents and even city officials baffled over what type of animal it is exactly.  

"I've looked at the video a few times, and it kind of looks maybe like a dog, maybe likeâ€¦an illegal pet," Norwalk Mayor Marcel Rodarte said on Friday. "We just don't know at this point still." 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1oXvhkt

"I started making noises at them, screaming at them, yelling at them â€” nothing. They would not respond. They stood their ground," says a Burbank resident who was terrorized by a pack of coyotes. "I started backing up and they started advancing."

The man's surveillance camera caught the animals roaming in a large pack through his densely populated residential neighborhood.

Now police are warning foothill residents that drought is pushing coyotes into neighborhoods.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1u5UKZz

California's already bad drought got much worse in the last week, as this dramatic graphic shows.

At the same time, new mandatory statewide water-use restrictions just went into effect. Anyone caught wasting water outdoors could face a $500 per day fine.

Get details on the restrictions from KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rNzbeR

Two days before the upper falls area in Eaton Canyon was set to be shut down for safety reasons, a hiker was injured after falling nearly 50 feet down the side of a cliff.

Cellphone video taken on Wednesday showed a woman attempting to scale down an embankment when she lost her footing.

Bystanders could be heard screaming as the woman slid down the steep hillside before her leg got caught in a tree branch that stopped her fall.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1m1Zvhp

The Nell and John Wooden Court in Pauley Pavilion is showing signs of "buckling" following Tuesday's water main break that sent millions of gallons of water toward the UCLA campus. 

At one point, the court was covered with 8 to 10 inches of water. "Whether we'll be able to save that court, I don't know," a school official said. 

Kareen Wynter will have a live report during the KTLA 5 News at 1. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1pqMnGw

"I'm just kind of scared to be honest," a 14-year-old girl hiding inside a bedroom closet told a 911 dispatcher on Monday. 

Two male juveniles, who investigators believe are connected to other burglaries in the area, were attempting to enter her Orange County home when she decided to make the call.

Police responded quickly and were able to arrest the potential burglars. 

"She's a great example ofâ€¦staying calm, remaining on the phone with the 911 dispatcher," Lt. Jeff Hallock with the Sheriff's Department said.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1qd2SET

The CHP officer captured in a violent encounter with a woman on the 10 Freeway on this dramatic cellphone video was finally identified in a recently revised version of a civil rights lawsuit. 

Officer Daniel L. Andrew, who is accused of beating up Marlene Pinnock before arresting the 51-year-old homeless woman on July 1, falsified reports of the incident and said she called him the devil, the lawsuit alleges. 

Pinnock also claims Andrew ripped her dress, displaying her naked butt to the slow-moving traffic as he straddled and punched her, according to the lawsuit. 

The CHP has not confirmed the officer's identity. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1tQGVhi

Dramatic raw footage of a car driving through a crowd of screaming people participating in a "zombie walk" near Comic-Con was released Sunday. 

A 64-year-old woman was hospitalized after suffering a serious arm injury, and the deaf driver's car windshield was shattered. 

Some onlookers said they tried to stop the impatient driver, while police said the man was trying to get away from the angry crowd. 

No charges have been filed and an investigation is underway. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rITlKg

Investigators are searching for more victims after arresting this Cypress man. Michael Theodore Mordaunt is suspected of targeting children between 12 and 16 years old by creating multiple Myspace and Facebook accounts between 2009 and 2014 and pretending to be a teen surfer. 

"Mordaunt is accused of having sexually explicit conversations or attempting to meet with the victims," according to a DA statement. "The defendant is accused of requesting and receiving sexually explicit pictures from several victims."

"Share" this post to alert others.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1o3k8cK

A passenger captured dramatic footage of SWAT officers storming a plane in Toronto after a man on board allegedly said he wanted to bomb Canada.

The Boeing 737, which was high above West Virginia when the "direct threat" was made, was escorted back to Pearson International Airport by two U.S. fighter jets, a NORAD spokeswoman said.

Ali Shai, 25, was arrested and is now facing multiple charges.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/UBPUqd

Another video has surfaced of an officer using physical force on a person who some say didn't appear to be resisting arrest.

Surveillance video shows a burglary suspect lying face-down on the ground before Santa Ana police officers put something on the man's hands then hit him with their fists and a baton on June 20.

The department said Friday that the use of force was documented in police reports and is being investigated. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1zeou9f

A local school official has been arrested on suspicion of sexually assaulting a sleeping man, and community leaders are asking for his resignation. 

Skyy Fisher allegedly performed oral sex on a male friend as he slept in the San Diego hotel room the pair shared in April, the L.A. Times reported on Friday. 

Fisher, who is out on bail, has been a controversial figure on the Compton Unified School Board of Trustees since he was elected in 2011. He was also arrested on suspicion of DUI last year. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1qEyB6U

status_message:
An arrest warrant has been issued for a California man with tuberculosis who has refused treatment and may be contagious. 

The case has gained urgency because Eduardo Rosas Cruz hails from a part of Mexico known for a drug-resistant strain of tuberculosis. 

Cruz, who was described as a transient, failed to show up at a Stockton motel room where he was supposed to take medication for the disease. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1l18uPQ

status_message:
An armed carjacker was taken into custody in Colorado after a wild crime that was captured by aerial footage, authorities said.

The unidentified man is accused of stealing multiple vehicles â€” and attempting to steal a snow plow â€” while armed with a long rifle.

After smashing through a garage door at a victim's home, a sheriff's deputy wrestled him to the ground on a nearby freeway and made the arrest.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1qCuS9T

Someone is killing peacocks in the Palos Verdes area. Since 2012, 52 of the animals have been found dead or injured in the area. 

In the latest instance, a witness reported seeing a man in a silver four-door Mercedes-Benz fire a pellet gun at a peacock that was standing in a driveway on Eastvale Road on July 9. The peacock collapsed and died from his injuries.

The man was described as white, 50 to 60 years old, wearing a white shirt and "Aviator" style sunglasses.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rIARqO

status_message:
A reserve officer with the Santa Paula Police Department claims hateful statements she made against bicyclists in a Friday YouTube video were satirical. 

"How much would I have to pay you to run one of these over?" Laura Weintraub can be heard asking a man driving her. He responded, "How much do you have in your wallet right now?"

The video ended with a still shot of a car smashing into a group of cyclists, captioned "Like you've never thought of it."

Weintraub has resigned.   

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1n1xDyi

A hot-air balloon drifted into multiple power lines in a Massachusetts neighborhood, causing two massive explosions.

Five people were injured in the the incident, which was captured on video by several witnesses.

The crash caused a brief power outage in the area. An investigation into the cause is underway.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/Woncus

A 24-year-old Los Angeles man was one of the Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza this weekend.

Max Steinberg was a Woodland Hills native and graduate of El Camino Real High School. He voluntarily joined the Israel Defense Forces in 2012 and served as a sharpshooter, according to his Facebook page.

Tonight on the KTLA 5 News at 9 p.m., Kacey Montoya will have a full report on the Gaza-Israel crisis, a pro-Palestinian rally in Westwood and a memorial gathering for Steinberg in Canoga Park.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1jQdmMd

status_message:
Exactly 45 years ago today, Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the moon, making "one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind." 

To commemorate the historic event, NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration will broadcast the Apollo 11 moon landing at 7:39 p.m. PT, the time Armstrong opened up the Eagle hatch on July 20, 1969. 

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://ktlane.ws/UjgPaq

After a 54-year-old driver was pulled over for DUI on a freeway in Ohio, he got out of his car and walked casually into the path of oncoming traffic.

Video of the incident, captured by a police vehicle's dashcam, shows Officer Matt Beck pulling 350-pound Richard Solis to safety after the motorist fell to the ground.

Solis was later convicted of driving under the influence.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1nWGqS7

Dozens of nude photos of Santa Clarita Valley high school students began showing up on a Twitter account called "The Scv Purge" this week.

The account holder who allegedly uploaded the pics and encouraged followers to "expose anyone you know" even threatened to release the names of the teens before the account was shut down. 

Sheriff's officials in Santa Clarita said whoever was responsible could face felony charges.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1wEFvXh

status_message:
A 51-year-old homeless woman who was seen on video being repeatedly punched by a CHP officer had filed a civil rights lawsuit against him and the head of the California Highway Patrol.

The level of force used against Marlene Pinnock in the July 1 beating on the 10 Freeway in Los Angeles was a violation of her constitutional rights, her attorney says.

"I just need and want justice for my mom. This shouldn't have happened to her," Pinnock's daughter said. "I don't want it to happen to anyone else."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1r79NSC

After Nathen Steffel's 6-week-old daughter Sophia died of a rare liver tumor, he made a simple request on Reddit:

"She was in the hospital her whole life and we were never able to get a photo without all her tubes. Can someone remove the tubes?"

He was hoping to get at least one good image. So far, he's received more than 100 photos, drawings and paintings.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1kxeDD8
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message:
A recording went viral Tuesday of a desperate Comcast sales representative trying to talk a customer out of cancelling his service.

The cable company has since apologized to Ryan Block, the customer, for the employees persistence, but  Block remains critical. 

"I hope the quick action you take is a thorough evaluation of your culture and policies, and not the termination of the rep," Block tweeted.

Read KTLA's story and hear the full recording: http://ktlane.ws/1p97iw9

When a group of good Samaritans heard the cries of a mom and her child inside a vehicle that had allegedly been carjacked in broad daylight in San Diego, they sprang into action, and the whole thing was caught on video. 

The bystanders grabbed the man from the driver's seat and dragged him outside, where they eventually forced him to the ground, the YouTube video showed. They held him there until police arrived. 

"Police aren't always around to catch people. It's great the community would jump in," said Aaron Leaf, who shot the video. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1sYydNx

A quick-thinking police officer in Cypress narrowly avoided running over a woman who collapsed in the street right in front of his patrol car.

Officer Juan Robles was rushing the scene of a DUI when he turned a corner and saw the woman directly in his path.

The heart-stopping close call was captured on the car's dash-cam.

Two days after hitting hit his head on a 405 Freeway overpass while on a double-decker "party bus," 16-year-old Mason Zisette died, according to authorities.

A 9-year-old girl has died after becoming infected with a "brain-eating amoeba" while swimming over the Fourth of July weekend in Kansas.

The rare Naegleria fowleri amoeba is found in warm freshwater lakes and typically enters the body through the nose while the person is swimming underwater or diving and travels to the brain.

"Hally knew no stranger and lived life to the fullest, enjoying waterskiing, water sports of any kind," her family said.

Joseph Sanchez went cliff jumping off Inspiration Point in Rancho Palos Verdesâ€”something he did every week--on Wednesday afternoon, and hasn't been seen since.

Sanchez's friend said he tried to rescue the 18-year-old after he was knocked into the rocks by high surf and swept into a cave, but, after jumping in, quickly became overwhelmed by the dangerous waves.

Update: Public access to the beautiful but treacherous area, where more than 50 rescues have taken place in 10 days, was restricted on Thursday, the Fire Department announced.

A 2-year-old amputee could be heard saying "I got it" repeatedly as he learned to walk in a video posted by his mother on Independence Day.

Ben Carlson, 32, had been a lifeguard for 15 years, the chief of the Newport Beach Fire Department said.

Twenty-five people entered the water to help find the lifeguard after he and the swimmer were struck by a large wave. Carlson was located about 8 p.m. and transported to a nearby hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

The shark swam away only after Robles pried its mouth open with his hand, he said.

Louis Zamperini, the former Olympic distance runner and World War II hero who had recently been named the grand marshal of the 2015 Rose Parade, has died at the age of 97. 

Zamperini 's incredible story of survival, which included floating at sea for weeks after his plane crashed in the Pacific Ocean during the war and then being held as a prisoner of war in Japan, was detailed in the best-selling book "Unbroken." A film version is set to be released in December. 

"His indomitable courage and fighting spirit were never more apparent than in these last days," family members said in a statement on Thursday.

A 78-year-old great-grandfather had stopped to get gas on his way to work in San Bernardino early one late-June morning when he was violently attacked by two armed men who emptied his pockets as he lay unconscious.  

John Faust spent four days in the hospital for a broken nose, concussion and bleeding on the brain, and police are hoping newly released surveillance video can help them catch whoever did this to him. 

"It's the lowest of low," said Lt. Rich Lawhead of the San Bernardino Police Department. "They didn't appear to be nervous in any way, shape or form. And they're only going to get more and more brazen. Eventually, somebody's going to get killed."

Albuquerque police shot a homeless man in the back and killed him, and it was all caught in gruesome detail on a police video.

James Boyd, a mentally disturbed man, was holding two small camping knives. Officers negotiated with him for five hours, eventually winning agreement from Boyd to leave the makeshift -- and illegal -- campsite.

Cooper was only 22 months old when he died in the backseat of his father's sweltering SUV after being left strapped to his car seat for 7 hours.

It wasn't until the Georgia father got back in his SUV to go home that he realized Cooper was still there. By that time, it was too late.

Harris has been charged with felony murder in Cooper's death.

A selfie video taken by a woman having a stroke is being credited with saving her life.

Stacey Yepes was having her third stroke in three days. She had been dismissed two days earlier by ER doctors in Toronto, who claimed her symptoms were stress-related. So,Yepes decided to videotape the next attack.

After seeing the video, doctors finally diagnosed her with transient ischemic attacks, or "mini-strokes," due to plaque buildup in her arteries.

Stunned parents watched helplessly as a "bounce house" with two children inside was picked up by a gust of wind and blown 300 feet.

Bean Bean was hit in the head and died from blunt force trauma.

Some witnesses claim he may have passed out, a student says he wasn't moving during the crash and preliminary evidence show no signs that he tried to stop. 

"I don't see any skid marks, It looks like he went straight into the tree," CHP said.

Three were critically injured and remained in the hospital Friday.

Many people fear the "Big One" is coming, but the 5.1-magnitude quake in La Habra is a reminder that the next catastrophic disaster could come from a lesser known fault. 

A major quake on the Puente Hills fault could kill nearly double, or even 10 times the number of people than the "Big One" - a magnitude 8 quake on the San Andreas fault.  

That's because of its location. The Puente Hills fault runs under the skyscrapers of downtown LA, through the San Gabriel Valley and Orange County, making smaller quakes potentially far more dangerous. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1fbnURD
link_name: Timeline Photos

A 10-year-old local girl who traveled to the Vatican to ask Pope Francis to intercede on her father's behalf got her wish Saturday as she and her dad were finally reunited. 

Cameras captured the emotional moment when Jersey Vargas was finally able to hug her father, an undocumented immigrant who had been detained the past six months for driving without a driver's license, after he was released. 

"It was the best thing ever," the young girl said through tears. "I didn't celebrate my birthday because my dad wasn't with me. I've been waiting for him." 

Watch the full video here: http://ktlane.ws/1lfgeiO

Customers at a Farrell's Ice Cream Parlour in Brea reacted as a 5.1 earthquake struck Southern California on Friday night.

The 5.1 earthquake that struck Southern California Friday night is being blamed for a number of damages in the area, and was responsible for triggering a rock slide that caused a car to overturn in Orange County, authorities said. 

Dozens of aftershocks have been felt in the aftermath of the quake. Seismologists say there is a 5 percent chance that the 5.1 event could be a foreshock to a larger earthquake. 

Were there any damages in your area as a result of the earthquake?

Next time you're burning with anger, stuck in SoCal traffic, consider this case of road-rage "instant karma." 

After tailgating another motorist and then making an obscene gesture at her, a pickup truck driver in Florida spun out and crashed seconds later. And it was all caught on cellphone video that has gone viral.

The truck driver was reportedly not injured. He fled the scene and was later arrested.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1rMvwze

A DreamWorks animator from Northridge transformed his 3-year-old son into an action hero in a series of incredible videos.

Update: Bruno's surgery on Friday was a pronounced a success and the Anaheim police K-9 was getting stronger after being shot in the face last week.

The German shepherd had his breathing tube removed and no longer needed to be on IV fluids as of Friday.

Authorities in Santa Monica have captured an escapee who has a reputation for squealing.

Officers and park rangers responded to a call regarding a loose pig, later identified as Sophie, after several residents saw the animal "roaming" around the neighborhood, the Santa Monica Police Department said on Facebook.

"After a short foot pursuit the pig was taken into custody without incident and safely transported to the Santa Monica Animal Shelter," the post said.

Natasha Huestis had very sad news to share: The rescuers had just found the body of her 4-month-old daughter, Sanoah, in the Washington state mudslide.

Earlier this week, rescuers had found the remains of Sanoah's grandmother -- and Huestis' mother -- Christina Jefferds, 45.

The pair had been 10 feet away from each other.

They were together until the end, and for that, Natasha Huestis is grateful.

"It's an absolute relief," Huestis, 26, told the Los Angeles Times. "Now we can move on to the next part."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1h1pjGF

There's a new power couple in town: Hubert and Kalisa. The Los Angeles Zoo and Botanical Gardens is welcoming the two newly arrived African lions.

Both 15 years old, Hubert and Kalisa are a bonded pair. Their arrival in L.A. marks the return of lions to the Griffith Park institution.

The sound of leonine roars is expected to be heard throughout the park again soon.

"Scandal" star Columbus Short has found himself in a real-life scandal when he was arrested for committing felony battery.

This comes just a month after Short pled not guilty to misdemeanor spousal battery.

"Mya was the most loving little girl. So sweet and loved to cuddle," wrote a relative of this 4-year-old girl, who was pronounced dead after being rushed to an L.A. hospital.

Now Mya Migneault's babysitter, Vanessa Denise Hawkins Scott, 53, has been charged with murder, assault and child abuse.

An ordinary school fire drill turned into a surprise marriage proposal when an Ohio firefighter got down on one knee before his girlfriend, a counselor on campus.

Justin Deierling met Megan Zahorec at his fire station when they both volunteered during a kids walk-a-thon. He immediately knew she was someone special, he said.

Deierling popped the question in front of students, then handed the kids ring pops after she said "yes."

Watch KTLA's full video here: http://ktlane.ws/1gr2GQC

Update: Cameras caught the emotional reunion between a wrongfully convicted 74-year-old grandmother who spent 32 years in prison and her family and friends following her release. 

Mary Virginia Jones was freed late Monday in Lynwood after her conviction in a 1981 murder was set aside. 

"Words cannot express my gratitude to God and to my fellow man," Jones said upon her release.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1ruibeZ

Correction: This post earlier stated that Jones was convicted in a 1981 double murder; one of the two people shot in the crime survived.

Update: An L.A. courtroom erupted in cries of joy Monday when a judge announced that a 74-year-old grandmother would be released from prison after serving 32 years for a murder she did not commit.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/OSJrV6

In 1981, Jones' abusive boyfriend kidnapped two drug dealers and then forced Jones - at gunpoint - to drive them into an alley, where the boyfriend fatally shot the one of the men.

Jones ran from the scene, expecting to be killed too. Instead, the teacher's aide and churchgoer with no criminal record was charged with and convicted for two counts of murder and other crimes.

Now, thanks to the help of USC law school students, her charges were reduced to manslaughter and she was set to be freed.

Correction: This post earlier stated that Jones was convicted in two murders; one of the two people shot in the crime survived.

Several days after being shot in the face while on duty, Bruno, an Anaheim police K-9 who has captured hearts, has improved by "leaps and bounds."

Video released Sunday shows Bruno sitting up and eating for the first time since surgery. He has since received blood from two of his fellow K-9 officers.

A test drive went very wrong on a residential street in Anaheim when a GMC Yukon erupted in flames.

Jeff Bauman, who lost both legs in the Boston Marathon attack, is engaged to the woman he was waiting for at the finish line.

The 28-year-old is also expecting a child this summer with fiancee Erin Hurley, 27, according to an announcement on his Facebook page, Jeff Bauman -- Boston Strong, True Patriot and Hero.

He is credited with helping investigators identify the suspects in the April 2013 bombing.

When a would-be kidnapper punched a nanny and ran off with 4-year-old boy in her care last month, witness Jesus Delgado leapt into action to stop the man.

A toddler who fell from a third-story window narrowly missed hitting the street below, thanks to a quick-thinking couple who happened to be moving that day.

They positioned the mattress under the window and used it to help break the boy's fall. The toddler was OK.

When 8-year-old Jet Feirn wrote to his sports idol Shaun White, he pointed out two things that he and the Olympic-gold winner have in common: they both love snowboarding, and both were born with a congenital heart defect.

"Just like you, I have heart surgery, too," Jet wrote. He added: "Please write me back."

White's response included an autographed snowboard, goggles, a backpack and a helmet.

The mayors of Boston and New York City, along with the Samuel Adams and Heineken beer companies, decided not to support St. Patrick's Day parades in the respective cities because gay and lesbian groups aren't allowed to march openly.

LGBT groups haven't been allowed to participate in the Boston parade, which is run by the Allied War Veterans Council, in an exclusion previously ruled constitutional by the U.S. Supreme Court.

With a shattered leg and in excruciating pain, a young surfer too weak to make it back to shore needed a miracle. 

That's when James Severini charged into the water fully dressed, scooped up 14-year-old James Hodges Jr. and carried him to the lifeguard tower. 

"He is a guardian angel," said the James' mother during a tearful reunion between the boy and his hero. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1ewtMkP

An already wild pursuit took a dramatic turn when a man yanked a female driver out of her car, got in and sped off, leaving the terrified woman behind.

That was the third vehicle that the Colorado carjacking suspect drove during a nearly two-hour pursuit that began when he allegedly took off in an SUV with a 4-year-old boy inside. The boy was later found safe. 

The pursuit ended when the alleged carjacker collided with oncoming traffic.  

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1cRoGoc

In an rare sighting, a mountain lion was caught on surveillance video calmly strolling through neighborhood streets in the densely populated Hollywood Hills.

"This is her last chance," said the father of a 2-year-old Pasadena girl in desperate need of a bone marrow transplant.

Sofia Flores' story first came to light when she was diagnosed with an aggressive form of leukemia last year. Now, Sophia's mother says she has only months to live if she cannot find a match. 

For information on how you could become a donor read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1fpQT4H

"Share" this post to let others know.

"He's trying to attack us," an Oregon man told a 911 operator. "He's very, very, very, very hostile."

"He" was Lux, a 22-pound cat that belonged to the man's family and was terrorizing them prior to the 911 call Sunday. 

The man told the dispatcher the cat "went over the edge" and was charging at them every time they opened the door to the bedroom they were hiding in to escape the cat. The family hid after the cat attacked a baby and became crazed.  

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/NWEmeu

She was only a few hours old when she was left in the bathroom of a Burger King in Pennsylvania, now 27-years later Katheryn Deprill is using Facebook to try to find her birth mother.

Instead of feeling angry or resentful, Deprill says she wants to give her mother a hug for not throwing her away.

"She did such a wonderful thing for me and left me in a warm, dry place. I would like to thank her because now I have three beautiful children and I had a wonderful life growing up."

"Share" this post to help spread the word.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1glTw3m

Gabriel Campos Martinez, pictured, was arrested Friday in Texas on suspicion of murder in the death of Hervey Medellin. Martinez, 38, was described as the "former roommate" of Medellin, who was 66.

BREAKING: An airliner carrying 239 people has vanished without a trace, according to Malaysia Airlines officials.

The Boeing 777-200 was flying from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing when air traffic control lost contact with the jet. "We tried to call this aircraft through various means," an airline spokesman said. 

By now, the airline says the jet would have run out of fuel.

This 19-year-old returned from college in Seattle with plans to kill his whole family in their upscale Orange County home, authorities say.

Ashton Colby Sachs allegedly shot his parents to death as they slept in San Juan Capistrano, then fired on his 8-year-old brother, leaving him paralyzed.

A 17-year-old sister, who was also shot at, survived uninjured. Sachs was charged Friday with murder and attempted murder.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1cIS36n

A love letter mailed 70 years ago from a serviceman in Palm Springs to a woman in Dallas may finally be delivered.

The letter, yellowed with age and dated May 26, 1945, was recently found unopened inside a book purchased by Sheila Polk at a thrift store in Florida.

After learning that both Sgt. Albert C. Alm, Jr. and the letter's intended recipient Pfc. Helen Rothurmel had passed away, Polk decided to open the letter. She says it was written on stationery embossed with the phrase "Don't sit under the apple tree with anyone else but me."

Polk is hoping to finally deliver the letter to family members.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/NZLupS

Hundreds of first responders from across the U.S. converged on Burrillville, R.I., to help a cancer patient celebrate his 7th birthday.

Other agencies, including the Los Angeles Police Department, sent gifts and video greetings to Tyler Seddon, who is battling leukemia.

"You stay in the fight, little brother. You're going to do great," LAPD Chief Charlie Beck said in a video that included SWAT, mounted patrol and air-unit officers.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/NYlefy

BREAKING: The mother of two young boys who were found wandering alone near a South L.A. liquor store has been arrested. 

Sidnicka Wilson, 32, was found with an unidentified man inside a vehicle in a store parking lot. The mother of eight was booked on suspicion of child abuse. 

The boys, ages 2 and 3, had been to the liquor store twice about a week before they were found. 

Police say the older boy knew to go to the store to get bread when the children became hungry.

A picture of a 6-month-old girl with a rifle resting across her lap has ignited a firestorm of controversy after it was posted on Facebook.

The girl's dad was handling the rifle at a Connecticut gun store when he noted how light it was and laid it across his daughter's carrier. 

"She grabbed the rifle and put on a big smile," store owner Mike Majewski said. "[The father] thought it was adorable, so he took a picture."

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1doXmvq

A mother is undergoing a mental health evaluation after driving her three children straight into the Atlantic Ocean Tuesday. 

A witness to the family's rescue told a local television station he heard one of the children inside screaming that their mom was trying to kill them.

"The two in the back seat was crying, with their arms out saying, 'Our mommy's trying to kill us, please help,'" the witness told the station.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/Nx3o3w

The sight of a 95-year-old veteran cheering on runners in a military charity race in San Jose triggered a spontaneous show of patriotism that captured the nation's attention.

Joe Bell was waving at the runners when suddenly he became the one being honored. One by one, participants ran over to Bell, shaking his hand and thanking him for his service.

The race benefited the Pat Tillman Foundation, set up in honor of the fallen Army Ranger and San Jose native.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1kwcgo9

"That's what you get for being a good person," Ellen DeGeneres told a UC Riverside student after bringing her on stage and giving her the surprise of a lifetime.

Sharon Bustamante found herself on Ellen's show after her younger sister wrote to Ellen explaining how Sharon could not afford a TV after moving to college -- and could no longer watch Ellen's show.

Not only did Sharon get a new TV, but Ellen shocked the college student by handing her the keys to a Mazda SUV. 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1eSnhfX

An injured young bear was rescued after wandering onto the slopes at a ski resort in Lake Tahoe.

The ski run at Heavenly Mountain was temporarily closed while wildlife officials captured the animal, whose March appearance was blamed on drought conditions.

"He should still be in hibernation," an official said.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1dn7Vz4

Two toddlers found wandering alone in a busy intersection in South L.A. were snatched out of the street by a Good Samaritan who happened to be working on his car.  

"They were just two kids alone. Nobody around to take care of them," Luis Rodriguez said. 

Markeisha Hall saw what was happening and came over to help clean up the little boys. Police were still trying to track down the parents. But for now the boys are safe. 

"I thank God we all came to the babies' rescue," Hall said. "This could have been a tragic morning." 

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/NoxXIK

A 12-year-old boy who is going blind will be able to see the world before he loses his sight thanks to an international "bucket list" trip financed in part by generous donors. 

"This year we're going to try and fill his world with as many beautiful images as we can," the mother of Louie Corbett told CNN.

The CEO of a Boston-based software firm has stepped in with a hefty donation and a promise to raise even more to make the trip a reality for Louie.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1hzKWlS

A fallen U.S. airman finally got his due 60 years after his plane crashed and he went missing during the Cold War, thanks to the efforts of his persistent daughter who just wanted a proper memorial for her dad. 

Jill Ellman was only 8 when her father lost his life trying to protect and defend this country. 

"But there had never been anything for my dad. Never a funeral, never a memorial, never a marker," she said. "I felt like he was cheated out of that and I wanted it for him."

On Wednesday, she got her wish, when her father â€” Air Force Capt. Paul Pascal â€” was honored in a military ceremony at Westwood's National Cemetery.

Read KTLA's story here: http://ktlane.ws/1hz20rZ
link_name: Timeline Photos

When Rickey Young heard a radio report about an injured dog that was stranded on a Houston freeway, he immediately rushed to the scene.

Transit camera video shows the skittish yellow Labrador backing away when Young first approached.

The Good Samaritan then had an idea: he ran back to his truck, grabbed a sandwich and used it to coax the dog to safety.

Watch KTLA's video here: http://ktlane.ws/1gLrfVx

Police in Escondido, Calif., chased down a man accused of stealing a jar of donation money from two Girl Scouts.

A news camera was rolling as officers tackled 21-year-old David Betancourt, who attempted to flee when an arrest warrant was served at his home.

The Girl Scouts, sisters Gracie and Zoe Fullerton, had been collecting the funds to send cookies to troops overseas.

Incredible video captured the moment when a huge wave violently crashed through windows of a seaside restaurant in Santa Barbara amid this weekend's massive storm.

Moments later, the wave bursts through the windows, shattering the glass and eliciting screams from diners as it crashed.

A disturbing and graphic video showing a puppy being body slammed and abused led to the arrest of two teens in St. Louis after it was posted on Facebook. 

In the video, a person can be heard laughing as a young man body slams the pet into the front yard. The video also showed the dog being punched, over and over.

Amazingly, the puppy â€“ now named "Honor" â€“ sustained no major injuries. She was in the care of animal control officers and will be put up for adoption.

A tax filer allegedly shot four people because his refund check wasn't processed quickly enough, authorities said.

"It's a miracle," a Mississippi coroner said of a man who was pronounced dead on Wednesday, then later woke up.  

Walter Williams, 87, had already been transported to the morgue and was in an embalming room when the coroner noticed that his legs were moving.

A holiday gathering took a frightening turn for an Indiana family when the deck they were standing on suddenly collapsed.

Prosecutors also showed jurors a grainy black-and-white video, showing a shirtless Kelly Thomas being repeatedly struck.

Thomas can be heard repeatedly apologizing to officers, saying he was "sorry" as they continued to pummel him with their fists and batons

He eventually screams: "Dad, they are killing me."

Read the full story: http://bit.ly/J9ISxb
